= Čech with [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] in 2015 | fullname = Petr Čech<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=2 February 2018 |accessdate=10 February 2018}}</ref> | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1982|5|20|df=y}}<ref>{{Hugman|3284|Petr Cech|accessdate=10 February 2018}}</ref> | birth_place = [[Plzeň]], Czechoslovakia | height = 1.96 m<ref name=PremProfile>{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/players/2651/Petr-Cech/overview |title=Petr Cech: Overview |publisher=Premier League |accessdate=28 September 2018}}</ref> | position = [[Goalkeeper (association football)|Goalkeeper]] | currentclub = [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] | clubnumber = 1 | youthyears1 = [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] | caps4 = 333 | goals4 = 0 | years5 = 2015– | clubs5 = [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] | caps5 = 110 | goals5 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 1997–1998 | nationalteam1 = Czech Republic U15 | nationalcaps1 = 3 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 1998–1999 | nationalteam2 = Czech Republic U16 | nationalcaps2 = 15 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 1999 | nationalteam3 = [[Czech Republic national under-17 football team|Czech Republic U17]] | nationalcaps3 = 3 | nationalgoals3 = 0 | nationalyears4 = 1999–2000 | nationalteam4 = [[Czech Republic national under-18 football team|Czech Republic U18]] | nationalcaps4 = 13 | nationalgoals4 = 0 | nationalyears5 = 2000–2001 | nationalteam5 = Czech Republic U20 | nationalcaps5 = 7 | nationalgoals5 = 0 | club-update = 20:28, 15 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = | nationalyears6 = 2001–2002 | nationalteam6 = [[Czech Republic national under-21 football team|Czech Republic U21]] | nationalcaps6 = 15 | nationalgoals6 = 0 | nationalyears7 = 2002–2016 | nationalteam7 = [[Czech Republic national football team|Czech Republic]] | nationalcaps7 = 124 | nationalgoals7 = 0 }} '''Petr Čech''' ({{IPA-cs|ˈpɛtr̩ ˈtʃɛx|-|Cs-Petr_Cech.ogg}}; born 20 May 1982) is a Czech professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Goalkeeper (association football)|goalkeeper]] for {{English football updater|Arsenal}} club [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]].
Born in [[Plzeň]], Čech began his senior career at [[FK Chmel Blšany|Chmel Blšany]] in 1999, where he played sporadically for two seasons prior to relocating to domestic superpower [[AC Sparta Prague|Sparta Prague]] in 2001. At age 19, Čech became a first team regular, and his single campaign with the club was fruitful, as he registered a league record of not conceding a goal in 903 competitive minutes. This garnered him his first move abroad, when he relocated to France to join [[Ligue 1]] side [[Stade Rennais F.C.|Rennes]] for a fee of €5.5 million (£3.9 million) in 2002.
In France, Čech starred in an under-performing team, and soon moved to Premier League side [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] for a fee of £7 million (€9.8 million) in 2004, which was then a club record transfer for a goalkeeper. During his eleven year stay at the club, Čech registered 486 senior appearances, making him the club's highest overseas appearance maker, and sixth [[List of Chelsea F.C. records and statistics#All-time appearances|all-time]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/300954/analysis|title=Mourinho's mistake|date=26 November 2013|accessdate=4 April 2014|work=BSkyB|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140206152025/http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/300954/analysis|archivedate=6 February 2014}}</ref> He also helped the club win four [[List of English football champions|Premier League titles]], four [[FA Cup]]s, three [[EFL Cup|League Cup]]s, one [[UEFA Europa League]] title, and one [[List of European Cup and UEFA Champions League finals|UEFA Champions League]] title. He also holds the club [[List of Chelsea F.C. records and statistics|all-time]] record for clean sheets, with 220. Čech departed Chelsea in 2015 to join city rivals [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] for a fee of £10 million, where he won another FA Cup and two [[FA Community Shield]]s.
A Czech international, Čech made his debut with the [[Czech Republic national football team|Czech Republic]] in 2002, and is the [[Czech Republic national football team#Most capped Czech Republic players|most capped player]] in the history of the Czech national team, with [[List of footballers with 100 or more caps|124 caps]]. He also represented his country at the [[2006 FIFA World Cup|2006 World Cup]], as well as the [[UEFA Euro 2004|2004]], [[UEFA Euro 2008|2008]], [[UEFA Euro 2012|2012]], and [[UEFA Euro 2016|2016]] [[UEFA European Championship|European Championships]]. He was voted into the Euro 2004 All-Star team after helping the Czechs reach the semi-finals, and also served as the team's [[Captain (association football)|captain]], prior to retiring from international competition in 2016. Čech also holds the record for the most [[Czech Footballer of the Year]] and [[Golden Ball (Czech Republic)|Czech Golden Ball]] wins.
Considered one of the best goalkeepers of all time, Čech holds a number of goalkeeping records, including the [[Premier League records and statistics|Premier League record]] for fewest appearances required to reach 100 [[clean sheet]]s, having done so in 180 appearances, the most number of clean sheets in a season (24), as well as the record for the [[Premier League records and statistics#Goalkeepers|most clean sheets in Premier League history]] (202).<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.premierleague.com/players/2651/Petr-Cech/stats?co=1&se=13|title=Petr Cech Statistics – 2004/05|accessdate=17 December 2017|work=premierleague.com}}</ref><ref name="Paragraph Ten">{{cite web|url=https://www.premierleague.com/history/2004-05|title=2004/05 Season Review|publisher=Premier League|date=n.d.|accessdate=26 February 2019}}</ref> Čech is also the only goalkeeper to have won the [[Premier League Golden Glove]] with two separate clubs, and has won it a joint record four times; in [[2004–05 FA Premier League|2004–05]], [[2009–10 Premier League|2009–10]], [[2013–14 Premier League|2013–14]] and the [[2015–16 Premier League|2015–16]]. He was voted the [[IFFHS World's Best Goalkeeper]] in 2005, received the award of Best Goalkeeper in the [[2004–05 UEFA Champions League|2004–05]], [[2006–07 UEFA Champions League|2006–07]] and [[2007–08 UEFA Champions League|2007–08]] editions of the UEFA Champions League, and went 1,025 minutes without conceding a goal in 2004–05, which was also a Premier League record.
==Club career== ===Early career=== Born in [[Plzeň]], Czechoslovakia, Čech started playing football aged seven for Škoda Plzeň (later known as [[FC Viktoria Plzeň|Viktoria Plzeň]]). In his early days, he played as a [[Forward (association football)#Striker|striker]], although he later moved to the goalkeeper position.<ref name=dmaugust0809>{{cite news | last=Pattenden | first=Mike | date=8 August 2009 | url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/home/moslive/article-1204489/The-greatest-save-life-The-day-Chelseas-Petr-Cech-died.html | title=The greatest save of my life: The day Chelsea's Petr Cech almost died | newspaper=[[The Daily Mail]] | accessdate=1 April 2012 | location=London}}</ref> Čech joined [[Czech First League]] team [[FK Chmel Blšany|Chmel Blšany]] in June 1999<ref name=idnes20010131>{{cite news | last=Štrunc | first=Robert | date=31 January 2001 | url=http://fotbal.idnes.cz/cech-sni-o-barcelone-ale-zamiril-do-sparty-f17-/fotbal.aspx?c=A010131_093352_fotbal_rou | title = Čech sní o Barceloně, ale zamířil do Sparty |language=Czech |work=Mladá fronta DNES |location=Czech Republic |publisher=MAFRA | accessdate=12 March 2012}}</ref> and made his league debut at the age of 17 in October 1999, in a 3–1 loss against Sparta.<ref name=dmaugust0809/><ref name=idnes20010131/>
Čech signed a {{frac|5|1|2}}-year contract with [[AC Sparta Prague|Sparta Prague]] at the age of 18 in January 2001, although he remained at Blšany until the end of [[2000–01 Czech First League|the 2000–01 season]].<ref>{{cite news | date=29 January 2001 | url=http://fotbal.idnes.cz/cech-jde-do-sparty-ktera-preplatila-bremy-fp7-/fotbal.aspx?c=A010129_143341_fotbal_bra | title = Čech jde do Sparty, která přeplatila Brémy |language=Czech |work=Mladá fronta DNES |location=Czech Republic |publisher=MAFRA | accessdate=12 March 2012}}</ref> In November 2001, Čech broke the record formerly held by [[Theodor Reimann]] for the longest time elapsed without conceding a goal in the Czech professional league, stretching his run to 855 minutes.<ref>{{cite news | date = 4 November 2001 | url=http://fotbal.idnes.cz/brankar-cech-si-hlidal-aby-mu-rekord-neutekl-fei-/fotbal.aspx?c=A011104_191941_fotbal_min | title=Brankář Čech si hlídal, aby mu rekord neutekl |language=Czech |work=Mladá fronta DNES |location=Czech Republic |publisher=MAFRA | accessdate=12 March 2012}}</ref> His clean sheet record finally ended when he was beaten by a goal from [[Marcel Melecký]] of [[Bohemians 1905|Bohemians]] on 17 November 2001, ending his record at 903 consecutive minutes without conceding.<ref>{{cite news | last = Švéd | first = Jan | date = 14 July 2003 | url = http://fotbal.idnes.cz/rekordy-cech-nedostal-gol-903-minut-dl5-/fotbal.aspx?c=A030713_231554_fotbal_ruz | title = Rekordy: Čech nedostal gól 903 minut | language = Czech | work = Mladá fronta dnes | location = Czech Republic | publisher = Marfa | accessdate = 12 March 2012 }}</ref>
Despite Čech not winning the league title in the spring of 2002 with Sparta, he attracted interest from English clubs including [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] due to his international performances. Due to difficulties in obtaining a work permit, however, a proposed deal with the ''Gunners'' fell through.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://espnfc.com/news/story/_/id/897742/petr-cech:-i-could-have-been-arsenal's-no.-1?cc=3436|title=Cech: Arsenal rejected me|date=23 March 2011|accessdate=3 April 2014|work=ESPN}}</ref>
===Rennes=== In July 2002, Čech moved to French club [[Stade Rennais F.C.|Rennes]], signing a four-year contract for a transfer fee reported as [[Czech koruna|CZK]]150 million ([[Euro|€]]5.5 million).<ref>{{cite news | last=Novák | first=Jaromír | date=9 July 2002 | url=http://fotbal.idnes.cz/cech-nejde-do-anglie-ale-do-rennes-do9-/fotbal.aspx?c=A020709_124905_fotbal_min | title=Čech nejde do Anglie, ale do Rennes |language=Czech |work=Mladá fronta DNES |location=Czech Republic |publisher=MAFRA | accessdate=12 March 2012}}</ref>
During his [[2002–03 Ligue 1|first season]] in France, he was awarded [[man of the match]] against [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|Paris Saint-Germain]] by ''[[L'Équipe]]''.<ref name=frenchmom>{{cite news | date=22 May 2003 | url=http://fotbal.idnes.cz/cech-je-nejlepsim-golmanem-ve-francii-dsk-/fot_zahranici.aspx?c=A030522_105806_fot_zahranici_min | title=Čech je nejlepším gólmanem ve Francii |language=Czech |work=Mladá fronta DNES |location=Czech Republic |publisher=MAFRA | accessdate=18 March 2012}}</ref> In May 2003, Rennes was at the bottom of the league table,<ref name=frenchmom/> yet escaped relegation with a win over [[Montpellier HSC|Montpellier]] in the final matchday.<ref>{{cite news | date=24 May 2003 | url=http://fotbal.idnes.cz/cech-vychytal-rennes-zachranu-dkb-/fot_zahranici.aspx?c=A030524_230756_fot_zahranici_min | title=Čech vychytal Rennes záchranu |language=Czech |work=Mladá fronta DNES |location=Czech Republic |publisher=MAFRA | accessdate=12 March 2012}}</ref>
===Chelsea=== [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] made a transfer bid for Čech in January 2004 which was rejected.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/c/chelsea/3375791.stm |title=Chelsea Cech bid rejected |work=BBC Sport |accessdate=30 April 2008 | date=7 January 2004}}</ref> However in February Rennes agreed to Čech's move to Chelsea for [[Pound sterling|£]]7 million. Čech signed a five-year contract, to commence in July 2004, becoming the most expensive goalkeeper in Chelsea's history at that time.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/c/chelsea/3411707.stm |title=Chelsea sign Cech |work=BBC Sport | date=9 February 2004 | accessdate=30 April 2008 }}</ref><ref name=magicnumbers>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/c/chelsea/4470059.stm |title=Chelsea's magic numbers |work=BBC Sport |accessdate=30 April 2008 | date=30 April 2005 |first=Dan |last=Warren}}</ref> Čech's was one amongst many British club transfers that came under the spotlight in the [[2006 allegations of corruption in English football|2006 football corruption investigation]] for being potentially in breach of transfer regulations. The Stevens inquiry report, published in June 2007, found no evidence of illegal payments.<ref>{{cite news | title = Drogba deal, Zihavi and five clubs in transfer spotlight | work= espnstar.com| date = 15 June 2007| url =http://espnstar.com/epl/epl_newsdetail_6191049.html|archiveurl =https://web.archive.org/web/20071020210514/http://espnstar.com/epl/epl_newsdetail_6191049.html| archivedate =20 October 2007| accessdate =6 September 2007}}</ref>
====2004–05 season==== When Čech arrived at Chelsea, Carlo Cudicini was established as Chelsea's first choice goalkeeper. Cudicini, however, suffered a pre-season elbow injury that allowed Chelsea manager [[José Mourinho]] to promote Čech into the starting spot, where he became the first-choice goalkeeper in his first season. He kept a [[clean sheet]] in his [[Premier League]] debut in a 1–0 victory over [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]].<ref>{{cite news | title = Cech content with debut |work=Sky Sports | url = http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11668/2308156/Cech-content-with-debut | accessdate =12 June 2013 | date=}}</ref> On 5 March 2005, Čech set a new [[Premier League records and statistics|Premier League record]] of 1,025 minutes without letting in a goal, though his record has since been broken by Manchester United's [[Edwin van der Sar]]. Čech finally conceded to [[Leon McKenzie]] of [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]], after keeping a clean sheet in the league since 12 December 2004 when [[Thierry Henry]] scored for Arsenal.<ref name=magicnumbers/> Čech was given a special award by the Premier League for the new record, and he was also awarded the [[Premier League Golden Glove]] at the end of the [[2004–05 FA Premier League|2004–05 season]] for keeping a record 21 clean sheets in the Premier League.<ref name=ext2008/> The team, having conceded only 15 league goals in the entire season, also set a new record.
====2005–06 season==== Chelsea retained the Premier League title in the [[2005–06 FA Premier League|2005–06 season]], with Čech playing in 34 league matches. Chelsea conceded just 22 times during the season.<ref>{{cite news| title = English Premier League 2005–2006 : Table| work = Statto.com| url = http://www.statto.com/football/stats/england/premier-league/2005-2006| accessdate = 17 August 2010| date = 17 August 2010| deadurl = yes| archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20120817022011/http://www.statto.com/football/stats/england/premier-league/2005-2006| archivedate = 17 August 2012| df = dmy-all}}</ref> In January 2006, he was named the [[International Federation of Football History & Statistics|IFFHS]] World's Best Goalkeeper for 2005.<ref>{{cite news | date=19 January 2006 | url=http://www.radio.cz/en/section/curraffrs/young-czech-football-goalkeeper-petr-cech-named-best-in-world | title=Young Czech football goalkeeper Petr Cech named best in world |work=Czech Radio |location=Czech Republic |last=Willoughby |first=Ian |accessdate=13 March 2012}}</ref> In February 2006, Čech signed a two-year contract extension, keeping him at the club until 2010.<ref name=ext2006>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/2331566/Cech-rewarded-for-Chelsea-record-with-contract-to-2010.html |title=Cech rewarded for Chelsea record with contract to 2010 |date=2 February 2006 |accessdate=13 March 2012 |work=The Telegraph |last=Johnson |first=William }}</ref> He was also named the [[Czech Footballer of the Year]] for the first time.<ref>{{cite news | date=27 February 2006 | url=http://fotbal.idnes.cz/brankar-cech-poprve-fotbalistou-roku-dwg-/fot_reprez.aspx?c=A060227_174522_fot_reprez_mn | title=Brankář Čech poprvé Fotbalistou roku |language=Czech |work=Mladá fronta DNES |location=Czech Republic |publisher=MAFRA | accessdate=15 March 2012}}</ref> [[File:Robbencech.jpg|thumb|250px|Čech and [[Arjen Robben]] celebrate their second Premier League title in 2006.]]
====2006–07 season==== Čech underwent minor shoulder surgery on 27 June 2006 to repair a long-standing injury stemming from the previous season.<ref>{{cite news | title = Keeper Cech has shoulder surgery |work=BBC Sport | url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/c/chelsea/5119818.stm | accessdate =6 September 2007 | date=27 June 2006}}</ref> He returned to action on 27 August 2006.<ref>{{cite news | title = Blackburn 0–2 Chelsea |work=BBC Sport | url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/5266318.stm | accessdate =6 September 2007 | date=27 August 2006 | first=John | last=Sinnott}}</ref>
====Head injury==== Čech sustained a head injury in the match against [[Reading F.C.|Reading]] at the [[Madejski Stadium]] on 14 October 2006 when he collided with Reading midfielder [[Stephen Hunt (footballer, born 1981)|Stephen Hunt]] inside Chelsea's penalty area within the first minute of a Premier League match. Hunt's right knee hit Čech's head, leaving the goalkeeper requiring treatment.<ref name=headinj>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2006/oct/15/match.chelsea |title=Rattled Chelsea get better of Reading after keeper crisis |date=15 October 2006 |accessdate=24 March 2012 |work=The Guardian |location=London |last=Lawrence |first=Amy }}</ref> Čech was taken off after several minutes and replaced by Carlo Cudicini, who himself was knocked unconscious later in the same game, forcing Chelsea captain [[John Terry]] to play in goal for the match's remaining minutes.<ref name=headinj/> Čech underwent surgery for a [[skull fracture|depressed skull fracture]].<ref name="BBC Cech surgery">{{cite news | date=15 October 2006 | url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/c/chelsea/6053244.stm | title=Keeper Cech has surgery on skull |work=BBC Sport | accessdate=16 October 2006}}</ref> Initially unaware of the seriousness of the injury, the doctors later reported that it nearly cost Čech his life,<ref>{{cite news | last=Cross | first=John | date=28 October 2006 | url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/tm_headline=i-ll-be-back&method=full&objectid=18005566&siteid=94762-name_page.html | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071020024939/http://mirror.co.uk/sport/football/tm_headline%3Di-ll-be-back%26method%3Dfull%26objectid%3D18005566%26siteid%3D94762-name_page.html | archivedate=20 October 2007 | title=I'LL BE BACK | newspaper=[[Daily Mirror]] | accessdate=18 March 2012 | deadurl=yes | df=dmy-all }}</ref> and as a result of the collision, he suffered intense headaches.<ref>{{cite news | date=16 October 2006 | url=https://int.soccerway.com/news/2006/October/16/doctors-cech-out-for-rest-of-season | title=Doctors: Cech out for rest of season | work=soccerway.com | accessdate=16 November 2006 | deadurl=yes | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070929103222/http://www.soccerway.com/news/2006/October/16/doctors-cech-out-for-rest-of-season | archivedate=29 September 2007 | df=dmy-all }}</ref>
Chelsea manager José Mourinho blamed Hunt for Čech's injury, saying that his challenge was "a disgrace".<ref>{{cite news | date=14 October 2006 | url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/c/chelsea/6052028.stm | title=Mourinho angry as keepers injured |work=BBC Sport | accessdate=16 October 2006}}</ref> He also criticised the South Central Ambulance Service [[National Health Service (England)|NHS]] Trust<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/reading-and-nhs-failed-cech-claims-mourinho-420484.html |title=Reading and NHS failed Cech, claims Mourinho |date=18 October 2006 |accessdate=18 March 2012 |work=The Independent |last=Wallace |first=Sam }}</ref> and match referee [[Mike Riley (referee)|Mike Riley]].<ref>{{cite news | date=16 October 2006 | url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/pages/live/articles/sport/football.html?in_article_id=410707&in_page_id=1779 | title=Referee Riley: I did not make Cech leave the pitch for treatment | newspaper=[[Daily Mail]] | accessdate=21 October 2006 | location=London}}</ref> A number of commentators, including current and former goalkeepers, saw the incident as highlighting the need for greater protection for goalkeepers.<ref>{{cite news | date=17 October 2006 | url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/6057730.stm | title=Wenger fears for keepers' safety |work=BBC Sport | accessdate=18 October 2006}}</ref><ref>{{cite news | date=19 October 2006 | url=http://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/2006/writers/gabriele_marcotti/10/19/cech.keepers/index.html | title=English head games |work=Sports Illustrated | accessdate=20 October 2006}}</ref>
Čech was able to return home on 24 October 2006 and participated in light training the following week. Chelsea, however, announced that the goalkeeper would be out for three months, in line with medical advice on the time needed for complete recovery from the skull fracture.<ref>{{cite news|date=24 October 2006|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/article.asp?hlid=424212&m=10&y=2006&nav=news&sub=latest+news|title=Cech home and set to train|work=chelseafc.com|accessdate=25 October 2006}}{{dead link|date=September 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}</ref> In an interview, Čech said that he had no memory of the injury itself.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2006/oct/27/newsstory.sport8|title=I don't remember Hunt collision, admits Cech|date=27 October 2006|accessdate=30 September 2014|publisher=The Guardian}}</ref>
====Return==== [[File:Petr Cech.jpg|thumb|left|Čech playing for Chelsea in 2007]] Čech made his comeback in a Premier League match against [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] on 20 January 2007, which Chelsea eventually lost 2–0, wearing a [[scrum cap|rugby style headguard]]<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/eng_prem/6258681.stm |title=Liverpool 2–0 Chelsea |work=BBC Sport |first=Phil |last=McNulty |date= 20 January 2007|accessdate=13 March 2012}}</ref> made by [[Canterbury of New Zealand]] and carrying the manufacturer's logo. This caused friction with Czech national team sponsor [[Puma SE|Puma]] and Chelsea's apparel manufacturer [[Adidas]]. The matter was resolved after the latter sponsor developed its own headgear for Čech to wear in club matches, while the player went on to wear an unbranded cap for national team games.<ref name=sponsor2008>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/chelsea/3701996/Petr-Cech-follows-Zinedine-Zidane-in-sponsorship-deal-Football.html |title=Petr Cech follows Zinedine Zidane in sponsorship deal |date=21 July 2008 |accessdate=13 March 2012 |work=The Daily Telegraph |last=Benammar |first=Emily }}</ref> Even long after his injuries healed completely, Čech has continued to wear the cap to his matches.
Although Chelsea lost Čech's comeback match, he then went approximately 810 minutes of Premier League play without conceding a goal. On 11 April 2007, Čech was awarded the [[Premier League Player of the Month]] for the first time in his career, in recognition of his eight successive league clean sheets. He was the first goalkeeper to receive the award since [[Tim Flowers]] in 2000.<ref>{{cite news|date=16 April 2007 |url=http://www.czech.cz/en/news/sport/petr-cech-named-player-of-the-month/ |title=Petr Cech named player of the month |work=czech.cz |accessdate=6 September 2007 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070927012333/http://www.czech.cz/en/news/sport/petr-cech-named-player-of-the-month/ |archivedate=27 September 2007 |deadurl=yes }}</ref> This run was ended during a 4–1 Chelsea victory over [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] on 18 April 2007 when [[Carlos Tevez]] scored against him.
Čech also kept a clean sheet for Chelsea in the [[2007 FA Cup Final|2007 FA Cup final]] against Manchester United. He and United's Edwin van der Sar shared the honour of being the first goalkeepers to keep a clean sheet over 90 minutes in a competitive fixture at the new [[Wembley Stadium]], but Čech became the first goalkeeper to end a competitive game unbeaten, as Chelsea beat United 1–0 to win the FA Cup.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/fa_cup/6649815.stm |title=Chelsea 1–0 Manchester United |work=BBC Sport |first=Andrew |last=McKenzie |date= 19 May 2007|accessdate=9 November 2008}}</ref>
====2007–08 season==== [[File:Petr Čech.jpg|thumb|right|Čech training for Chelsea in 2008]] Čech started the [[2007–08 Premier League|2007–08 season]] conceding two goals against [[Birmingham City F.C.|Birmingham City]] in the first match of the season. Despite this, Chelsea managed to win 3–2 and set an English record for their 64th consecutive unbeaten league match at home.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report?id=221289&cc=5901&league=ENG.1 |title=Report: Chelsea vs Birmingham – English Premier League |work=ESPNsoccernet |accessdate=9 November 2008}}</ref>
In November 2007, Čech suffered an injury to his right calf muscle in the 0–0 [[2007–08 UEFA Champions League group stage|UEFA Champions League group stage]] match at [[FC Schalke 04|Schalke 04]].<ref name=inj2010>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/teams/c/chelsea/8841884.stm |title=Chelsea keeper Petr Cech may miss Premier League start |work=BBC Sport |date=21 July 2010 |accessdate=13 March 2012}}</ref> The following month, on 23 December 2007, he had to be replaced during a match against [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]] due to a hip injury.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/eng_prem/7145750.stm |title=Blackburn 0–1 Chelsea |work=BBC Sport |date=23 December 2007 |accessdate=13 March 2012}}</ref>
Chelsea suffered its first major blow when it lost the [[2008 Football League Cup Final|League Cup final]] to [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]], with Čech [[parrying]] the ball onto [[Jonathan Woodgate]]'s head for the winner.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report?id=235283&cc=5901 |title=Report: Tottenham vs Chelsea – English Carling Cup |work=ESPNsoccernet |date=24 February 2008 | accessdate = 9 November 2008}}</ref> He played in several games until the eve of Chelsea's home Champions League tie with Greek champions [[Olympiacos F.C.|Olympiacos]] when he injured his ankle in training.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/main.jhtml?xml=/sport/2008/03/06/sfnche206.xml |title=Petr Cech hit by injury setback |date=6 March 2008 |accessdate=13 March 2012 |work=The Telegraph |last=Ley |first=John |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080508205418/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/main.jhtml?xml=%2Fsport%2F2008%2F03%2F06%2Fsfnche206.xml |archivedate=8 May 2008 |deadurl=yes }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,11945_3243941,00.html |title=Cech suffers ankle injury |work=Sky Sports |accessdate=9 November 2008}}</ref> In the weeks that followed, Čech missed key games of Chelsea's campaign, including the [[Arsenal F.C.–Chelsea F.C. rivalry|derby with Arsenal]] and both legs of the Champions League quarter-final.
On 7 April 2008, it was announced that Čech had undergone emergency surgery on his chin and lips following an accidental collision with [[Tal Ben Haim]] during training.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/teams/c/chelsea/7334884.stm |title=Chelsea ready to risk keeper Cech |work=BBC Sport |date=14 April 2008 |accessdate=9 November 2008}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/news/story?id=523722&cc=5901 |title=Cech out for two weeks after fifty stitch operation |work=ESPNsoccernet |accessdate=9 November 2008}}</ref> He had 50 stitches put on his mouth and chin and missed 22 games due to injuries.<ref>{{cite news|title=Goalies find their fate in coaches' hands| author=Rob Hughes|work=International Herald Tribune| url=http://www.iht.com/articles/2008/04/08/sports/SOCCER.1.php| date =8 April 2008| accessdate =8 April 2008}}{{subscription required}}</ref> He returned to action on 14 April, in a home match against [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] which Chelsea drew 1–1. He appeared in the [[2008 UEFA Champions League Final|Champions League final]] against Manchester United, where Chelsea lost in a [[penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalty shootout]].
====2008–09 season==== [[File:Petr Cech training.jpg|thumb|left|250px|Čech before Chelsea's first game of the [[2008–09 Premier League|2008–09]] season against [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]]]] Čech signed a new five-year contract in July 2008 to keep him at Chelsea until 2013.<ref name=ext2008>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/chelsea/2437931/Petr-Cech-signs-five-year-extension-at-Chelsea-with-Michael-Essien-set-to-follow.html |title=Petr Cech signs five-year extension at Chelsea with Michael Essien set to follow |date=21 July 2008 |accessdate=13 March 2012 |work=The Telegraph |last=Wilson |first=Steve }}</ref> Chelsea started the [[2008–09 Chelsea F.C. season|2008–09 season]] in good form, conceding only 7 goals in 17 games and keeping 11 clean sheets, 10 of which with Čech in goal.
In November 2008, Chelsea beat [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] 5–0 at [[Stamford Bridge (stadium)|Stamford Bridge]], a game which marked the 100th match Čech had played for Chelsea without conceding a goal.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2008/nov/09/premier-league-chelsea-blackburn |title=Cech the century maker makes case for defence |date=9 November 2008 |accessdate=1 May 2009 |work=The Guardian |location=London |last=Castles |first=Duncan }}</ref> Chelsea had a 1–0 victory over [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]] in the [[2008–09 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] on his 200th appearance for the club, and he also starred in a 1–0 away victory at [[Villa Park]] against [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]], saving from [[Gabriel Agbonlahor]] and [[Gareth Barry]]. The following week, Čech helped Chelsea move up to second place in the league by saving from [[Paul Scharner]] in the first half against Wigan Athletic at Stamford Bridge, where Chelsea won 2–1. Successive clean sheets by Čech in Chelsea's wins against [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]] and [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] saw his side consolidate their position in the Premier League whilst progressing into the [[2008–09 FA Cup|FA Cup]] semi-finals. Čech also made saves from [[Dirk Kuyt]] and [[Xabi Alonso]] as Chelsea beat Liverpool 3–1 at [[Anfield]] in the first leg of the Champions League quarter-finals.
In a crucial Premier League game in April 2009, with Chelsea comfortably leading 4–0 against [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]], Chelsea manager [[Guus Hiddink]] took off both [[Didier Drogba]] and [[Frank Lampard]] only for Bolton to score three late goals which questioned the Chelsea defence, and in particular Čech. Čech, however, responded when he saved a penalty from [[Mark Noble]] in Chelsea's 1–0 win at the [[Boleyn Ground]] against West Ham.<ref>{{cite news|title=West Ham 0–1 Chelsea |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/8000577.stm|accessdate=14 September 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=25 April 2009}}</ref> He also kept a clean sheet in the next game against [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] during the Champions League semi-final first leg match. Following a 3–2 win against Sunderland at the [[Stadium of Light]], Čech and Chelsea finished the season with the joint-tightest defence in the Premier League along with Manchester United, having conceded just 24 goals over the course of the season.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/table/default.stm |title=Premier League table |date=24 May 2009 |accessdate=24 May 2009 |work=BBC Sport}}</ref> Despite conceding the fastest goal in [[List of FA Cup finals|FA Cup final]] history, Čech helped Chelsea's [[2009 FA Cup Final|2009 FA Cup final]] triumph over [[Everton F.C.|Everton]]. Chelsea won 2–1, earning the Czech his seventh trophy at the club.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/fa_cup/8060989.stm |title=Chelsea 2–1 Everton |date=30 May 2009 |accessdate=31 May 2009 |work=BBC Sport |last=Bevan |first=Chris }}</ref>
Former Chelsea coach [[Luiz Felipe Scolari]] accused Čech, [[Michael Ballack]] and Drogba of causing his sacking, saying that they "did not accept my training methods or my demands". Scolari also said that it stemmed from a row between him and the Czech goalkeeper over the latter's alleged insistence on being given a personal coach. Čech denied the claims saying that he was "disappointed with [Scolari] because never in my life have I had a personal goalkeeping coach".<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2009/jul/06/petr-cech-carlo-ancelotti-chelsea |title=Petr Cech says Carlo Ancelotti is "ideal" man for Chelsea |date=6 July 2009 |accessdate=24 March 2012 |work=The Guardian |location=London}}</ref>
====2009–10 season==== [[File:Petr Čech 4486.jpg|thumb|left|Čech training for Chelsea in 2010]] Čech began the [[2009–10 Chelsea F.C. season|2009–10 season]] in winning form with Chelsea, beating Manchester United in the [[2009 FA Community Shield|Community Shield]] final at Wembley. With the game level at 2–2 at the end of normal time, Čech saved penalties from [[Ryan Giggs]] and [[Patrice Evra]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/8190061.stm |title=Chelsea 2 – 2 Man Utd |date=9 August 2009 |accessdate=19 November 2012 |work=BBC Sport |last=McNulty |first=Phil }}</ref> Čech kept goal for Chelsea in the six-match winning run that opened their season and placed them on top of the [[2009–10 Premier League|Premier League]]. On 26 September 2009, however, Čech was sent off and at the same time conceded the winning penalty for a trip on Wigan forward [[Hugo Rodallega]], in the defeat that broke the run and conceded the lead in the league to Manchester United.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/sport/football/premier_league/chelsea/article6850633.ece|title=Wigan break winning run of mighty Chelsea|date=27 September 2009 | accessdate = 27 September 2009 |work=The Sunday Times |location=UK |last=Castles |first=Duncan }}</ref> On 27 February 2010, Čech sustained a calf injury in the [[2009–10 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] match against [[Inter Milan]].<ref>{{cite news| url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/low/football/teams/c/chelsea/8535619.stm |work=BBC Sport | title=Keeper Cech ruled out for a month | date=25 February 2010 | accessdate=22 May 2010}}</ref> On 13 April, Čech kept his 100th Premier League clean sheet for Chelsea, against Bolton.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/terry-denies-handball-claim-as-chelsea-savour-vital-win-1945082.html |title=Terry denies handball claim as Chelsea savour vital win |date=15 April 2010 |archiveurl =https://web.archive.org/web/20100417155639/http://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/terry-denies-handball-claim-as-chelsea-savour-vital-win-1945082.html| archivedate =17 April 2010|accessdate=13 March 2012 |work=The Independent |last=Wallace |first=Sam }}</ref> He won his second Premier League Golden Glove award for the season, having kept 17 clean sheets in the Premier League as Chelsea secured a third title.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2010/may/15/petr-cech-chelsea-fa-cup-final |title=Success goes hand in glove with redemption for Petr Cech and Chelsea |date=15 May 2010 |accessdate=13 March 2012 |work=The Guardian |location=London |last=Ronay |first=Barney }}</ref> He concluded his season by saving a penalty against Portsmouth in the [[2010 FA Cup Final|FA Cup final]], ensuring that the ''Blues'' went on to retain the Cup and achieve their first domestic [[Double (association football)|double]].
====2010–11 season==== [[File:Petr Cech - Chelsea vs Bolton Wanderers (1).jpg|thumb|right|Čech playing for Chelsea in 2010]] During [[2010-11 Premier League|2010–11 pre-season]] training, Čech reaggravated the calf injury he suffered against Inter the previous season.<ref name=inj2010/> Scans revealed a muscle tear that sidelined him for the next three weeks, including Chelsea's 3–1 loss to Manchester United in the [[2010 FA Community Shield|Community Shield]]. He returned on 14 August and kept a clean sheet as Chelsea beat [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] 6–0. Čech then kept another clean sheet in a 2–0 win over Arsenal,<ref>{{cite news| url=http://forum.talkchelsea.net/topic/8096-chelsea-2-0-arsenal/ | work=Talk Chelsea | title=Chelsea 2–0 Arsenal | date=3 October 2010 | accessdate=17 October 2010}}</ref> before keeping a clean sheet in a 0–0 draw at Villa Park.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://forum.talkchelsea.net/topic/8162-aston-villa-0-0-chelsea// | work=Talk Chelsea | title=Villa 0–0 Chelsea | date=16 October 2010 | accessdate=17 October 2010}}</ref> On 7 March, Čech made his 300th Chelsea appearance, against Premier League side [[Blackpool F.C.|Blackpool]], which Chelsea went on to win 3–1. On 19 May, Čech was awarded the Chelsea Player of the Year for the first time. More than 28,000 fans voted for the award, which was handed over by Chelsea manager [[Carlo Ancelotti]].{{citation needed|date=May 2016}}
====2011–12 season==== Čech started the opening game of Chelsea's [[2011–12 Premier League]] season away to [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]], which ended 0–0. On 18 August 2011, Čech was ruled out for up to four weeks after he sustained a knee injury in training.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/14573557.stm |title=Chelsea's Petr Cech out for up to four weeks with knee injury |work=BBC Sport | date=18 August 2011 | accessdate = 1 September 2011 }}</ref> He made his return three weeks later against Sunderland in which Chelsea won 2–1. He kept a clean sheet in Chelsea's first Champions League match of the season in a 2–0 win over [[Bayer 04 Leverkusen|Bayer Leverkusen]]. On 27 February, Čech was announced as the Czech Footballer of the Year for 2011, winning the award for the fifth time.<ref>{{cite news |last=Novák |first=Miloslav |date=27 February 2012 |url=http://fotbal.idnes.cz/fotbalistou-roku-je-cech-vyrovnal-se-legende-trenerum-kraloval-vrba-1gn-/fot_reprez.aspx?c=A120227_175340_fot_reprez_min |title=Fotbalistou roku je Čech, vyrovnal se legendě. Trenérům kraloval Vrba |language=Czech |work=Mladá fronta DNES |location=Czech Republic |publisher=MAFRA |accessdate=1 April 2012}}</ref> On 24 March, Čech played his 250th league game for Chelsea against Tottenham Hotspur in a 0–0 draw at Stamford Bridge.<ref>{{cite news |last=Rostance |first=Tom |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17412539 |title=Chelsea 0–0 Tottenham |work=BBC Sport |accessdate=24 March 2012 | date=24 March 2012}}</ref> Čech saved a penalty in extra time against former teammate [[Arjen Robben]], and two penalties in the subsequent penalty shootout, of the [[2012 UEFA Champions League Final|2012 Champions League final]] against [[FC Bayern Munich|Bayern Munich]] resulting in the first Champions League win for Chelsea.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2147270/Chelsea-win-Champions-League-Petr-Cech-saves-day.html|title=How it was Cech mate: Blues' No 1 reveals his logic that saved the day in Munich|date=20 May 2012|accessdate=28 May 2012|publisher=Daily Mail}}</ref> Čech was named the Fans' Man of the Match following his heroic performance in goal for ''The Blues''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://en.uclratings.uefa.com/Player/Profile/49029/2007693 |title=UEFA.com – UEFA Champions League – Player Rater – Petr Čech Match statistics |publisher=En.uclratings.uefa.com |date=6 November 2013 |accessdate=19 November 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140106031817/http://en.uclratings.uefa.com/Player/Profile/49029/2007693 |archivedate=6 January 2014 }}</ref> By winning the Champions League, Čech became just the fourth Czech to win the competition.<ref>{{cite news |date=4 February 2013 |url=http://sport.ihned.cz/fotbal/c1-59253300-golman-cech-prekonal-viktoruv-rekord-a-stal-se-poseste-fotbalistou-roku |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130412054943/http://sport.ihned.cz/fotbal/c1-59253300-golman-cech-prekonal-viktoruv-rekord-a-stal-se-poseste-fotbalistou-roku |dead-url=yes |archive-date=12 April 2013 |title=Čech překonal Viktorův rekord v anketě Fotbalista roku a zahrál si i na bicí |language=Czech |work=Hospodářské noviny |location=Czech Republic |accessdate=5 February 2013 }}</ref> He finished the season by signing a new four-year contract with Chelsea in May, keeping him with the club until the end of the 2015–16 season.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/page/LatestNews/0,,10268~2790514,00.html|title=CECH COMMITS FOR FOUR MORE YEARS|date=28 May 2012|accessdate=28 May 2012|publisher=[[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea official website]]|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120529205012/http://www.chelseafc.com/page/LatestNews/0%2C%2C10268~2790514%2C00.html|archivedate=29 May 2012}}</ref>
====2012–13 season==== [[File:Petr Čech with ball.jpg|thumb|left|Čech playing for Chelsea in the [[2012 FIFA Club World Cup]]]] Čech started in Chelsea's first match of the [[2012–13 Chelsea F.C. season|2012–13 season]], the [[2012 FA Community Shield|2012 Community Shield]] against [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]], but failed to keep a clean sheet as Chelsea went down 3–2 to goals from [[Yaya Touré]], Carlos Tevez and [[Samir Nasri]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/page/LatestNews/0,,10268~2879166,00.html |title=Latest News | News | Official Site | Chelsea Football Club |publisher=Chelseafc.com |date= |accessdate=19 November 2013 }}{{dead link|date=September 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> He also featured in the last [[2012 UEFA Super Cup|UEFA Super Cup]] to be played at [[Monaco]]'s [[Stade Louis II]], in which he conceded four goals as Chelsea lost 4–1 to the [[2012 UEFA Europa League|UEFA Europa League]] winners [[Atlético Madrid]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19423702 |title=BBC Sport – Chelsea 1–4 Atletico Madrid |publisher=Bbc.co.uk |date=31 August 2012 |accessdate=19 November 2013}}</ref> In October 2012, Čech took the [[Captain (association football)|captain]]'s armband as regular Chelsea captain John Terry was sidelined with a four-match ban.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20291156 |title=BBC Sport – John Terry: Chelsea skipper out for 'approximately three weeks' |publisher=Bbc.co.uk |date=16 November 2012 |accessdate=19 November 2013}}</ref>
In May 2013, Čech won the [[UEFA Europa League]] when Chelsea defeated [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]] 2–1 in the [[2013 UEFA Europa League Final|final]].<ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2325135/Chelsea-win-Europa-League-2-1-win-Benfica-Amsterdam-ArenA-Martin-Samuels-match-report.html|title= Ivanovic rises high in injury time to seal dramatic Europa League success for Benitez's Blues|date=15 May 2013|work=Daily Mail|accessdate=21 May 2013 }}</ref>
====2013–14 season==== [[File:Petr Čech Chelsea vs AS-Roma 10AUG2013.jpg|thumb|right|Petr Čech training for Chelsea in 2013]] On 19 October 2013, Čech made his 300th Premier League appearance for Chelsea, in a 4–1 home win over newly promoted side [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/competitions/premier-league/10387081/Chelsea-4-Cardiff-City-1-match-report.html |title=Chelsea 4 Cardiff City 1: match report |publisher=The Telegraph |date=19 October 2013 |accessdate=20 October 2013 }}</ref> On 11 January 2014, he kept his 209th clean sheet for Chelsea in all competitions in a 2–0 away win at [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]], beating the club record set by [[Peter Bonetti]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25600393 |title=Hull City 0–2 Chelsea |work=BBC Sport | date=11 January 2014 |accessdate=11 January 2014 }}</ref>
On 18 March 2014, Čech made his 100th UEFA Champions League appearance in a 2–0 win over [[Galatasaray S.K. (football)|Galatasaray]] at Stamford Bridge. He became the fourth goalkeeper to make a century of appearances in the competition after [[Iker Casillas]], [[Victor Valdés]] and [[Oliver Kahn]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/news/newsid=2068181.html|title=Čech becomes latest member of 100 club|date=18 March 2014|publisher=UEFA}}</ref>
On 22 April 2014, Čech was substituted in the first leg of the [[2013–14 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] semi-final against Atlético Madrid with a shoulder injury. Chelsea manager José Mourinho stated that the injury would prevent Čech from playing again in the [[2013–14 Chelsea F.C. season|2013–14 season]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/27121526|title=Chelsea: John Terry & Petr Cech injured for Premier League run-in|date=22 April 2014|accessdate=23 April 2014|work=BBC}}</ref> Despite the injury, Čech would finish the season as the joint winner of the Premier League Golden Glove award along with Arsenal goalkeeper [[Wojciech Szczęsny]], both keeping 16 clean sheets.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://talksport.com/football/liverpool-star-suarez-named-barclays-player-season-14051390935 |title=Liverpool star Suarez named Barclays Player of the Season |publisher=talksport |date=13 May 2014 |accessdate=13 May 2014 }}</ref>
====2014–15 season==== Čech's place as Chelsea's starting goalkeeper was taken at the start of the season by [[Thibaut Courtois]]. This was possibly due to Čech's long standing injury concerns to his shoulder, back and knees.<ref>{{cite news|url =http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2051245/Petr-Cech-Chelsea-future-doubt-says-Thibaut-Courtois.html|title=Time's running out for Cech: Rookie Courtois casts doubt over keeper's future|publisher=Daily Mail|date=20 October 2011|accessdate = 29 June 2015}}</ref> On 24 September 2014, Čech made his first appearance of the season against Bolton in the third round of the [[EFL Cup|League Cup]], a 2–1 victory. He made his first league appearance of the season on 5 October, replacing the injured Courtois in the first half of a 2–0 home win over Arsenal.<ref>{{cite news|last1=McNulty|first1=Phil|title=Chelsea 2–0 Arsenal|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29398780|accessdate=5 October 2014|work=BBC Sport|date=5 October 2014}}</ref> His second start of the season came in the Champions League group stage victory against Slovenian side [[NK Maribor|Maribor]], keeping a clean sheet as Chelsea won 6–0.<ref>{{cite web|first=Gary|last=Rose|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/29362738|title=Chelsea 6–0 Maribor|work=BBC Sport|date=21 October 2014|accessdate=23 October 2014}}</ref> With Courtois injured, Čech made his first league start of the season on 13 December against Hull, keeping a clean sheet in a 2–0 win.<ref>{{cite news|title=Chelsea 2–0 Hull|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30357622|accessdate=13 December 2014|work=BBC Sport|date=13 December 2014}}</ref>
Despite him being second choice, Mourinho stated that Čech would not be sold in the January 2015 transfer window due to third-choice [[Mark Schwarzer]] leaving for [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Petr Cech to stay at Chelsea as Mark Schwarzer joins Leicester|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30675920|accessdate=18 January 2015|work=BBC Sport|date=4 January 2015}}</ref> During that month, Čech made back to back starts in the Premier League against [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] at home, followed by [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]] away from home, keeping clean-sheets in both wins.<ref>{{cite news|title=Chelsea 2–0 Newcastle|url=http://www.espnfc.com/gamecast/statistics/id/395574/statistics.html|work=ESPN|date=10 January 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Swansea City 0–5 Chelsea |url=http://www.espnfc.com/gamecast/statistics/id/395563/statistics.html|work=ESPN|date=17 January 2015}}</ref> On 1 March 2015, Čech started in goal in the [[2015 Football League Cup Final|2015 League Cup final]] against Tottenham Hotspur, keeping a clean sheet in a 2–0 victory to win the trophy for the third time in his career.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/mar/01/chelsea-tottenham-capital-one-cup-final-match-report|title=Terry drives Chelsea to Capital One Cup final win over Tottenham|date=1 March 2015|work=The Guardian}}</ref>
===Arsenal=== [[File:Emirates Cup - Arsenal v Wolfsburg (19576570504).jpg|thumbnail|Čech playing for Arsenal at the [[2015 Emirates Cup]]]] {{quote| Last summer, things changed and I understood I was no longer the first-choice keeper, but I felt it was not the right time for me to go. During the season it became clear that my situation would not improve and, as I know I am not at the stage of my career where I want to be on the bench, I made my decision to move on and look for new challenges.|Čech, via open letter on [[Twitter]], about his situation on Chelsea and his move to Arsenal<ref>{{cite web|title=Petr Čech on Twitter|url=https://twitter.com/PetrCech/status/615527161475268609|date=29 June 2015|accessdate=5 August 2015}}</ref>}}
====2015–16 season==== Čech signed for Chelsea's Premier League [[Arsenal F.C.–Chelsea F.C. rivalry|rivals]] Arsenal on a four-year contract on 29 June 2015, for a fee of around £10 million.<ref>{{cite news|url =https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33318367|title=Petr Cech: Arsenal sign keeper from Chelsea in £10m deal|publisher=BBC Sport|date=29 June 2015|accessdate = 29 June 2015}}</ref> The departure of Wojciech Szczęsny to [[A.S. Roma|Roma]] on loan made Čech first-choice goalkeeper ahead of [[David Ospina]]. On 2 August, Čech won his first trophy with Arsenal after beating former side Chelsea 1–0 in the [[2015 FA Community Shield]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.goal.com/en/match/arsenal-vs-chelsea/2036539/report?ICID=MP_MS_5|title=Arsenal 1–0 Chelsea: Wenger breaks Mourinho jinx to lift Community Shield|date=2 August 2015|accessdate=2 August 2015|publisher=Goal.com}}</ref> A week later, he made his Premier League debut for Arsenal in a 2–0 home defeat to West Ham.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Arsenal 0–2 West Ham|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33750502 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=9 August 2015}}</ref> On 20 October, he made his first Champions League appearance for Arsenal in a 2–0 win against Bayern Munich.<ref>{{cite news|title=Arsenal 2–0 Bayern Munich|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/34128978|publisher=BBC Sport|date=20 October 2015}}</ref> Čech recorded his 170th Premier League clean sheet in a 2–0 win against [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|AFC Bournemouth]] on 28 December 2015, setting a new league record and overtaking previous record holder [[David James (footballer)|David James]].<ref name="Cech record breaker">{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/dec/29/petr-cech-the-meticulous-record-breaker-who-likes-to-do-things-the-right-way|title=Petr Cech: the meticulous record breaker who 'likes to do things the right way'|work=The Guardian|author1=David Hytner|date=29 December 2015|accessdate=29 December 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/35148189|title=Arsenal 2–0 Bournemouth|publisher=BBC Sport|date=28 December 2015|accessdate=28 December 2015}}</ref> On 2 March 2016, he was sidelined due to a calf injury while playing against Swansea.<ref name="skysports.com">{{cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11670/10191062/arsenal-goalkeeper-petr-cech-facing-four-weeks-out-with-calf-injury|title=Arsenal goalkeeper Petr Cech facing four weeks out with calf injury|website=Sky Sports|access-date=22 April 2016}}</ref> On 2 April, he returned as an unused substitute against [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] and returned to pitch on 17 April against [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] in a narrow 1–1 draw<ref name="skysports.com"/> and guided Arsenal to its 500th Premier League win on 21 April against West Brom.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/arsenal/story/2845465/arsenal-land-500th-premier-league-win-v-west-brom|title=Arsenal land 500th Premier League win against West Brom|website=ESPNFC.com|access-date=22 April 2016}}</ref>
====2016–17 season==== Čech was given the captain's armband for Arsenal in their 4–3 opening day home loss to Liverpool.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eurosport.com/football/premier-league/2016-2017/live-arsenal-liverpool_mtc862032/live.shtml|title=Arsenal 3–4 Liverpool|website=Eurosport.com}}</ref> In September 2016, he featured for the full 90 minutes in a 3–0 rout by Arsenal of his former side Chelsea at the Emirates.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37393486|title=Arsenal 3–0 Chelsea|website=BBC.com}}</ref> In April 2017, Čech played in the [[2016–17 FA Cup]] semi final against Manchester City on 24 April at Wembley, which Arsenal won 2–1.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/04/23/arsenal-vs-manchester-city-fa-cup-semi-final-watch-live-score/amp/|title=Arsenal 2–1 Manchester City|website=Telegraph.co.uk}}</ref> Čech again held the captain's armband on 10 May 2017 in a 2–0 win over Southampton at the St Mary's Stadium.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eurosport.com/football/premier-league/2016-2017/live-southampton-arsenal_mtc862282/live.shtml|title=Southampton 0–2 Arsenal|website=Eurosport.com}}</ref> Čech was sidelined for the [[2017 FA Cup Final|FA Cup Final]] due to injury, but Arsenal beat Chelsea 2–1.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ibtimes.co.uk/arsenal-vs-chelsea-petr-cech-be-benched-fa-cup-final-after-injury-scare-1623603|title=Arsenal vs Chelsea: Petr Cech to be benched in FA Cup final after injury scare|website=IB Times.co.uk}}</ref> Čech won his 5th FA Cup, and Arsenal became the most successful club in the history of the competition with 13 tournament wins.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nesn.com/2017/05/fa-cup-final-2017-arsenal-celebrates-win-vs-chelsea-on-field-in-dressing-room/amp/|title=Arsenal celebrate FA Cup final win vs. Chelsea|website=NESN.com}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/39984089|title=Arsenal 2–1 Chelsea|website=BBC.com}}</ref>
====2017–18 season==== Čech was the goalkeeper for the [[2017 FA Community Shield|2017 Community Shield]], which Arsenal won in a penalty shootout against Chelsea.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=sVwr6MxovYQ|title=Arsenal 1–1 Chelsea (4–1 Pens) – FA Community Shield|website=YouTube.com}}</ref>
He then held the armband to captain Arsenal in their 4–3 opening day home win over Leicester City.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/arsenal-vs-leicester-live-updates-score-latest-what-time-start-where-watch-tv-stream-a7888216.html|title=Arsenal 4 Leicester 3 as it happened: Goals galore on breathless opening night of the Premier League season|website=Independent.co.uk}}</ref>
On 11 March 2018, Čech became the first [[Premier League]] goalkeeper to keep 200 league clean sheets, against [[Watford FC|Watford]] after saving a penalty from [[Troy Deeney]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://metro.co.uk/2018/03/11/petr-cech-claims-200th-premier-league-clean-sheet-arsenals-win-watford-7378652/|title=Petr Cech finally reaches Premier League milestone with clean sheet vs Watford|date=11 March 2018|work=Metro|access-date=11 March 2018|language=en-GB}}</ref>
====2018–19 season and retirement==== He started the season as the first choice in goal for new manager [[Unai Emery]], but later lost his place to new signing [[Bernd Leno]] after suffering a hamstring injury in a match against Watford. On 15 January 2019, Čech announced via open letter on Twitter that he would retire at the end of the season.<ref>{{cite web |title=Petr Cech on Twitter |url=https://twitter.com/PetrCech/status/1085130768844800002 |website=Twitter |accessdate=15 January 2019 |date=15 January 2019}}</ref>
==International career== [[File:Petr Cech National.JPG|thumb|Čech playing for the [[Czech national football team]] in 2010]] {{wikinews|Petr Čech retires from international football}} Čech first represented his country in November 1997 with the under-15 team, working his way up through different age groups before making his senior debut for the [[Czech Republic national football team|Czech Republic]] in February 2002. He first came to prominence as a 20-year-old at the [[2002 UEFA European Under-21 Championship|2002 U-21 European Championships]] when his [[penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalty shoot-out]] heroics in the final against [[France national under-21 football team|France]], letting in only one of the penalty kicks, earned the [[Czech Republic national under-21 football team|Czech Republic]] their first title at youth level.<ref>{{cite web|title=Čech sparks Czech party|url=http://www.uefa.com/under21/history/season=2002/index.html|publisher=UEFA|date=1 June 2002|accessdate=18 March 2012}}</ref>
After establishing himself as the senior team's first choice goalkeeper, Čech was selected in the Czech Republic's squad for [[UEFA Euro 2004]]. Čech's saves helped his team progress as far as the semi-finals, where they lost to eventual winners [[Greece national football team|Greece]] on the [[silver goal]] rule. He was named in the all-star team as best goalkeeper at the tournament.<ref>{{cite news|work=BBC Sport|title=Zagorakis named top player|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/euro_2004/greece/3866823.stm|date=5 July 2004|accessdate=13 April 2009}}</ref>
The Czech Republic qualified for the [[2006 FIFA World Cup|2006 World Cup]], held in Germany, and were placed in Group E, alongside [[Ghana national football team|Ghana]], [[Italy national football team|Italy]] and the [[United States men's national soccer team|United States]]. The Czech Republic finished third in their group, following a 3–0 win against the United States, and two losses against Ghana and Italy, the score 2–0 in both games, thus not qualifying for the knock-out stages of the tournament.
On 17 October 2007, Čech captained the Czech Republic team in their [[UEFA Euro 2008|Euro 2008]] Group D qualifier against [[Germany national football team|Germany]]. He kept a clean sheet and the Czechs defeated Germany 3–0 away to book their place for the finals in Austria and Switzerland. In the last group game of the final tournament, Čech was beaten three times in the final 15 minutes as [[Turkey national football team|Turkey]] overcame a two-goal deficit to knock the Czechs out. Čech had a cross slip through his hands, allowing [[Nihat Kahveci]] to score Turkey's equalizing goal.<ref>{{cite news|work=The Daily Telegraph |title=Euro 2008: Petr Cech blames himself for Czech Republic's spectacular collapse|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/international/2303385/Euro-2008-Petr-Cech-blames-himself-for-Czech-Republics-spectacular-collapse.html|date=16 June 2008|accessdate=13 April 2009 | location=London}}</ref>
On 29 May 2012, Čech was named in the Czech Republic's squad for [[UEFA Euro 2012|Euro 2012]] in Poland and Ukraine.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/2898/euro-2012/2012/05/29/3134610/pudil-dropped-from-final-czech-republic-squad-for-euro-2012 |title=Daniel Pudil cut from Czech Republic squad for Euro 2012|website=Goal.com|date=29 May 2012|access-date=15 May 2016}}</ref> In the Czech Republic's [[UEFA Euro 2012 Group A|group]] match against Greece, a fumble from Čech allowed the Greeks a goal.<ref>{{cite news|work=BBC Sport |title=Greece 1 – 2 Czech Rep.|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/18137833|date=12 June 2012 |accessdate=12 June 2012 }}</ref> The match, however, finished 2–1 in the Czech Republic's favour. Čech deputised for the injured [[Tomáš Rosický]] as captain in the final group match against [[Poland national football team|Poland]], as the Czech Republic qualified for the quarter-final with a 1–0 win.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2012/06/17/sports/soccer/euro-2012-czech-republic-eliminates-co-host-poland.html?_r=1|title=Euro 2012 – Czech Republic eliminates co-host Poland|website=NY Times.com|date=17 June 2012|access-date=15 May 2016}}</ref> Čech's captaincy continued in the quarter-final, as [[Portugal national football team|Portugal]] eliminated the Czechs through a 79th-minute [[Cristiano Ronaldo]] goal.<ref>Rostance, Tom. (21 June 2012) [https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/18355069 Czech Rep. 0–1 Portugal]. Bbc.co.uk. Retrieved on 15 May 2016.</ref>
On 26 March 2013, Čech made his [[List of footballers with 100 or more caps|100th appearance]] for the Czech Republic, keeping a clean sheet in a 3–0 win over [[Armenia national football team|Armenia]].<ref>{{cite news|work=Reuters |title=Cech wins 100th cap as Vydra double delights Czechs |url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/2013/03/26/uk-soccer-world-armenia-idUKBRE92P15O20130326|date=26 March 2013|accessdate=3 April 2014| location=Yerevan}}</ref> He equalled the national record of former teammate [[Karel Poborský]] on 17 November 2015, when he earned his 118th cap in a 3–1 loss to neighbours [[Poland national football team|Poland]] in [[Wrocław]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Petr Cech equals Karel Poborsky Czech Republic appearance record, Croatia come from behind to defeat Russia and Switzerland beat Austria in Vienna|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3323030/Petr-Cech-equals-Karel-Poborsky-Czech-Republic-appearance-record-Croatia-come-defeat-Russia-Switzerland-beat-Austria-Vienna.html|accessdate=19 November 2015|work=Daily Mail|date=18 November 2015}}</ref> The following 27 May, he took the record outright by playing in a 6–0 friendly win over Malta.<ref>{{cite news|title=Cech becomes Czech Republic's most-capped player|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/news/4961/international-football/2016/05/27/23988662/cech-becomes-czech-republics-most-capped-player|accessdate=1 June 2016|publisher=Goal.com|date=27 May 2016}}</ref>
On 8 July 2016, Čech announced his retirement from international football. He is the most capped player in the history of the Czech team, with 124 caps.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.itv.com/news/update/2016-07-08/arsenal-goalkeeper-announces-international-retirement/|title=Arsenal goalkeeper announces international retirement|date=8 July 2016|accessdate=8 July 2016|publisher=ITV}}</ref>
==Style of play== [[File:Arsenal 1 Chelsea 1 (4-1 on pens) (35586034434).jpg|thumb|Cech diving to save a penalty against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] in [[FA Community Shield]]]] ===Analysis=== Since his emergence as a precocious talent in his youth, Čech has been considered to be one of the greatest, most consistent, and most respected goalkeepers both of his generation and of all time.<ref name="ESPN Profile">{{cite web|url=http://espnfc.com/player/_/id/13069/petr-cech?cc=4716 |title=Petr Cech Bio, Stats, News – Football / Soccer |publisher=Espn Fc |date=20 May 1982 |accessdate=19 November 2013}}</ref><ref name="goalkeeping greats">{{cite web|url=http://www.fourfourtwo.com/news/buffon-touts-brave-neuer-among-goalkeeping-greats#:F2JnYrHft0tEhA|title=Buffon touts 'brave' Neuer among goalkeeping greats|work=FourFourTwo|date=22 February 2016|accessdate=25 March 2016}}</ref><ref name="Greatest goalkeepers">{{cite web|url=http://www.fourfourtwo.com/news/cech-one-greatest-goalkeepers-ever-says-wenger%3f_format=amp|title=Cech is one of the greatest goalkeepers ever, says Wenger|work=FourFourTwo|date=6 November 2015|accessdate=15 September 2018}}{{Dead link|date=February 2019 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/petr-cech-will-recover-to-have-a-fantastic-season-at-arsenal-says-gunners-legend-jens-lehmann-10453278.html |title=Petr Cech will recover to have a 'fantastic season' at Arsenal, says Gunners legend Jens Lehmann |publisher=The Independent |author1=Tom Sheen |date=13 August 2015 |accessdate=11 November 2018 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.espn.com/soccer/uefa-champions-league/story/2812976/gigi-buffon--manuel-neuer-not-yet-among-worlds-best-keepers |title=Gigi Buffon: Bayern's Manuel Neuer not yet among world's best keepers |publisher=ESPN FC |author1=Ben Gladwell |date=22 February 2016 |accessdate=11 November 2018 }}</ref> A tall, athletic, agile, brave, physically strong, and well-rounded keeper, with a strong mentality, as well as good decision-making and leadership qualities, throughout his career he has stood out for his reflexes and shot-stopping abilities, as well as his positional sense, concentration, handling when coming off his line to claim crosses, and command of his area.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/ludek-cech-nearly-signed-for-hammers-6987608.html|title=Ludek: Cech nearly signed for Hammers|publisher=The Evening Standard|author1=Ken Dyer|date=28 January 2004|accessdate=15 February 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/u20worldcup/news/y=2009/m=9/news=peter-seeking-inspiration-from-petr-1109483.html|title=Peter seeking inspiration from Petr|publisher=FIFA.com|date=29 September 2009|accessdate=15 February 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.marca.com/en/football/national-teams/2016/06/16/5762d315e5fdea273a8b4646.html|title=Cech shows off his brilliant reflexes|publisher=Marca|date=16 June 2016|accessdate=15 February 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/teams/c/chelsea/8414755.stm|title=Alan Hansen's tactical view|publisher=BBC Sport|author1=Alan Hansen|date=16 December 2009|accessdate=15 February 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://soccer.nbcsports.com/2015/08/05/petr-cechs-arsenal-arrival-the-final-piece-for-a-real-premier-league-title-challenge/|title=Petr Cech’s Arsenal arrival — the final piece for a real Premier League title challenge?|publisher=NBC Sports|author1=Andy Edwards|date=5 August 2015|accessdate=15 February 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/34047710|title=Petr Cech shows his class but Arsenal still need to strengthen|publisher=BBC Sport|author=Phil McNulty|date=25 August 2015|accessdate=22 February 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-soccer-england-arsenal/cech-arrival-adds-substance-to-arsenals-style-idUKKCN0Q62R620150801|title=Cech arrival adds substance to Arsenal's style|publisher=Reuters.com|author1=Tom Hayward|date=1 August 2015|accessdate=12 September 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.corrieredellosport.it/news/calcio/calcio-mercato/2015/06/03-1395179/calciomercato_16_portieri_in_cerca_di_una_casa/|title=Ecco i portieri che accendono il calciomercato|publisher=Il Corriere dello Sport|language=Italian|author1=Valerio Albensi|date=3 June 2015|accessdate=12 September 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/it/news/1941/z/2012/11/20/3541290/la-sfida-nella-sfida-buffon-vs-cech-il-portierone-bianconero|title=La Sfida nella Sfida – Buffon vs Cech: il portierone bianconero ha qualcosa in più del collega 'Blue'...|publisher=Goal.com|language=Italian|author1=Renato Maisani|date=20 November 2012|accessdate=12 September 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.gazzetta.it/Calcio/Premier-League/20-07-2018/arsenal-cech-che-cambiamento-ora-montagna-muscoli-280762667668.shtml |title=Arsenal, Cech, che cambiamento. Ora è una montagna di muscoli |publisher=La Gazzetta dello Sport |language=Italian |author1=Simona Marchetti |date=20 July 2018 |accessdate=23 September 2018 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.fifa.com/live-scores/news/y=2007/m=11/news=who-the-world-best-keeper-630581.html |title=Who is the world's best keeper? |publisher=FIFA.com |date=6 November 2007 |accessdate=11 November 2018 }}</ref> Although he is not as adept with the ball at his feet as the newer generation of goalkeepers that emerged in his later career,<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/alisson-turn-petr-cech-error-liverpool-arsenal-goalkeeper-scout-transfer-a8522756.html |title=After Alisson and Petr Cech made errors with their feet, is it time goalkeeping coaching went back to basics? |publisher=The Independent |author1=Miguel Delaney |date=4 September 2018 |accessdate=11 November 2018 }}</ref> he possesses a deep kick with either foot, despite being naturally left-footed.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/it/news/2/serie-a/2015/11/19/17489272/juventus-buffon-analizza-i-colleghi-cech-il-migliore-come|title=Juventus, Buffon analizza i colleghi: "Cech il migliore, come tecnico stimo Luis Enrique"|publisher=Goal.com|language=Italian|author=Luca Barbon|date=19 November 2015|accessdate=4 November 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://bleacherreport.com/articles/1700510-picking-an-all-left-footed-chelsea-xi-under-jose-mourinho|title=Picking an All Left-Footed Chelsea XI Under Jose Mourinho|publisher=Bleacher Report|author1=Joe Krishnan|date=11 July 2013|accessdate=4 November 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.arsenal.com/news/features/20160912/petr-cech|title=Petr Cech|publisher=Arsenal.com|author1=Max Jones|date=16 September 2016|accessdate=4 November 2017}}</ref> ===Reception=== Fellow goalkeeper [[Gianluigi Buffon]] named Čech as the best goalkeeper of his era, saying: "The best goalkeeper with his feet? [[Pepe Reina]]. In the air I’d say Neuer. With his hands: Casillas. The best overall I’d say is Cech.".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://90min.com/posts/2732836-gianluigi-buffon-names-arsenal-s-petr-cech-as-the-best-goalkeeper-of-his-era|title=Gianluigi Buffon Names Arsenal's Petr Cech as the Best Goalkeeper of his Era|publisher=90min|author=Mahmoud Jaber|date=19 November 2015|accessdate=8 February 2019}}</ref> Former [[Arsenal]] manager [[Arsene Wenger]] and goalkeeper [[Jens Lehmann]] have hailed him as ''one of the greatest of all time''.<ref name=''Jens's statement''>{{cite web|url=http://www.squawka.com/en/news/jens-lehmann-petr-cechs-presence-makes-him-one-of-the-best-goalkeepers-ever/960864#J3IEpyBgyjfdLdr1.97|title=Arsenal’s Petr Cech’s is one of the best goalkeepers ever – Jens Lehmann|publisher=Squawka|date=18 June 2017|accessdate=12 February 2019}}</ref> Cech currently holds two [[Guinness World Records]] for the most clean sheets in [[English Premier League]] history and [[Golden Gloves]] with two different clubs in Premier League.<ref name="Guineas">{{cite web|URL=https://www.squawka.com/en/news/arsenal-goalkeeper-petr-cech-enters-2017-guinness-book-of-world-records/796063%3famp-on|title=Arsenal goalkeeper Petr Cech enters 2017 Guinness Book of World Records|publisher=Squawka| author=Henry, Natasha|date=n.d.|accessdate=26 February 2019}}</ref>
==Personal life== Čech was born a triplet along with sister Šárka and a brother named Michal, who died aged two after contracting an infection in hospital.<ref name=dmapril2507>{{cite news | last=Sale | first=Charles | date=25 April 2007 | url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/article-450556/Sports-Agenda-Cech-aims-stay-ahead-game.html | title=Sports Agenda: Cech aims to stay ahead of the game | newspaper=[[Daily Mail]] | accessdate=13 March 2012 | location=London}}</ref> Čech also has an elder sister, Markéta.<ref name =family>{{cite news |date=18 October 2006 | url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/news/article67586.ece | title=Brain bug killed Cech's brother | newspaper=[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]] | accessdate=8 April 2008 | location=London | first=Richard | last=White}}</ref>
Čech married Martina Dolejšová (now Čechová) (b. 1982), also of Czech nationality, in June 2003.<ref name=wife>{{cite news | last=Riebauerová | first=Martina | date=30 June 2008 | url=http://ona.idnes.cz/martina-cechova-chybi-mi-manzel-dmw-/spolecnost.aspx?c=A080619_114726_ona_ony_jup | title=Martina Čechová: Chybí mi manžel |language=Czech |work=Mladá fronta DNES |location=Czech Republic |publisher=MAFRA | accessdate=24 March 2012}}</ref> They have a daughter Adéla (b. 23 January 2008)<ref name=wife/> and a son Damián (b. June 2009),<ref name=secondchild>{{cite news | date=4 July 2009 | url=http://fotbal.idnes.cz/fotbalovy-golman-cech-stravil-poprve-v-kariere-celou-dovolenou-v-cechach-14x-/fot_zahranici.aspx?c=A090704_134212_fot_zahranici_rou | title=Fotbalový gólman Čech strávil poprvé v kariéře celou dovolenou v Čechách |language=Czech |work=Mladá fronta DNES |location=Czech Republic |publisher=MAFRA | accessdate=24 March 2012}}</ref> both born in the Czech Republic.
He is a keen musician and plays the drums. He has a [[YouTube]] channel under his own name on which he posts video drum covers, including [[Incubus (band)|Incubus]]' "[[Anna Molly]]",<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d0bBlHl7sKI|title=Anna Molly drum cover by Petr Cech|website=YouTube.com|date =14 March 2015|access-date=15 May 2016}}</ref> as well as songs by [[Coldplay]] and [[Foo Fighters]]. He has played with [[Roger Taylor (Queen drummer)|Roger Taylor]] of [[Queen (band)|Queen]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nme.com/news/various-artists/83767|title=Chelsea goalkeeper Petr Cech covers Incubus' 'Anna Molly' in drum tutorial video – watch|work=NME|date=21 March 2015|accessdate=21 March 2015}}</ref>
Along with his native language Czech, Čech also speaks English, French, German and Spanish.<ref name=dmirrordec292015>{{cite news | last=Cross| first=John| date=29 December 2015 | url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/petr-cech-insists-wouldnt-joined-7087953 | title=Petr Cech insists he wouldn't have joined Arsenal if he didn't think they could win Premier League | newspaper=[[Daily Mirror]] | accessdate=31 December 2015 | location=London}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Double Club Meets Petr Čech|url=https://www.arsenaldoubleclub.co.uk/fun-zone/double-club-meets/double-club-meets-petr-cech/|publisher=[[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] Double Club|accessdate=20 December 2018}}</ref><ref>{{citenews|title=I speak to my defence in four languages, reveals Arsenal goalkeeper Petr Cech|url=https://talksport.com/football/22886/i-speak-my-defence-four-languages-reveals-arsenal-goalkeeper-petr-cech-160101179624/|publisher=[[Talksport|talkSPORT]]|date=1 January 2016|first=George|last=Pitts}}</ref>
==Career statistics== ===Club=== {{updated|match played 14 February 2019}}<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.soccerbase.com/players_details.sd?playerid=26534 | title = Peter Cech Career Stats | work = Soccerbase | accessdate = 29 June 2015 }}</ref><ref name=NFT>{{NFT player |id=1844 |name=Čech, Petr |accessdate=13 June 2016}}</ref>
