{{Spanish name|Bellerín|Moruno}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Héctor Bellerín | image = 1 hector bellerin 2015.jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = Bellerín playing for [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] in 2015 | fullname = Héctor Bellerín Moruno | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1995|03|19|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Barcelona]], Spain | height = 1.78 m<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/players/4474/Héctor-Bellerín/overview |title=Héctor Bellerín: Overview |publisher=Premier League |accessdate=15 June 2018}}</ref> | position = [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|Right back]] / [[Defender (association football)#Wing-back|Wing back]] | currentclub = [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] | clubnumber = 2 | youthyears1 = 2003–2011 | youthclubs1 = [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] | youthyears2 = 2011–2013 | youthclubs2 = [[Arsenal F.C. Academy|Arsenal]] | years1 = 2013– | clubs1 = [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] | years2 = 2013–2014| clubs2 = → [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] (loan) | caps1 = 143 | goals1 = 6 | caps2 = 8 | goals2 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2011 | nationalteam1 = [[Spain national under-16 football team|Spain U16]] | nationalyears2 = 2012 | nationalteam2 = [[Spain national under-17 football team|Spain U17]] | nationalyears3 = 2013–2014 | nationalteam3 = [[Spain national under-19 football team|Spain U19]] | nationalyears4 = 2015–2017 | nationalteam4 = [[Spain national under-21 football team|Spain U21]] | nationalyears5 = 2016– | nationalteam5 = [[Spain national football team|Spain]] | nationalcaps1 = 6 | nationalgoals1 = 1 | nationalcaps2 = 6 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalcaps3 = 9 | nationalgoals3 = 0 | nationalcaps4 = 14 | nationalgoals4 = 0 | nationalcaps5 = 3 | nationalgoals5 = 0 | club-update = 19 January 2019 | nationalteam-update = 22:46, 12 May 2017 (UTC) }} '''Héctor Bellerín Moruno''' ({{IPA-es|ˈeɣtoɾ βeʎeˈɾim moˈɾuno}},{{efn|In isolation, ''Bellerín'' is pronounced {{IPA-es|beʎeˈɾin|}}.}} born 19 March 1995) is a Spanish professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|right back]] or [[Defender (association football)#Wing-back|wing back]] for {{English football updater|Arsenal}} club [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] and the [[Spanish national football team|Spain national team]].
Bellerín started his career as an attacking winger for [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]], and credits his development as a successful right back to [[Steve Bould]] upon his arrival at [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] in the summer of 2011.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3341454/Hector-Bellerin-didn-t-know-defend-Barcelona-schooled-Arsenal-legend-Steve-Bould.html|title=Arsenal star Hector Bellerin 'didn't know how to defend' at Barcelona|newspaper=Mail Online|access-date=2016-11-21}}</ref> His speedy pace, skilful [[Dribbling#Association football|dribbling]] on the ball, and [[Cross (football)|crossing]] ability have also helped him in creating chances for his team. On 21 November 2016, he signed a long-term contract that ties him to the club until 2022.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.espn.in/football/arsenal/story/3000954/hector-bellerin-signs-new-long-term-contract-at-arsenal|title=Bellerin signs new long-term Arsenal deal|newspaper=ESPN|access-date=2016-11-21}}</ref>
Bellerín played internationally for Spain from [[Spain national under-16 football team|under-16]] to [[Spain national under-21 football team|under-21]] levels. He made his [[Spain national football team|senior]] debut for Spain in 2016 and was later chosen for the [[UEFA Euro 2016|European Championship]] of that year.<ref name=Euros />
== Club career ==
Born in [[Barcelona]], [[Catalonia]], Bellerín started his club football career in [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]]'s youth team. He moved to [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] in the summer of 2011,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/bellerin-i-m-so-happy-i-joined-arsenal |title=Bellerin – I'm so happy I joined Arsenal |publisher=[[Arsenal F.C.]] |date=29 August 2012 |accessdate=26 September 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130927152413/http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/bellerin-i-m-so-happy-i-joined-arsenal |archivedate=27 September 2013 |df= }}</ref> and signed his first professional contract with the club in July 2013. While a youth player at Arsenal, Bellerín also helped the club to reach fourth place of the [[NextGen Series]] of [[2012-13 NextGen Series|2012–13]].<ref name=NextGen>{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2301930/Arsenal-1-Sporting-Lisbon-3-NextGen-Series.html|title=Arsenal 1–3 Sporting Lisbon|website=Daily Mail.co.uk}}</ref> Bellerín made his competitive debut away to [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] in [[2013–14 Football League Cup|the third round]] of the [[Football League Cup|League Cup]] on 25 September 2013, coming on in the 95th minute as a substitute for [[Mikel Arteta]] in a [[penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalty shootout]] victory after a 1–1 draw.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.arsenal.com/match/report/1314/post/first-team/west-brom-1-1-arsenal-aet-report|title=WBA 1–1 Arsenal (3–4 pens)|publisher=Arsenal F.C.|first=Chris|last=Harris|date=25 September 2013|accessdate=26 September 2013}}</ref> Two months later, Bellerín joined [[Football League Championship|Championship]] club [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] on a two-month loan deal, and made his debut against [[Yeovil Town F.C.|Yeovil Town]] eight days after signing.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/bellerin-joins-watford-on-loan |title=Bellerin joins Watford on loan |publisher=Arsenal F.C.|date=22 November 2013 |accessdate=22 November 2013}}</ref> The loan at Watford was extended until the end of the season,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.watfordfc.com/news/article/140103-bellerin-signs-1273564.aspx|title=OFFICIAL: Bellerin’s Back|publisher=[[Watford F.C.]]|date=3 January 2014|accessdate=25 September 2016|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140104002503/http://www.watfordfc.com/news/article/140103-bellerin-signs-1273564.aspx|archivedate=4 January 2014}}</ref> but he was recalled by Arsenal in February 2014.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.watfordobserver.co.uk/sport/11018138.Bellerin_recalled_by_Gunners/|title=Arsenal have recalled young defender Hector Bellerin from his loan with Watford|work=Watford Observer|date=18 February 2014|accessdate=18 February 2014}}</ref>
[[File:Bellerin on the ball 2 (16316060769).jpg|thumb|180px|left|Bellerín on the ball against [[Leicester City]] in February 2015]]
Following injuries to [[Mathieu Debuchy]], [[Calum Chambers]] and [[Nacho Monreal]], Bellerín made his [[UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] debut on 16 September 2014 in a 2–0 defeat away to [[Borussia Dortmund]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29209551|title=Borussia Dortmund 2–0 Arsenal|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|first=Neil|last=Johnston|date=16 September 2014|accessdate=17 September 2014}}</ref> He scored his first goal for Arsenal on 1 February 2015, in a 5–0 win against [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]],<ref>{{cite web|last1=Dawkes|first1=Phil|title=Arsenal 5–0 Aston Villa|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30971833|accessdate=1 February 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=1 February 2015}}</ref> and added a second on 4 April to open a 4–1 win over [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] despite also conceding a [[Penalty kick (association football)|penalty kick]] through a foul on [[Raheem Sterling]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32097847|title=Arsenal 4–1 Liverpool|publisher=BBC Sport|first=Phil|last=McNulty|date=4 April 2015|accessdate=22 November 2015}}</ref>
Bellerín was selected to start for Arsenal in the [[2015 FA Cup Final]] on 30 May, helping the team keep a clean sheet in a 4–0 win over Aston Villa at [[Wembley Stadium]].<ref name=FACup>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/32856754|title=Arsenal 4–0 Aston Villa|publisher=BBC Sport|first=Phil|last=McNulty|date=30 May 2015}}</ref> He signed a new long-term contract before the 2015–16 season and played the entirety of Arsenal's 1–0 win over [[Arsenal F.C.–Chelsea F.C. rivalry|rivals]] [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] in the [[2015 FA Community Shield]].<ref name=Shield>{{cite web|last1=Cryer|first1=Andy|title=Arsenal 1–0 Chelsea|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33667216|accessdate=2 August 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=2 August 2015}}</ref> He was the sole Arsenal player listed in [[2015–16 Premier League|the season's]] [[PFA Team of the Year]],<ref name=pfa>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36106596|title=PFA awards: Leicester and Spurs dominate Premier League team|publisher=BBC Sport|date=21 April 2016|accessdate=21 April 2016}}</ref> and came in third place in Arsenal's Player of the Season voting.<ref name=arsenal.com>{{cite web|url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/20160518/player-of-the-season-in-third-place...|title=Player of the Season – in third place...|publisher=Arsenal F.C.|first=Max|last=Jones|date=18 May 2016|accessdate=18 May 2016}}</ref> On 21 November 2016, he signed a new long-term contract after agreeing to a deal that ties him to the club until 2022.<ref>{{cite news|title=Hector Bellerin: Spain defender signs new Arsenal deal|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/38054145|accessdate=21 November 2016|publisher=BBC Sport|date=21 November 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Hector Bellerin signs new long-term contract at Arsenal|url=http://www.espnfc.us/arsenal/story/3000954/hector-bellerin-signs-new-long-term-contract-at-arsenal|accessdate=26 November 2016|publisher=ESPN FC|date=21 November 2016}}</ref>
Bellerín featured in the following season throughout Arsenal's victorious [[2016-17 FA Cup|FA Cup Campaign]]. He played in the [[2017 FA Cup Final|Cup final]] which Arsenal went on to win by a 2–1 margin against Chelsea.<ref>{{cite web|url= https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=WXeS3rsW1Z8|title= Arsenal 2–1 Chelsea – Emirates FA Cup Final 2016/17|website=Youtube.com}}</ref> He was again triumphant in the Gunners lifting the [[2017 FA Community Shield|2017 Community Shield]] by beating Chelsea 4–1 on penalties.<ref name=CS>{{cite web|url= https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=sVwr6MxovYQ|title= Arsenal 1–1 Chelsea (4–1 Pens) – FA Community Shield|website=Youtube.com}}</ref> Bellerín scored his first goal of Arsenal's 2017–18 season in Arsenal's 3–1 victory over [[FC Köln]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41227374|title=Arsenal 3-1 FC Cologne|date=14 September 2017|publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> On 3 January 2018, Bellerin earned a draw for Arsenal against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] with what the [[BBC]] described as 'stunning injury-time strike' in the 92nd minute, having earlier conceded a penalty for a foul on [[Eden Hazard]].<ref>'Match Report: Arsenal: 2 Chelsea 2'. BBC Sport. 3 January 2018. https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42489693</ref> On March 7, 2018, Bellerín was ruled out of the [[UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] 1st leg clash against [[A.C. Milan|Milan]] with an unknown return date.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://metro.co.uk/2018/03/07/hector-bellerin-ruled-arsenals-europa-league-clash-ac-milan-7368948/|title=Hector Bellerin ruled out of Arsenal's Europa League clash with AC Milan}}</ref>
Bellerín missed out the first five weeks of the 2018-2019 season due to a calf problem.<ref name="INDEPENDENT2019">{{cite news |last1=Brown |first1=Luke |title=Why Hector Bellerin’s season-ending injury could not have come at a worse time for Arsenal and Unai Emery |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/arsenal-news-team-hector-bellerin-injury-vs-manchester-united-chelsea-latest-watch-video-a8740571.html |accessdate=26 January 2019 |work=Independent.co.uk (sports) |agency=Independent |date=22 January 2019}}</ref> He was given his first start of the season in a league game against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], in which he, unchallenged, suffered a ruptured anterior cruciate ligament on his left knee and was stretchered off of the pitch in the 70th minute at the [[Emirates Stadium]]. He was later ruled out for nine months, consequently missing the remainder of the season and possibly the start of the 2019-2020 season.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/46954903|title=Hector Bellerin: Arsenal defender out for up to nine months after rupturing ACL|publisher=BBC Sport|date=22 January 2019|accessdate=22 January 2019}}</ref> Arsenal coach [[Unai Emery]] perceives Bellerín as "very mature" and believes that "he is already preparing to come back stronger than before".<ref name="ARSENAL2019">{{cite news |last1=Kelly |first1=Rob |title='Bellerin is mature and can come back stronger' |url=https://www.arsenal.com/news/bellerin-mature-and-can-come-back-stronger |accessdate=26 January 2019 |work=Arsenal News |agency=Arsenal |date=23 January 2019}}</ref><ref name="GOAL2019">{{cite news |last1=Storer |first1=Tom |title=Bellerin mature enough to come back stronger for Arsenal - Emery |url=https://www.goal.com/en/news/bellerin-mature-enough-to-come-back-stronger-for-arsenal/f8865e3f8pyg151fhuhph128y |accessdate=26 January 2019 |work=Goal |agency=Goal.com |date=23 January 2019}}</ref>
== International career == Having reached the semi-finals of the [[2013 UEFA European Under-19 Championship|2013 European Championship]] with the [[Spain national under-19 football team|under-19 team]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sefutbol.com/en/future-theirs-hector-bellerin-speed-embodied-footballer|title=The Future is theirs: Héctor Bellerín, speed embodied in a footballer|publisher=Real Federación Española de Fútbol|date=16 May 2015|accessdate=30 May 2015}}</ref> Bellerín made his debut for [[Albert Celades]]'s [[Spain national under-21 football team|under-21 team]] on 30 March 2015, playing the full 90 minutes of a 4–0 friendly win over Belarus in [[León, Spain|León]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sefutbol.com/en/match-report-spains-u21-xxx|title=MATCH REPORT: Spain thrashes Belarus (4–0)|publisher=Real Federación Española de Fútbol|first=Antonio D.|last=Muñoz|date=30 March 2015|accessdate=30 May 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150403055342/http://www.sefutbol.com/en/match-report-spains-u21-xxx|archivedate=3 April 2015}}</ref>
On 29 May 2016, after being named as a stand-by player for [[UEFA Euro 2016|the year's European Championship]], Bellerín made his debut for [[Spain national football team|the full squad]] by starting in a 3–1 friendly win against [[Bosnia and Herzegovina national football team|Bosnia and Herzegovina]] at the [[AFG Arena]] in [[St. Gallen]], Switzerland.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/arsenals-hector-bellerin-makes-spain-8078047|title=Arsenal's Hector Bellerin makes Spain debut as defending champions warm up for Euro 2016 with a win|work=Daily Mirror|date=29 May 2016|accessdate=29 May 2016}}</ref> Two days later, he was chosen for the final squad after [[Dani Carvajal]] withdrew through injury.<ref name=Euros>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36416575|title=Euro 2016: Arsenal's Hector Bellerin in Spain squad after injury forces out Dani Carvajal|publisher=BBC Sport|date=31 May 2016|accessdate=31 May 2016}}</ref> He was unused as they reached the last 16.
== Style of play == <!-- Do not add that he is faster than Usain Bolt, or that his 40 m time is 4.41 seconds. See the talk page for why this is incorrect-->Bellerín is known for his pace, which allows him to take on opposition defenders as well as provide defensive cover. At the beginning of the [[2014–15 Arsenal F.C. season|2014–15 season]], he broke [[Theo Walcott]]'s 40-metre Arsenal sprint record by 1/100th of a second. He is considered to be one of the fastest footballers in the world.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/20150513/bellerin-the-secret-to-my-speed|title=Bellerin – The secret to my speed|last=Jones|first=Max|date=13 May 2015|publisher=Arsenal F.C.}}</ref> Like teammates [[Sead Kolasinac]] and [[Nacho Monreal]], he has received more praise for his attacking abilities,<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.thesun.co.uk/dream-team/fantasy-football/8217912/fantasy-football-tips-premier-league-hector-bellerin-arsenal-game-week-21/|title=Hector Bellerin is fully fit and ready to give you a Dream Team selection headache|last=161385360554578|date=2019-01-17|website=The Sun|language=en-US|access-date=2019-02-04}}</ref> and in the 2018-19 season, Unai Emery has often employed him as a wing-back.
== Personal life == Bellerín became a [[vegan]] in 2017, which he credits for improving his health.<ref>{{cite web|accessdate=3 January 2019|url=https://www.sport.es/es/noticias/premier-league/dieta-hector-bellerin-para-evitar-lesiones-6725295|title=La dieta de Héctor Bellerín para evitar lesiones|language=es|website=[[Sport (Spanish newspaper)|Sport]]|publicationdate=30 March 2018|first=Jonathan |last=Moreno|deadurl=no|archivedate=3 January 2019|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20190103163903/https://www.sport.es/es/noticias/premier-league/dieta-hector-bellerin-para-evitar-lesiones-6725295}}</ref>

{{Use dmy dates|date=June 2018}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Mohamed Elneny | image = Rus-Egy (4).jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = Elneny with [[Egypt national football team|Egypt]] at the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]]. | fullname = Mohamed Naser Elsayed Elneny<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=2 February 2018 |accessdate=10 February 2018}}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1992|7|11|df=y}}<ref name="Premier League">{{cite web |url=http://www.premierleague.com/en-gb/players/profile.overview.html/mohamed-elneny |title=Premier League Player Profile Mohamed Elneny |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=2016 |publisher=Barclays Premier League |access-date=4 February 2016}}</ref> | birth_place = [[El Mahalla El Kubra]], Egypt | height = 1.80 m<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/players/5239/Mohamed-Elneny/overview |title=Mohamed Elneny: Overview |publisher=Premier League |accessdate=1 January 2019}}</ref> | position = [[Midfielder#Defensive midfielder|Defensive midfielder]] | currentclub = [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] | clubnumber = 4 | youthyears1 = 1997–2008 | youthclubs1 = [[Al Ahly SC|Al Ahly]] | youthyears2 = 2008–2010 | youthclubs2 = [[El Mokawloon SC|El Mokawloon]] | years1 = 2010–2013 | clubs1 = [[El Mokawloon SC|El Mokawloon]] | caps1 = 35 | goals1 = 2 | years2 = 2013 | clubs2 = → [[FC Basel|Basel]] (loan) | caps2 = 15 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2013–2016 | clubs3 = [[FC Basel|Basel]] | caps3 = 76 | goals3 = 5 | years4 = 2016– | clubs4 = [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] | caps4 = <!--LEAGUE ONLY-->42<!--LEAGUE ONLY--> | goals4 = <!--LEAGUE ONLY-->0<!--LEAGUE ONLY--> | nationalyears1 = 2009–2011 | nationalteam1 = [[Egypt national under-20 football team|Egypt U20]] | nationalcaps1 = 7 | nationalgoals1 = 2 | nationalyears2 = 2010–2015 | nationalteam2 = [[Egypt national under-23 football team|Egypt U23]] | nationalcaps2 = 5 | nationalgoals2 = 1 | nationalyears3 = 2011– | nationalteam3 = [[Egypt national football team|Egypt]] | nationalcaps3 = 67 | nationalgoals3 = 6 | pcupdate = 22:23, 9 February 2019 (UTC) | ntupdate = 20:29, 8 September 2018 (UTC) }} '''Mohamed Naser Elsayed Elneny''' ({{Lang-arz|محمد ناصر السيد الننى}} {{transl|arz|ALA|maḥamad nāṣṣer e-sayyed}} {{transl|arz|el nenny}}, {{IPA-arz|mæˈħæm.mæd ˈnɑːseɾ esˈsæj.jed enˈnen.ni|pron}}; born 11 July 1992)<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.tahrirnews.com/posts/360941/%D9%82%D8%B5%D8%A9+%D8%B5%D8%B9%D9%88%D8%AF+%C2%AB%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%86%D9%86%D9%8A%C2%BB..+%D9%85%D9%86+%D8%B4%D9%88%D8%A7%D8%B1%D8%B9+%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%85%D8%AD%D9%84%D8%A9+%D8%A5%D9%84%D9%89+%D8%B9%D8%A7%D8%B5%D9%85%D8%A9+%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B6%D8%A8%D8%A7%D8%A8 |title=قصة صعود "النني".. من شوارع المحلة إلى عاصمة الضباب للمزيد |last=Hamdallah |first=Abu Bakr |date=30 December 2016 |website= |publisher=Tahrir News|access-date=}}</ref> simply known as '''Mohamed Elneny''',<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.facebook.com/ElNennyM |title=El-Neny's official facebook page}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.arsenal.com/first-team/players/mohamed-elneny |title=Mohamed Elneny |last= |first= |date= |website=Arsenal |publisher=|access-date=}}</ref> is an Egyptian professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[midfielder]] for {{English football updater|Arsenal}} club [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] and the [[Egypt national football team|Egypt national team]].
He began his senior career at [[El Mokawloon SC|El Mokawloon]] and moved to [[FC Basel|Basel]] in January 2013. He won eight honours at Basel, including the [[Swiss Super League]] in each of his four seasons. In January 2016, he was transferred to Arsenal.
Elneny competed at the [[Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament|2012 Summer Olympics]] for the [[Egypt national under-23 football team|Egyptian Under-23 team]].
==Club career== ===El Mokawloon=== Elneny played his youth football with [[Al Ahly SC|Al Ahly]]. In 2008, he transferred to [[El Mokawloon SC]] during the [[2007–08 Egyptian Premier League|2010–2011 season]]. Elneny advanced and became a regular in the starting team. Following the [[Port Said Stadium disaster]], early February 2012, the Egyptian Premier League was stopped and all subsequent matches of the [[2011–12 Egyptian Premier League]] were postponed. On 10 March 2012, the [[Egyptian Football Association]] announced their decision to cancel the remainder of the season.<ref name=BBC>{{cite news |title=Egypt's Premier League cancelled |work=BBC Sport |publisher=British Broadcasting Corporation |date=10 March 2012 |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17324997 |accessdate=11 March 2012}}</ref>
===Basel=== [[File:Mohamed Elneny.jpg|thumb|left|Elneny in 2013]]
[[FC Basel]] had been watching Elneny for some time and invited him to their training camp in [[Estepona]] from 14 to 24 January 2013. Elneny played his unofficial debut on 18 January 2013 during the friendly match against [[FC Steaua București|Steaua București]], a 1–1 draw. Elneny was able to impress Basel's trainer [[Murat Yakin]] during the training camp and on 29 January 2013, it was announced that he had signed a loan contract with Basel up until the end of June 2013.<ref name="fcb 1">{{cite web |last=FC Basel 1893 |first= |authorlink= |coauthors= |year=2013 |url=http://www.fcb.ch/news/show/byItemID/de-de/10044/29486/26/7/7 |title=Der Ägypter Mohamed Elneny wechselt leihweise zum FCB |format= |work= |publisher=FC Basel 1893 |accessdate=29 January 2012 |language=de | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20140107195057/http://www.fcb.ch/news/show/byItemID/de-de/10044/29486/26/7/7 | archive-date = 7 January 2014 | dead-url = yes |df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref name="ahram1">{{cite web |last=Mosselhi |first=Mohamad |authorlink= |coauthors= |year=2013 |url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/6/53/63624/Sports/Talents-Abroad/Egypt-midfielder-ElNenny-joins-Swiss-side-Basel-on.aspx |title=Arab Contractors midfielder Mohamed El-Nenny signs a six-month loan deal with Swiss side Basel |format= |work= |publisher=ahram.org.eg |accessdate=29 January 2012}}</ref><ref name=" kingfut.com 1">{{cite web |last=King Fut |first= |authorlink= |coauthors= |year=2013 |url=http://www.kingfut.com/2013/01/29/official-el-nenny-seals-loan-to-fc-basel/ |title=OFFICIAL: FC Basel sign Mohamed El-Nenny on loan |format= |work= |publisher=kingfut.com |accessdate=29 January 2012}}</ref> Elneny played his official debut for Basel in the [[2012–13 Swiss Super League|2012–13 Swiss Super League season]] on 10 February 2013 in the 3–0 home win against [[FC Sion|Sion]] as he was substituted in at half time.
At the end of the [[2012–13 Swiss Super League|Swiss Super League season 2012–13]] Elneny won the Championship title<ref name="eufa 2013-06-10">{{cite web |last=Schifferle |first=Michael |authorlink= |coauthors= |year=2013 |url=http://www.uefa.com/memberassociations/association=sui/news/newsid=1959420.html |title=Season review: Switzerland |work= |publisher=Eufa |accessdate=10 June 2013}}</ref> and was [[2012–13 Swiss Cup|Swiss Cup runner up]] with Basel.<ref name="sfv2013-05-20">{{cite web |last=SFV |first= |authorlink= |coauthors= |year=2013 |url=http://www.football.ch/de/SFV/Schweizer-Cup/Schweizer-Cup-Maenner/Statistik-und-Resultate-Schweizer-Cup/Telegramm-Schweizer-Cup.aspx/tg-2132469/ |title=Telegramm Schweizer Cup Final |format= |work= |publisher=Schweizerischer Fussballverband |accessdate=20 May 2013 |language=de}}</ref> In the [[2012–13 UEFA Europa League]] Basel advanced as far as the [[2012–13 UEFA Europa League knockout phase#Semi-finals|semi-finals]], there being matched against the reigning [[UEFA Champions League]] holders [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], but they were knocked out, losing both home and away ties, beaten 2–5 on aggregate.<ref name="eufa 2013-05-03">{{cite web |last=Haylett |first=Trevor |authorlink= |coauthors= |year=2013 |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/news/newsid=1945605.html#basel+take+heart |title=Basel take heart after Chelsea defeat |format= |work= |publisher=Eufa |accessdate=3 May 2013}}</ref>
During May 2013 Basel announced that they had taken up the option of signing the Egyptian midfielder on a permanent basis. He signed a four-year contract up-until 30 June 2017.<ref name="fcb 2013-05-03">{{cite web |last=Elassal |first=Mahmoud |authorlink= |coauthors= |year=2013 |url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/6/53/70641/Sports/Talents-Abroad/Basel-take-up-option-to-buy-Egypts-ElNeny.aspx |title=Basel take up option to buy Egypt's Elneny |format= |work= |publisher=ahramonline |accessdate=3 May 2013}}</ref> He scored his first goal for Basel, the last goal of the match, in the 4–2 home win at the [[St. Jakob-Park]] against [[FC Zurich|Zurich]] on 16 April 2014.<ref name="fcb-2014-04-16">{{cite web |last=Marti |first=Caspar |authorlink= |coauthors= |year=2014 |url=http://www.fcb.ch/news/show/byItemID/de-de/10044/32106/26/7/7 |title=Der FCB festigt seine Leaderposition mit einem 4:2 gegen den FCZ |format= |work= |publisher=FC Basel 1893 |accessdate=16 April 2014 | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20140426232551/http://www.fcb.ch/news/show/byItemID/de-de/10044/32106/26/7/7 | archive-date = 26 April 2014 | dead-url = yes |df=dmy-all}}</ref> At the end of the [[2013–14 Swiss Super League|2013–14 Super League season]] Elneny won the league championship with Basel.<ref name="fcb 2014-05-18">{{cite web |last=Grossenbacher |first=Sacha |authorlink= |coauthors= |year=2014 |url=http://www.fcb.ch/de-CH/Saison/Saisonspiel?m=2816 |title=Fotos vom Spiel gegen Lausanne sowie den anschliessenden Feierlichkeiten |format= |work= |publisher=FC Basel 1893 |accessdate=18 May 2014 |language=de}}</ref> They also reached the final of the [[2013–14 Swiss Cup]], but were beaten 2–0 by [[FC Zürich|Zürich]] after extra time. During the [[2013–14 UEFA Champions League|2013–14 Champions League season]] Basel reached the [[2013–14 UEFA Champions League group stage|group stage]] and finished the group in third position. Thus they qualified for [[2013–14 UEFA Europa League knockout phase|Europa League knockout phase]] and here they advanced as far as the quarter-finals. In their [[2013–14 FC Basel season|season 2013–14]] Basel played a total of 68 matches (36 Swiss League fixtures, 6 Swiss Cup, 6 Champions League and 10 Europa League and 10 test matches). Elneny totaled 55 appearances, 32 League, 4 Cup, 6 Champions League and 6 Europa League as well 7 in the test games.<ref name="Rotblau Jahrbuch">{{Cite book |last1=Zindel |first1=Josef |title=Rotblau: Jahrbuch Saison 2014/2015 |place= |publisher=FC Basel Marketing AG |year=2014 |url= |ISBN=978-3-7245-2027-6}}</ref> He scored just that one goal in the league.
The season 2014–15 was a very successful one for Elneny and FC Basel. The championship was won for the sixth time in a row [[2014–15 Swiss Super League|that season]]<ref name="fcb 2015-05-29">{{cite web |last=Marti |first=Caspar |authorlink= |coauthors= |year=2015 |url=http://www.fcb.ch/de-CH/News/2015/05/29/Der-Meisterfreitag-im-bunten-Zeitraffer |title=Der Meisterfreitag im bunten Zeitraffer |format= |work= |publisher=FC Basel 1893 |accessdate=29 May 2015}} {{de icon}}</ref> and in the [[2014–15 Swiss Cup]] they reached the final. But for the third season in a row, they finished as runners-up, losing 0–3 to [[FC Sion]] in the final. Basel entered the [[2014–15 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] in the [[2014–15 UEFA Champions League group stage|group stage]] and reached the [[2014–15 UEFA Champions League knockout phase|knockout phase]] as on 9 December 2014 they managed a 1–1 draw at [[Anfield]] against [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/29363537 |title=Liverpool 1 Basel 1 |date=10 December 2014 |work=BBC Sport |accessdate=10 December 2014}}</ref> But then Basel then lost to Porto in the [[2014–15 UEFA Champions League#Round of 16|Round of 16]]. Basel played a total of 65 matches (36 Swiss League fixtures, 6 Swiss Cup, 8 Champions League and 15 test matches). Under manager [[Paulo Sousa]] Elneny totaled 51 appearances, 29 in the Super League, 6 in the Cup and 7 in the Champions League, as well 9 in test games. He scored 5 goals in these matches.<ref name="Rotblau Jahrbuch Nr.02">{{Cite book |last1=Zindel |first1=Josef |title=Rotblau: Jahrbuch Saison 2015/2016 |place= |publisher=FC Basel Marketing AG |year=2015 |url= |ISBN=978-3-7245-2050-4}}</ref>
Despite the fact that Elneny left the club during the winter break, under their new trainer [[Urs Fischer (footballer)|Urs Fischer]] Basel won the [[Swiss Super League]] championship at the end of the [[2015–16 Swiss Super League|2015–16 Super League season]]. For Elneny it was the fourth title, for the club it was the seventh in a row and their 19th championship title in total.<ref name="fcb 2016-04-30">{{cite web |first=Casper |last=Marti |authorlink= |coauthors= |year=2016 |url=http://www.fcb.ch/de-CH/News/2016/04/30/FCB-Sion |title=Es ist vollbracht ! Der FCB ist zum 19. Mal Meister |format= |work= |publisher=FC Basel 1893 |accessdate=30 April 2016}}</ref>
===Arsenal=== [[File:Arsenal Vs Burnley (24108353364).jpg|thumb|Elneny on his Arsenal debut against Burnley in January 2016]] On 13 January 2016, after a 3–3 draw against [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]], Arsenal manager [[Arsène Wenger]] confirmed the signing of Elneny from FC Basel.<ref>{{cite news |title=Mohamed Elneny: Arsenal confirm signing from Basel |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/35308910 |accessdate=14 January 2016 |work=BBC Sport |date=14 January 2016}}</ref> The following day, the transfer was officially confirmed by the club for an undisclosed fee reported to be somewhere between £5 million and £7.4 million.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Mohamed Elneny joins Arsenal |url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/20160114/mohamed-elneny-joins-arsenal |publisher=[[Arsenal F.C.]] |date=14 January 2016 |accessdate=14 January 2016}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |title=Confirmed: Arsenal finally announce signing of midfielder Mohamed Elneny |url=http://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/634600/Confirmed-Arsenal-finally-announce-signing-of-midfielder-Mohamed-Elneny |publisher=[[Daily Express]] |date=14 January 2016 |accessdate=14 January 2016}}</ref> He was assigned the number 35 shirt for Arsenal.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Mohamed Elneny: Player Profile Arsenal |url=http://www.arsenal.com/first-team/players/mohamed-elneny |publisher=[[Arsenal F.C.]] |date=14 January 2016 |accessdate=14 January 2016}}</ref> He made his debut for the club in a 2–1 win against [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] in the fourth round of the [[FA Cup]], on 30 January.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Flanagan |first1=Chris |title=Why Elneny impressed on debut: 5 things from Arsenal 2–1 Burnley |url=http://www.fourfourtwo.com/features/why-elneny-impressed-debut-5-things-arsenal-2-1-burnley#:YDpBT902moZmcA |website=FourFourTwo |accessdate=30 January 2016 |date=30 January 2016}}</ref> Elneny scored his first Arsenal goal in the [[2015–16 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] Round of 16 second leg defeat against [[FC Barcelona]], and was later awarded Arsenal's Player of the Month award for March. He also starred in April combining well with [[Aaron Ramsey]], winning the Arsenal's Player of the Month award for a second month. Elneny's only goal won him the goal of the season award for Arsenal.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Elneny tops Goal of the Season poll |url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/20160523/elneny-tops-goal-of-the-season-poll |publisher=[[Arsenal F.C.]] |date=22 May 2016 |accessdate=25 May 2016}}</ref> In the 2017/18 season, on 7 December 2017, Elneny scored his first goal at the Emirates Stadium (his second for Arsenal overall) in the [[2017-18 UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] Group Stage against [[FC BATE Borisov]] in a match which ended 6–0 to the home side.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en-ke/news/first-emirates-stadium-goal-means-a-lot-to-arsenals-mohamed/1njr8qq1vu3pk1od4w8ast5hjg |title=Arsenal's Mohamed Elneny pleased with first goal in the Emirates Stadium - Goal.com |publisher=}}</ref> On 15 February, Elneny again produced a commendable display in the first leg of Arsenal's round of 32 [[UEFA Europa League|Europa league]] tie against [[Östersunds FK]]. Elneny was subsequently rewarded man of the match for his effort in a 3–0 away victory.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43050414 |title=Ostersunds FK 0–3 Arsenal |date=15 February 2018 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=18 February 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref>
On 26 March 2018, Elneny renewed his contract with Arsenal.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.arsenal.com/news/mo-elneny-signs-contract-extension |title=Mo Elneny signs contract extension |website=www.arsenal.com}}</ref>
On 8 April 2018, Elneny was sent off against [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]]. In a tight game defender [[Jack Stephens (footballer)|Jack Stephens]] tussled with [[Jack Wilshere]] and retaliation from Stephens resulted in referee [[Andre Marriner]] giving him a straight red. Wilshere escaped with just a yellow card but in the aftermath, Elneny received a red card after a shove on [[Cédric Soares]]. Arsenal held on to win 3–2.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/943121/Arsenal-Mohamed-Elneny-red-card-Southampton-video-watch |title=Did you see why Mohamed Elneny was sent off against Southampton? |publisher=Express |date=8 April 2018| access-date= 9 April 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43609100 |title=Arsenal 3–2 Southampton |publisher=BBC Sport |date=8 April 2018|access-date= 9 April 2018}}</ref>
==International career== Elneny helped the [[Egypt national under-23 football team|National Under-23 team]] qualify for the [[Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament|2012 Olympics]],<ref name=BBC/> where he played in all four games as the team reached the last eight, and were knocked out by Japan.{{citation needed|date=February 2017}}
He was in the Egypt National First Team squad in the Africa Cup of Nations 2017 in Gabon, which came as Runners-up.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.cafonline.com/en-us/competitions/31theditionofafricancupofnationtotal,gabon2017/TeamDetails/Home?TeamsIDs=MuM2AcKem%2bfAOqvO60gI4lu%2fw9Txaot5Yw%2foRoU%2b0kxn1p6zmn0xCeAalsWOFqpM |title=2017 AFCON {{!}} Egypt|last=|first=|date=|website=|access-date=24 January 2018}}</ref> He also helped the team qualify to the 2018 FIFA World Cup tournament in Russia, this is the third time for the Egyptians to participate in the competition after the 1934 and 1990 editions.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/matches/round=276412/match=300367133/index.html#nosticky |title=Egypt vs. Congo Lineup |last= |first= |date=9 October 2017 |website=FIFA|access-date=24 January 2018}}</ref>

Lorient|Lorient]] | caps3 = 35 | goals3 = 3 | years4 = 2010– | clubs4 = [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] | caps4 = 249 | goals4 = 22 | nationalyears1 = 2011–2018 | nationalteam1 = [[France national football youthclubs6 = [[En Avant Guingamp|Guingamp]] }} '''Laurent Koscielny''' ({{IPA-fr|loʁɑ̃ kosjɛlni, lɔ-}}; {{lang-pl|Kościelny}}, {{IPA-pl|kɔˈɕtɕɛlnɨ|pron}}; born 10 September 1985) is a French professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[centre back]] for {{English football updater|Arsenal}} club [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]], where he is club [[Captain (association football)|captain]].
Born in [[Tulle]], Koscielny began his football career playing for a host of youth clubs before moving to [[En Avant Guingamp|Guingamp]] in 2003, where he quickly progressed through the youth ranks, making his professional debut the following season. After becoming frustrated at being played out of position as a [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|right back]], he joined [[Tours FC|Tours]] for an undisclosed fee, quickly establishing himself as the team's star player in his desired position, ultimately aiding in the club's promotion into [[Ligue 1]], while also being named in the [[Ligue 2]] Team of the Season.<ref name="autogeneratedcc"/> Koscielny continued his impressive performances following a €1.7 million transfer to fellow French outfit [[FC Lorient|Lorient]] in 2009, receiving multiple plaudits for his performances, largely cultivating a reputation as a clever, agile, ball-playing [[Defender (association football)|defender]].<ref name="autogeneratedcc">{{cite web |url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/player/_/id/88970/laurent-koscielny?cc=3436 |title=Laurent Koscielny Bio, Stats, News |publisher=ESPN |date=10 September 1985 |accessdate=2011-12-14}}</ref> His achievements and footballing potential attracted [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]], ultimately moving to the [[Premier League]] side for a fee of £8.45 million the following season.
Following his arrival in England, Koscielny was regarded to be one of the best players in his position, as well as one of the best in the world.<ref>{{cite web |last=Smith |first=Peter |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11095/9777914/terry-kompany-koscielny-who-is-the-premier-leagues-best-centre-back |title=Terry, Kompany, Koscielny? Who is the Premier League's best centre-back? | Football News |publisher=[[Sky Sports]] |date= |accessdate=2016-09-24}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.arsenal.com/first-team/players/laurent-koscielny/2010/11 |title=Laurent Koscielny |publisher=Arsenal.com |accessdate=2011-12-14}}</ref> He had established himself as a core component in the Arsenal first team, as well as contributing with a host of individual performances, including aiding in ending the club's [[History of Arsenal F.C. (1966–present)|nine-year trophy drought]], scoring a crucial equalizer en route to winning the [[FA Cup]] in [[2014 FA Cup Final|2014]]. He was also crucial in further club successes that followed, winning another FA Cup and the [[FA Community Shield]] twice.
Despite qualifying to represent [[Poland national football team|Poland]], Koscielny instead decided to represent [[France national football team|France]], and first appeared up for the national team against [[Brazil national football team|Brazil]] in February 2011.<ref name=kosso>{{cite news |url=http://www.rmc.fr/edito/sport/86852/koscielny-songe-lui-aussi-a-prendre-la-nationalite-polonaise/ |title=Koscielny songe lui aussi à prendre la nationalité polonaise |date=19 August 2009 |work=RMC.fr}}</ref> Koscielny has since become a regular starter for the nation in every major tournament that they have appeared in, including [[UEFA Euro 2012]] and the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]], while also leading France to the final of [[UEFA Euro 2016]], which they lost to Portugal.<ref>https://www.theguardian.com/football/live/2016/jul/10/portugal-v-france-euro-2016-final-live</ref> He scored his first international goal in a [[Exhibition game|friendly]] match against Scotland in 2016,<ref name="ESPN">{{cite news |url=http://www.espnfc.com/international-friendly/53/video/2886233/friendly-koscielnys-first-france-goal |title=Friendly: Koscielny's first France goal |date=4 June 2016 |accessdate=5 June 2016 |work=ESPN}}</ref> and amassed fifty-one [[Cap (sport)|appearances]] for the national side. He retired from international football in 2018.
==Club career==
===Early career=== Koscielny was born in [[Tulle]], [[Corrèze]]. His career began in 2004 with [[EA Guingamp|Guingamp]], a team that had produced such talents as [[Didier Drogba]] and [[Florent Malouda]]. Three years later, Koscielny was forced to take stock and drop down to the French third tier. He made 47 appearances for Guingamp, between 2004 and 2007, mostly as a right fullback. {{citation needed|date=September 2014}}
In 2007, Koscielny joined [[Tours FC]], deciding that he wanted a chance at centre back. He showed remarkable improvement in aerial ability and positional awareness that limited him to just three yellow cards. During the 2008–09 season, Koscielny made 34 [[Ligue 2]] appearances, scoring 5 goals from defence, and was named in the division's best XI at the end of the season.<ref name="autogeneratedcc"/>
===Lorient=== On 16 June 2009, newly promoted [[Ligue 1]] side [[FC Lorient]] signed Koscielny on a four-year contract for around €1.7 million. He established himself as a starter and played in his preferred centre-back position. Over one season at the club, he scored 3 goals in 35 appearances. On 7 March 2010 Koscielny tapped in his first Ligue 1 goal against Olympique Marseille at Stade Vélodrome in the 65th minute in a 1–1 draw. Koscielny became a fan favourite when he scored his second goal with a header deep in injury time against Montpellier in a 2–2 draw after a cross from [[Olivier Monterrubio]]. {{citation needed|date=September 2014}}
He scored another against Bordeaux after 11 minutes. However, he received a red card 15 minutes later for a foul in the penalty area against his future Arsenal teammate [[Marouane Chamakh]]. Koscielny helped Lorient to finish the campaign in 7th place; its best finish in Ligue 1. An impressive season culminated in reports from French daily ''Ouest-France'' that the defender was training with the Arsenal reserves ahead of an official announcement. On 6 July 2010, Koscielny agreed personal terms with Arsenal. Arsenal's initial offer for Koscielny was believed to be in the region of £4 million, while they were then prepared to do a deal that would also involve youngster [[Francis Coquelin]] moving on loan in the opposite direction, which Lorient rejected.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,11670_6201064,00.html |work=Sky Sports |title=Arsenal warned off Koscielny |date=11 June 2010}}</ref> During the summer transfer window of 2010 reports began to emerge in late June that a deal had been reached to bring Koscielny to Arsenal for a reported sum of £8.45 million. {{citation needed|date=September 2014}}
===Arsenal===
====2010–11 season==== {{Quote box | width=30% | align=right | quote= "I don't believe any French player would have refused to come and play for Arsenal. It took me four years to go from the bench of Ligue 2 to Arsenal so it is a great achievement. I have been on the crest of a wave for the last few years. But it is just the beginning; I haven't proved anything yet. Arsenal is a reference for football." |source= <small>Laurent Koscielny<ref name="autogeneratedcc"/> </small> }} Arsenal confirmed the signing on 7 July 2010 and Koscielny was handed the club's number 6 shirt, previously worn by [[Philippe Senderos]], who had moved to [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] earlier in the summer. Wenger explained he bought Koscielny due to the fact he added height to the team and Arsenal were low on centre backs.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/teams/a/arsenal/8798237.stm |title=Arsenal sign Lorient defender Laurent Koscielny |date=7 July 2010 |work=BBC Sport |publisher=BBC |accessdate=2010-07-07}}</ref> Koscielny made his debut against [[Barnet F.C.|Barnet]] in a pre-season friendly in July 2010. One month later in his competitive debut against [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] at [[Anfield]], he was sent off in the 94th minute for a second bookable offence. Both of his yellow cards were shown beyond 90 minutes. The game ended in a 1–1 draw with both teams having debut players sent off.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/8909559.stm |title=Liverpool 1–1 Arsenal |date=15 August 2010 |work=BBC Sport |publisher=BBC Sport |first=Mandeep |last=Sanghera |accessdate=2010-08-15}}</ref> He scored his first goal for Arsenal on 11 September 2010, in a 4–1 win against [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/8976732.stm |title=Arsenal 4–1 Bolton |first=Pranav |last=Soneji |publisher=BBC |date=11 September 2010 |accessdate=30 December 2010}}</ref>
Koscielny made his debut in European competition on 15 September 2010, when he partnered [[Sébastien Squillaci]] in a 6–0 win over [[S.C. Braga|Braga]] at the [[Emirates Stadium]]. Koscielny was praised for performances against [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] and made a brilliant tackle against [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] to stop [[Aaron Lennon]] from scoring during their [[2010–11 Football League Cup|Football League Cup]] tie. On 27 October, he blocked a shot off the line and provided an assist to [[Theo Walcott]] against [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] in the fourth round of the League Cup, where Arsenal went on to win the match 4–0 at [[St James' Park]]. Koscielny was given a straight red card in Arsenal's 0–1 loss at home against Newcastle United on 7 November 2010. This was his second sending off of the season.
[[File:Danny Graham, Laurent Koscielny, Nathan Dyer & Kieran Gibbs.jpg|thumb|left|250px|Koscielny playing for Arsenal on 10 September 2011 against [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]].]]
On 25 January 2011, Koscielny scored the second goal in the 3–0 win over [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]] in the League Cup semi-final second leg win at the Emirates Stadium. Throughout January 2011, Koscielny and [[Johan Djourou]] were a part of a defence that did not concede a goal in the Premier League. On 1 February, he scored his third goal of the season, which proved to be the winner in a 2–1 turn around victory over [[Everton F.C.|Everton]]. Koscielny had arguably his best performance to date for Arsenal in the first leg of the [[2010-11 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] [[2010-11 UEFA Champions League knockout phase|round of 16]] match against [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]]. The match ended in a 2–1 home win for Arsenal. Koscielny's performances were applauded and praised in many media reports of the game. Former Arsenal defender, [[Martin Keown]], said his performance was "impressive" and "magnificent throughout".<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.sport.co.uk/news/Football/50534/He_really_bullied_Barcelonas_players.aspx |first=Ben |last=Moss |title=He really bullied Barcelona's players |publisher=Sport.co.uk |date=17 February 2011 |accessdate=2011-12-14}}</ref> On 27 February, in the last minute of the [[2011 Football League Cup Final]], Koscielny was involved in a mix-up with his goalkeeper [[Wojciech Szczęsny]], which resulted in [[Birmingham City F.C.|Birmingham City]] striker [[Obafemi Martins]] scoring the winning goal.<ref>{{cite news |last=McCarra |first=Kevin |title=Obafemi Martins grabs glory as Birmingham beat Arsenal |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2011/feb/27/arsenal-birmingham-city-carling-cup-final |accessdate=18 May 2014 |newspaper=[[The Guardian]] |date=27 February 2011}}</ref>
====2011–12 season==== [[File:Fernando Torres & Laurent Koscielny 2.jpg|thumb|right|Koscielny and [[Fernando Torres]] in a Premier League match on 21 April 2012.]] Koscielny started the [[2011–12 Arsenal F.C. season|2011–12 season]] alongside [[Thomas Vermaelen]] in central defence. Koscielny was injured and taken off the pitch 10 minutes into a 2–0 home loss to [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] on 20 August 2011. However, he returned to the starting line-up Arsenal's biggest ever Premier League defeat, losing 8–2 to [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] at [[Old Trafford]]. On 17 September, Koscielny scored an own goal as Arsenal lost 4–3 to [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]] in the Premier League. He went on to be named man of the match away at [[Olympique de Marseille|Olympique Marseille]] in the [[2011–12 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]], where Arsenal won 1–0 at the [[Stade Vélodrome]], keeping their first clean sheet in a Champions League away game since 18 August 2009 against [[Celtic F.C.|Celtic]], where the Gunners had won 2–0.
On 29 October, Koscielny received praise for his solid performance in Arsenal's 5–3 away win against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]]. He scored his first goal of the season on 2 January 2012 in a 2–1 away defeat against Fulham. He scored his first Champions League goal against [[A.C. Milan]] in a 3–0 victory in the [[2011–12 UEFA Champions League knockout phase|round of 16]] second leg. On 13 May 2012, he scored the winning goal in a 3–2 victory against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] to ensure that Arsenal finished third in the Premier League. He was voted as the team's fourth most important player by the fans in Arsenal's Player of the Season poll for his performances throughout the 2011–12 season.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/player-of-the-season-in-fourth-place-is |first=Rob |last=Kelly |title=Player of the Season – in fourth place is... |publisher=Arsenal.com |date=29 May 2012 |accessdate=2012-07-23 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120712065025/http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/player-of-the-season-in-fourth-place-is |archivedate=12 July 2012 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
====2012–13 season==== On 24 July 2012, Koscielny signed a new long term contract with Arsenal.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/koscielny-agrees-new-long-term-contract |title=Koscielny agrees new long-term contract |publisher=Arsenal.com |date=24 July 2012 |accessdate=2012-07-24 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120724104225/http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/koscielny-agrees-new-long-term-contract |archivedate=24 July 2012 |df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/news/2896/premier-league/2012/07/24/3261758/koscielny-agrees-to-new-long-term-arsenal-contract |title=Koscielny agrees to new long-term Arsenal contract |publisher=Goal.com |date=24 July 2012 |accessdate=2012-07-24}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.thehindu.com/sport/football/article3678701.ece |title=Koscielny agrees new deal at Arsenal |date=24 July 2012 |location=Chennai, India |work=The Hindu}}</ref> His first goal of the season was a late equaliser against champions [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] on 23 September 2012 in a match which ended 1–1.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2012/sep/23/manchester-city-arsenal-match-report |title=Laurent Koscielny rescues point for Arsenal at Manchester City |work=The Guardian |date=24 July 2012 |accessdate=2012-07-24 |location=London |first=Daniel |last=Taylor}}</ref> On 30 October, he scored a header from a corner in the 88th minute against [[Reading F.C.|Reading]] in the [[2012–13 Football League Cup|Football League Cup]], helping Arsenal come back from 4–0 down to eventually win the game 7–5.<ref name = "Reading 301012">{{cite web |last=Smith |first=Ben |title=Reading 5 – 7 Arsenal |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20053678 |work=BBC Sport |accessdate=30 December 2012 |date=30 October 2012}}</ref>
On 13 March 2013, Koscielny scored against [[FC Bayern Munich|Bayern Munich]] at the [[Allianz Arena]] in the [[2012–13 UEFA Champions League#Round of 16|UEFA Champions League Last 16]]. His goal put Arsenal 2–0 ahead on the night and level at 3–3 on aggregate, but they still exited the competition on the [[away goals rule]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21681052 |title=Bayern Munich 0–2 Arsenal |publisher=BBC Sport |date=13 March 2013 |accessdate=14 March 2013}}</ref>
On 19 May, Koscielny scored the winning goal as Arsenal beat Newcastle United 1–0 at St James' Park in their final Premier League fixture of the season to secure a fourth-placed finish and qualification to the [[2013–14 UEFA Champions League qualifying phase and play-off round|2013–14 UEFA Champions League play-off round]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/newcastle-0-arsenal-1-match-report-gunners-finish-fourth-thanks-to-laurent-koscielny-winner-8622705.html |location=London |work=The Independent |first=Sam |last=Wallace |title=Newcastle 0 Arsenal 1 match report: Gunners finish fourth thanks to Laurent Koscielny winner |date=19 May 2013}}</ref>
Koscielny was voted as Arsenal's second best player of the season.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/player-of-the-season-2nd-koscielny |title=Player of the Season: 2nd Koscielny |publisher=Arsenal F.C. |date=30 May 2013 |accessdate=15 June 2013 |last=Kelly |first=Rob}}</ref>
====2013–14 season==== Koscielny started the [[2013–14 Arsenal F.C. season|2013–14 season]] by conceding a penalty and getting sent off in Arsenal's 3–1 Premier League opening day defeat at home to [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/23644714 |title=Arsenal 1–3 Aston Villa |date=17 August 2013 |accessdate=9 May 2014 |work=BBC}}</ref> However, his partnership with [[Per Mertesacker]] saw the Gunners achieve the joint-best defensive record in the Premier League at the halfway point of the season, as the team topped the table.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/halfterm-reports-so-who-is-making-the-grade-in-the-premier-league-so-far-9030925.html |title=Half-term reports: So who is making the grade in the Premier League so far? |date=30 December 2013 |accessdate=9 April 2014 |work=The Independent}}</ref>
On 22 February 2014, Koscielny scored his first goal of the season in a 4–1 defeat of [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]].<ref name="Arsenal 4-1 Sunderland">{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/26202635 |title=Arsenal 4–1 Sunderland |date=22 February 2014 |accessdate=9 May 2014 |work=BBC}}</ref> In the team's penultimate home match, Koscielny scored his second goal of the season in a 3–0 win against Newcastle United.<ref name="Arsenal 4-1 Sunderland"/>
On 9 May 2014, Koscielny signed a new long-term contract with Arsenal.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/20140509/koscielny-signs-new-long-term-contract |title=Koscielny signs new long-term contract |accessdate=9 May 2014 |work=Arsenal F.C.}}</ref>
On 17 May, Koscielny scored Arsenal's equalising goal as the team came from 2–0 down to defeat [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] 3–2 in the [[2014 FA Cup Final]], winning his first piece of silverware with the club.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/27354148 |title=Arsenal 3–2 Hull |date=17 May 2014 |accessdate=18 May 2014 |work=BBC}}</ref>
====2014–15 season==== [[File:Chelsea 2 Arsenal 0 Top team performance, top of the league. (15265832150).jpg|thumb|right|Koscielny and [[Kieran Gibbs]] playing for [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] in a match against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] on 5 October 2014]] On 16 August 2014, Koscielny opened his goal-scoring account for the season, scoring [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]]'s first goal in the [[2014–15 Premier League]]. The goal was header from a free-kick in first half stoppage time against [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] at the Emirates Stadium.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28718788 |title=Ramsey scores late Arsenal winner |accessdate=17 August 2014 |date=16 August 2014}}</ref> After sustaining an achilles tendon injury during the October international break, Koscielny was absent from the Arsenal team for seven weeks.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://talksport.com/football/arsenal-line-v-west-brom-defender-make-first-start-seven-weeks-141128126799 |title=Arsenal line-up v West Brom: Defender to make first start in seven weeks? |date=28 November 2014 |accessdate=26 January 2015 |work=TalkSport}}</ref> On 29 November, he returned to Arsenal's starting line-up alongside Per Mertesacker in central defence, as the Gunners kept a clean sheet in a 1–0 victory against West Bromwich Albion at [[The Hawthorns]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/30156733 |title=West Brom 0–1 Arsenal |date=29 November 2014 |accessdate=26 January 2015 |work=BBC}}</ref> In the team's following fixture at home to [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]], Koscielny helped Arsenal to record a second consecutive clean sheet and 1–0 win.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/30204434 |title=Arsenal 1–0 Southampton |date=3 December 2014 |accessdate=26 January 2015 |work=BBC}}</ref>
[[File:1 laurent koscielny 2015.jpg|thumb|left|Koscielny in 2015]]
On 11 January 2015, Koscielny scored the first goal in a 3–0 win over [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/30670776 |title=Arsenal 3–0 Stoke |date=11 January 2015 |accessdate=26 January 2015 |work=BBC}}</ref> On 18 January, he started in central defence as Arsenal shut out defending champions Manchester City to win 2–0 at the [[City of Manchester Stadium]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/30766356 |title=Man City 0–2 Arsenal |date=18 January 2015 |accessdate=26 January 2015 |work=BBC}}</ref> On 10 February, he scored the opening goal as Arsenal defeated [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]] 2–1.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/31106369 |title=Arsenal 2–1 Leicester |accessdate=12 February 2014 |work=BBC}}</ref> On 30 May 2015, Koscielny was selected to start in the [[2015 FA Cup Final]], playing the full 90 minutes in a 4–0 defeat of Aston Villa at [[Wembley Stadium]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/live/football/32563518 |title=FA Cup final – FT: Arsenal 4–0 Villa |date=30 May 2015 |work=BBC}}</ref>
====2015–16 season==== Koscielny started every game in the first month of the season, excluding a 0–0 draw with rivals [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] at [[Emirates Stadium]],<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/33955692 |title=Arsenal 0–0 Liverpool |date=24 August 2015 |accessdate=10 April 2016 |work=BBC}}</ref> due to an injury. Koscielny played a vital part as Arsenal won 5 games out of six in October to go second in the Premier League, with Koscielny scoring in successive Premier League wins against Everton and Swansea.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/34558443 |title=Arsenal 2–1 Everton |date=24 October 2015 |accessdate=10 April 2016 |work=BBC}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/34623949 |title=Swansea City 0–3 Arsenal |date=31 October 2015 |accessdate=10 April 2016 |work=BBC}}</ref> With manager Arsene Wenger opting to play [[Gabriel Paulista]] ahead of vice-captain Per Mertesacker, Koscielny began appearing as captain in February, due to injuries to other captains [[Santi Cazorla]] & [[Mikel Arteta]]. This ended after a 3–2 defeat to Manchester United, when Koscielny missed four games through injury, including a North London derby at [[White Hart Lane]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/35624234 |title=Manchester United 3–2 Arsenal |date=28 February 2016 |accessdate=10 April 2016 |work=BBC}}</ref> He returned in a 3–1 away defeat to Barcelona in the Champions League, as Arsenal exited the competition at the round of 16 for the sixth season running.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/35814925 |title=Champions League: Barcelona 3–1 Arsenal (5–1 agg) |date=16 March 2016 |accessdate=10 April 2016 |work=BBC}}</ref> Koscielny scored his fourth of the season in a 3–3 draw with West Ham.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/35949243 |title=West Ham United 3–3 Arsenal |date=9 April 2016 |accessdate=10 April 2016 |work=BBC}}</ref>
====2016–17 season==== Koscielny started his first game of the season in a goalless draw against Leicester City. On 10 September, he was given the role of captain and scored a fine overhead kick to equalize for the Gunners in a game which they then won 2–1 against Southampton making him Arsenal's highest goal scoring defender in EPL history, with the landmark achieved on his 31st birthday.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://metro.co.uk/2016/04/13/laurent-koscielny-is-arsenals-highest-scoring-defender-in-premier-league-history-5814960/ |title=Arsenal's Koscielny secures legendary status with insane stat |last=Metro.co.uk |first=Mark Brus for |date=2016-04-13 |website=Metro|access-date=2016-09-11}}</ref> Koscielny was involved in a controversial incident at the end of Arsenal's 1–0 win over [[Burnley FC|Burnley]], in which Koscielny and [[Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain]] were involved in a goal which appeared to be scored from an offside position after hitting Koscielny's arm. Neither the perceived deliberate handball or offside offenses were deemed to be infringements and the goal was later correctly credited to Koscielny.<ref>https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37465283</ref><ref>https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2016/10/02/burnley-vs-arsenal-premier-league-live-score/</ref><ref>http://www.arsenal.com/match/report/1617/post/first-team/burnley-arsenal-match-report-</ref> On 12 January 2017, Koscielny, alongside teammates [[Francis Coquelin]] and [[Olivier Giroud]] signed a new long-term contract with Arsenal.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/20170112/french-trio-sign-new-long-term-contracts |title=French trio sign new long-term contracts |date=12 January 2017 |accessdate=12 January 2017 |publisher=Arsenal F.C.}}</ref> Two days later, he made his 200th appearance for Arsenal in the Premier League on a 4–0 away victory against [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.goal.com/en-us/news/85/england/2017/01/14/31518072/koscielny-reaches-200-premier-league-appearances-for-arsenal |title=Koscielny reaches 200 Premier League appearances for Arsenal |date=14 January 2017 |accessdate=18 January 2017 |publisher=Goal.com}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/38539469 |title=Swansea City 0–4 Arsenal |date=14 January 2017 |accessdate=18 January 2017 |publisher=BBC Sports}}</ref>
On the last day of the 2016–17 season he received red card for a tackle on [[Enner Valencia]] of Everton. Arsenal lost an appeal and Koscielny was banned for three games, meaning he would miss the [[2017 FA Cup Final|FA Cup final]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Laurent Koscielny: Arsenal defender to miss FA Cup final after appeal fails |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/40020494 |website=BBC Sport |date=23 May 2017}}</ref>
Although he was absent from the [[FA Cup]] final, Koscielny lifted the trophy alongside [[Per Mertesacker]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Watch Arsenal lift record 13th FA Cup |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/40073630 |website=BBC Sport |date=27 May 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Per Mertesacker: Arsenal hero lifts Community Shield despite gruesome head injury |url=http://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/837857/Per-Mertesacker-Arsenal-Community-Shield-head-injury-sportgalleries |website=Express |date=7 August 2017}}</ref>
====2017–18 season==== On 3 May 2018, Koscielny suffered an Achilles injury during the [[UEFA Europa League]] semi-final second leg match against [[Atlético Madrid]], and was ruled out for at least six months.<ref>{{cite web |title=Laurent Koscielny: Arsenal defender suffers Achilles injury in Europa League semi |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/43994949 |website=BBC Sport |date=3 May 2018}}</ref>
====2018–19 season==== Following the retirement of [[Per Mertesacker]], Koscielny was made captain of [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Unai Emery: Arsenal head coach wants five captains in his team |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/44813124 |publisher=BBC |date=July 12, 2018 |accessdate=July 12, 2018}}</ref>
==International career== [[File:Lloris Torres and Koscielny Sweden-France Euro 2012.jpg|thumb|right|Koscielny (right) and [[Hugo Lloris]] (left) playing for France at [[UEFA Euro 2012|Euro 2012]] against [[Fernando Torres]] and [[Spain national football team|Spain]].]] Koscielny was called up to the [[France national football team|French national team]] on 3 February 2011. Before his call up for France, Koscielny was also eligible to play for [[Poland national football team|Poland]] and initially considered applying for Polish citizenship.<ref name="kosso"/> In August 2010, it was reported that he had not submitted an application and cancelled a meeting with Poland national team coach [[Franciszek Smuda]] in Warsaw on 7 August. Koscielny later declared that his priority was to play for France.<ref name=priority>{{cite news |first=Matt |last=Monaghan |url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/9/england/2010/08/02/2052868/arsenal-defender-laurent-koscielny-has-heart-set-on-call-up |title=Arsenal Defender Laurent Koscielny Has Heart Set On Call Up To France National Team Despite Interest From Poland |date=2 August 2010 |work=goal.com |accessdate=23 August 2010}}</ref>
Koscielny was called up to the French team for the first time on 3 February 2011, for the team's friendly versus [[Brazil national football team|Brazil]] on 9 February.<ref name=callup>{{cite news |url=http://www.fff.fr/individus/selections/der_selection.php?id_selection=1 |title=Arsenal Defender Laurent Koscielny Called up For 9 February 2011 Friendly Against Brazil |date=3 February 2011 |work=fff.fr |accessdate=3 February 2011}}</ref><ref name=callup2>{{cite news |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-1353261/Laurent-Koscielny-handed-France-Patrice-Evra-shunned-despite-eligible-again.html?ITO=1490 |title=Laurent Koscielny handed first France call-up as Patrice Evra shunned despite being eligible again |date=3 February 2011 |work=Daily Mail |accessdate=3 February 2011 |location=London}}</ref> Koscielny made his first appearance for ''les Bleus'' in a friendly match against the [[United States men's national soccer team|United States]] on 11 November, playing the entire match in a 1–0 win.
He made his first appearance in a major tournament during [[UEFA Euro 2012]], when he played the entire match in a 2–0 defeat to [[Spain national football team|Spain]] in the quarter-finals but was voted Man of the Match by the French media. On 15 November 2013, he was sent off in a [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualification (UEFA)|2014 World Cup qualifying]] [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualification – UEFA Second Round|play-off]] against [[Ukraine national football team|Ukraine]].
On 13 May 2014, Koscielny was named in [[Didier Deschamps]]' squad for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]].<ref>{{cite news |title=World Cup 2014: Samir Nasri and Gael Clichy not in France squad |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27401306 |accessdate=14 May 2014 |newspaper=[[BBC Sport]] |date=13 May 2014}}</ref> He made his [[FIFA World Cup]] debut as a substitute for the injured [[Mamadou Sakho]] in a 5–2 defeat of [[Switzerland national football team|Switzerland]] in the team's second group match.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/25285207 |title=Switzerland 2–5 France |date=20 June 2014 |accessdate=21 June 2014 |work=BBC}}</ref> He was then named in the starting line-up for the next match against [[Ecuador national football team|Ecuador]], helping the team to a clean sheet in a 0–0 draw.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/25285420 |title=Ecuador 0–0 France |date=25 June 2014 |accessdate=26 June 2014 |work=BBC}}</ref>
Koscielny was named in the squad for the [[UEFA Euro 2016]] and started in all the matches of France's runners-up campaign. On 4 June 2016, he scored his first international goal in a friendly match against Scotland.<ref name="ESPN"/>
Prior to the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]], Koscielny announced that he would retire from international football after the competition.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.goal.com/en-us/news/koscielny-to-retire-from-france-national-team-after-world/oti1e0u8sugu1facxjhat4awy |title=Arsenal news: Laurent Koscielny to retire from international duty after 2018 World Cup |work=Goal.com|access-date=2017-11-13}}</ref> However, he was not included in the squad after an [[Achilles tendon]] injury ruled him out of contention.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://metro.co.uk/2018/05/04/laurent-koscielny-miss-world-cup-france-confirms-didier-deschamps-7522222/ |title=Laurent Koscielny to miss World Cup with France, confirms Didier Deschamps |date=4 May 2018 |accessdate=20 May 2018 |work=Metro}}</ref>
==Personal life== His grandfather and his great-grandfather were Polish miners who worked in the North of France. He has a brother who is 10 years older than him and played in the amateur leagues and now trains at Argentat football club. His father also played in the fourth division of French football for many clubs before becoming a manager.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.getfootballnewsfrance.com/2016/laurent-koscielnys-entire-interview-with-lequipe-magazine/ |title=Laurent Koscielny’s entire interview with L’Équipe Magazine |publisher=getfootballnewsfrance.com |date=20 October 2016 |accessdate=2016-10-20}}</ref> He is married to his long time girlfriend Claire Beaudouin.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.101greatgoals.com/news/social/arsenal-defender-laurent-koscielny-gets-married-to-claire-beaudouin-pictures/ |title=Arsenal defender Laurent Koscielny gets married to Claire Beaudouin |date=10 June 2015 |accessdate=2016-10-20}}</ref>
==Career statistics== [[File:Laurent Koscielny v Sunderland - 22 Feb 2014 (cropped).jpg|thumb|right|Koscielny celebrating a goal against [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] in a Premier League match on 22 February 2014.]]
