{{Use dmy dates|date=June 2018}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Stephan Lichtsteiner | image = Stephan Lichtsteiner 2018 (cropped).jpg | image_size = | caption = Lichtsteiner with [[Switzerland national football team|Switzerland]] at the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] | fullname = Stephan Lichtsteiner{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/844127 |title=2018/19 Premier League squads confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=3 September 2018 |accessdate=4 September 2018}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1984|1|16|df=y}}{{cite web |url=https://www.fifadata.com/document/fwc/2014/pdf/fwc_2014_squadlists.pdf |title=2014 FIFA World Cup Brazil: List of players: Switzerland |publisher=FIFA |format=PDF |page=30 |date=14 July 2014 |accessdate=4 September 2018}} | birth_place = [[Adligenswil]], Switzerland | height = 1.82 m{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/players/5520/Stephan-Lichtsteiner/overview |title=Stephan Lichtsteiner: Overview |publisher=Premier League |accessdate=8 January 2019}} | position = [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|Right-back]]
[[Defender (association football)#Wing-back|Right wing-back]]
[[Midfielder#Winger|Right midfielder]] | currentclub = [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] | clubnumber = 12 | youthyears1 = 1991–1996 | youthclubs1 = FC Adligenswil | youthyears2 = 1996–2000 | youthclubs2 = [[FC Luzern|Luzern]] | youthyears3 = 2000–2001 | youthclubs3 = [[Grasshopper Club Zürich|Grasshopper]] | years1 = 2001–2005 |clubs1 = [[Grasshopper Club Zürich|Grasshopper]] |caps1 = 79 |goals1 = 4 | years2 = 2005–2008 |clubs2 = [[Lille OSC|Lille]] |caps2 = 89 |goals2 = 5 | years3 = 2008–2011 |clubs3 = [[S.S. Lazio|Lazio]] |caps3 = 100 |goals3 = 3 | years4 = 2011–2018 |clubs4 = [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]] |caps4 = 201 |goals4 = 12 | years5 = 2018– |clubs5 = [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] |caps5 = 12 |goals5 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2003–2005 | nationalyears2 = 2006– | nationalteam1 = [[Switzerland national under-21 football team|Switzerland U21]] | nationalteam2 = [[Switzerland national football team|Switzerland]] | nationalcaps1 = 30 | nationalcaps2 = 104 | nationalgoals1 = 1 | nationalgoals2 = 8 | club-update = 22:22, 24 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 11 September 2018 }} '''Stephan Lichtsteiner''' ({{IPA-de|lɪçtʃtaɪnər}}; born 16 January 1984) is a Swiss professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays for {{English football updater|Arsenal}} club [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] and [[Captain (association football)|captains]] the [[Switzerland national football team|Switzerland national team]]. An attacking [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|right-back]] or [[Defender (association football)#Wing-back|wing-back]], he is known for his energetic runs down the [[Midfielder#Winger|right wing]], as well as his stamina and athleticism, which have earned him the nicknames "[[Forrest Gump]]" and "The Swiss [[Express train|Express]]". He began his professional career with [[Grasshopper Club Zürich|Grasshopper]], winning a league title in 2002–03, and moved to [[Lille OSC|Lille]] in 2005, helping the French club to Champions League qualification in his first season with the team. In 2008, he joined Italian club [[S.S. Lazio|Lazio]], and won both the [[Coppa Italia]] and [[Supercoppa Italiana]] the following year. In 2011, he signed for [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]] for a fee of €10 million. He played 257 total games for the Turin side over seven years and won 14 trophies, including the [[Serie A]] title in each of his seasons with the team. In the summer of 2018, he was signed by Arsenal. A full international since 2006, Lichtsteiner has earned over [[100 caps]] for Switzerland, making him their third most capped player of all time. He has represented his country at two [[UEFA European Championship]]s and three [[FIFA World Cup]]s. ==Early years== Lichtsteiner was born in [[Adligenswil]], [[Canton of Lucerne]] and played for the local football club. He left home as a teenager to play for [[Grasshopper Zürich]] and made his first team debut in [[2001–02 Nationalliga A|2001–02]] in the former Nationalliga A (now the [[Swiss Super League]]) but only made one league appearance. The following season, he began to establish himself as a first team regular and helped the club to the league title. While living in [[Zürich]] he completed a banking apprenticeship with [[Credit Suisse]] but ultimately chose a career in football.{{cite news|title=The Down-to-Earth Powerhouse|url=https://www.credit-suisse.com/sg/en/about-us/sponsorship/football/news.article.html/article/pwp/news-and-expertise/2013/10/en/portrait-lichtsteiner.html|publisher=[[Credit Suisse|credit-suisse.com]]|date=15 October 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140714141048/https://www.credit-suisse.com/sg/en/about-us/sponsorship/football/news.article.html/article/pwp/news-and-expertise/2013/10/en/portrait-lichtsteiner.html|archivedate=14 July 2014}} ==Club career== ===Lille=== During the 2004–05 season Lichtsteiner sealed a transfer to [[Lille OSC]] as one of five Swiss players to enter [[Ligue 1]] during the summer of 2005. He became a regular in his first season and helped Lille to a third-place finish to secure a Champions League spot. His last season ended disappointingly as Lille finished seventh in the league and missed out on European football next season just by a point. However he did end with 4 goals, his highest tally so far.{{cite news|title=Lichtsteiner: We can progress|url=https://www.fifa.com/worldfootball/clubfootball/news/newsid=758086.html|publisher=[[FIFA|fifa.com]]|date=2 May 2008}} ===Lazio=== After some good performances at [[UEFA Euro 2008]], several clubs, including [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|Paris Saint-Germain]] and [[Everton F.C.|Everton]], expressed interest in signing Lichtsteiner.{{cite news|title=Lichtsteiner vers la Lazio|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/breves2008/20080717_152319_lichtsteiner-vers-la-lazio_Dev.html|archive-url=https://archive.is/20120703012343/http://www.lequipe.fr/Football/breves2008/20080717_152319_lichtsteiner-vers-la-lazio_Dev.html|dead-url=yes|archive-date=3 July 2012|publisher=[[L'Équipe]]|date=17 July 2008|language=French}} He rejected PSG's bid and, in July, signed a four-year contract with Italian side [[S.S. Lazio]] for an undisclosed fee believed to be in the region of €1.5 million{{cite web|url=http://www.piazzadellaliberta.it/2008/07/16/calciomercato-lazio-preso-lichtsteiner/#more-8381|title=Calciomercato Lazio: preso Lichtsteiner|work=piazzadellalibertà.it|accessdate=16 July 2008 |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20080717012353/http://www.piazzadellaliberta.it/2008/07/16/calciomercato-lazio-preso-lichtsteiner/#more-8381 |archivedate = 17 July 2008|language=it}} as a replacement for fellow Swiss international [[Valon Behrami]], who went to [[West Ham United]].{{cite news|title=Lazio è arrivato lo svizzero Lichtsteiner|url=http://www.corrieredellosport.it/Notizie/Calcio/36704/Lazio%2C+%C3%A8+arrivato+lo+svizzero+Lichtsteiner|publisher=Corriere Dello Sport|date=16 July 2008|language=Italian}}{{dead link|date=March 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} In the April [[Derby della Capitale]] against cross-city rivals [[A.S. Roma|Roma]], he scored his first goal to put Lazio 3–1 up in a heated derby encounter, which ended in a 4–2 win to Lazio, and resulted in numerous bookings.{{cite news|title=Championnat d'Italie: Lichtsteiner à la fête dans le derby romain|url=http://www.lematin.ch/flash-info/sport/championnat-italie-lichtsteiner-fete-derby-romain|publisher=[[Le Matin (Switzerland)|Le Matin]]|date=11 April 2009|language=French}} Lichtsteiner himself was also booked for a heated confrontation with Roma defender [[Christian Panucci]], after the Italian had fouled him.{{cite web|url=http://sports.espn.go.com/espnmag/story?id=4070089|title=WGATU: Rivalries boil-over on the pitch|work=ESPN.com}} During the season, Lichtsteiner formed an attacking tandem down the flanks with Serbian international full-back [[Aleksandar Kolarov]] on the other side of the pitch. Although Lazio finished tenth, they ended the season on a high by winning the [[2008–09 Coppa Italia|Coppa Italia]], and thus earning a place in the [[UEFA Europa League]] the next season. He played a part in Lazio's successful campaign, scoring in the penalty shoot-out against [[U.C. Sampdoria|Sampdoria]] in the [[2009 Coppa Italia Final|final]], and also claimed the [[Supercoppa Italiana]] at the beginning of the next season. After Kolarov's departure, his future at Lazio became increasingly in doubt, as several clubs expressed interest in him. At the end of the 2010–11 season, he opted not to see out the final year of his contract, despite the ''Biancocelesti'' qualifying for the Europa League.{{cite news|title=Conte key for Lichtsteiner|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/news/story/_/id/930775/stephan-lichtsteiner-says-antonio-conte-was-key-to-juventus-switch?cc=3436|publisher=[[ESPN Soccernet]]|date=28 June 2011}} ===Juventus=== [[File:Stephan Lichtsteiner'13.JPG|thumb|upright|Lichtsteiner playing for Juventus in December 2013]] On 27 June 2011, [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]] confirmed that Lichtsteiner had undergone a medical in [[Turin]] and reached an agreement with Lazio to pay €10 million in three installments.{{cite news|title=Lichtsteiner non-ha dubbi "La Juve è sempre la Juve"|url=http://www.gazzetta.it/Calcio/SerieA/Juventus/10-07-2011/lichtsteiner-non-ha-dubbi-801947977793.shtml|publisher=[[La Gazzetta dello Sport]]|date=10 July 2011|language=Italian}} The transfer was confirmed on 1 July 2011. He marked his debut on 11 September 2011 against [[Parma F.C.|Parma]] by scoring the first goal in the 4–1 home victory, the first league goal to be scored in Juventus' new [[Juventus Stadium|stadium]].{{cite web|title=Juventus Stadium|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/news/newsid=1966779.html|publisher=UEFA.com|date=24 June 2013|accessdate=3 January 2016}} Juventus went on to win the ''Scudetto'' and he played a vital part in their strong defensive record, only missing a handful of matches through injury and suspensions.{{cite news|title=Champions of Italy: Stephan Lichtsteiner|url=http://www.juventus.com/juve/en/news/7june2012_lich_campioni|publisher=juventus.com|date=7 June 2012}} Lichtsteiner repeated his opening matchday feat the following season by converting his left-sided counterpart [[Kwadwo Asamoah]]'s pass in the 2–0 win.{{cite news|title=Lightning strikes twice for Lichtsteiner|url=http://www.juventus.com/juve/en/news/25ago2012_licht_eng|publisher=juventus.com|date=26 August 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120828062342/http://www.juventus.com/juve/en/news/25ago2012_licht_eng|archivedate=28 August 2012}} He played fewer matches during [[2013–14 Serie A|2013–14 season]] due to injuries but contributed three goals in all competitions and won his third consecutive [[Serie A]] title. His [[Cross (football)|crossing]] and ball-playing ability from the right flank, as well as his ability to make attacking runs to get on the end of [[Andrea Pirlo]]'s long passes, came to the fore as a right-sided wing-back in [[Antonio Conte|Conte's]] [[Formation (association football)#3–5–2|3–5–2 formation]].{{cite web|url=http://www.espn.com/soccer/blog/name/93/post/2152566/headline|title=Stephan Lichtsteiner is vital to Juventus' style of play|publisher=ESPN FC|author1=Mina Rzouki|date=19 November 2014|accessdate=20 February 2018}} As a result, he finished the season as Juventus's top assist-maker in the league, alongside [[Paul Pogba]], with eight.{{cite web|url=https://www.foxsports.com/soccer/juventus-team-stats?competition=3&season=2013&category=STANDARD|title=2013-14 Juventus Serie A Statistics and Leaders: Standard|publisher=Fox Sports|accessdate=20 February 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://www.juventus.com/it/squadre/prima-squadra/difensori/stephan-lichtsteiner/index.php|title=Stephan Lichtsteiner|publisher=juventus.com}} On 6 June 2015, Lichtsteiner started for Juventus in the [[2015 UEFA Champions League Final]] as the team were defeated 3–1 by [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] at Berlin's [[Olympiastadion Berlin|Olympiastadion]]; he was involved in [[Álvaro Morata]]'s temporary equalising goal.{{cite news|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2015/matches/round=2000552/match=2015227/postmatch/report/index.html|title=Barcelona see off Juventus to claim fifth title|date=6 June 2015|work=UEFA}} On 23 September 2015, Lichtsteiner was substituted at half time during a league match against [[Frosinone Calcio|Frosinone]] due to breathing difficulty. It was later necessary for heart surgery to be performed to correct [[cardiac arrhythmia]], which caused him to be out for a month.{{cite web|url=http://www.football-italia.net/73851/surgeon-one-month-lichtsteiner|title=Surgeon: 'One month for Lichtsteiner' - Football Italia|publisher=}} On 3 November 2015, Lichtsteiner returned from injury, starting against [[Borussia Mönchengladbach]] in the [[2015–16 UEFA Champions League group stage#Group D|2015–16 Champions League]] and scoring the equalizing goal in the 44th minute of a 1–1 away draw;{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/nov/04/juventus-stephan-lichsteiner-heart-surgery-return-goal|title=Juventus' Stephan Lichtsteiner marks heart surgery return with volleyed goal|publisher=The Guardian|date=4 November 2015|accessdate=5 November 2015}} the goal was later voted one of the best goals of the tournament that season.{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/news/newsid=2391294.html|title=Top ten goals of the 2015/16 Champions League|publisher=UEFA.com|date=18 July 2016|accessdate=18 July 2016}} At the beginning of the 2016–17 season, Lichtsteiner was excluded from Juventus's squad for the [[2016–17 UEFA Champions League|UEFA Champions League]] group stage;{{cite web|url=http://www.juventus.com/en/news/news/2016/juventus-submits-champions-league-squad.php|title=Juventus submits Champions League squad|publisher=Juventus F.C.|date=1 September 2016|access-date=24 December 2016}} this was due to the fact that the club had signed rightback [[Dani Alves]], and had already filled their squad quota, as Juventus were also required to have four club youth products in the 25-men squad, even though initially the only former youth product in the first team was [[Claudio Marchisio]]. Thus, Lichtsteiner was excluded to make way for other players.{{cite web|url=http://www.juventus.com/en/news/news/2016/marotta-analyses--satisfying--summer-.php|title=Marotta analyses 'satisfying' summer|publisher=Juventus F.C.|date=8 September 2016|accessdate=2 February 2017}}{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/news/newsid=2400510.html|title=UEFA Champions League squads: how it works|publisher=UEFA.com|date=1 September 2016|accessdate=2 February 2017}} Juventus had also re-signed [[Juan Cuadrado]] on loan, which meant that Lichsteiner would face competition for the starting right fullback/wingback/winger position, leading to rumours that he would be leaving the club; nevertheless, he later stated that he would be remaining with Juventus.{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.us/juventus/story/2942565/juventus-omit-stephan-lichsteiner-from-champions-league-squad|title=Juventus omit Stephan Lichsteiner from Champions League squad|publisher=ESPN FC|author1=Ben Gladwell|date=2 September 2016|accessdate=2 February 2017}}{{cite web|url=http://www.football-italia.net/90772/lichtsteiner-pledges-juve|title=Lichtsteiner pledges to Juve|publisher=Football Italia|date=1 September 2016|accessdate=2 February 2017}} Despite competition for a starting spot, Lichtsteiner took part in the [[2016 Supercoppa Italiana]] on 23 December 2016, as one of the starting eleven, as Juventus lost to [[A.C. Milan|Milan]] on penalties.{{cite web|url=http://www.football-italia.net/96104/milan-beat-juve-super-cup-shoot-out|title=Milan beat Juve in Super Cup shoot-out|publisher=Football Italia|date=23 December 2016|accessdate=2 February 2017}} On 2 February 2017, Lichsteiner renewed his contract until 30 June 2018.{{cite web|url=http://www.football-italia.net/97815/lichtsteiner-renews-juventus|title=Lichtsteiner renews with Juventus|publisher=Football Italia|date=2 February 2017|accessdate=2 February 2017}} On 7 March 2018, Lichtsteiner made his 250th appearance for Juventus in a 2–1 win over [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham]] at [[Wembley Stadium]], in the second leg of the round of 16 of the [[2017–18 UEFA Champions League|UEFA Champions League]], coming off the bench in the second half to help create [[Gonzalo Higuaín]]'s goal.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/43306558|title=Tottenham Hotspur 1-2 Juventus|publisher=BBC Sport|author1=Phil McNulty|date=7 March 2018|accessdate=9 March 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/european/tottenham-juventus-champions-league-match-report-paulo-dybala-gonzalo-higuain-a8244981.html|title=Paulo Dybala and Gonzalo Higuain stun Tottenham to send Juventus into Champions League quarter-finals|publisher=The Independent|author1=Luke Brown|date=8 March 2018|accessdate=9 March 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://www.juventus.com/en/news/news/2018/tottenham-juve-talking-points.php|title=Tottenham-Juve: Talking Points|publisher=Juventus F.C.|date=8 March 2018|accessdate=11 March 2018}} He made his 200th Serie A appearance with the club in a 3–1 home win over [[Bologna F.C. 1909|Bologna]] on 5 May, after which he announced that he would be leaving the club at the end of the season.{{cite web |url=http://www.sportmediaset.mediaset.it/mercato/juventus/juve-lichtsteiner-scudetto-e-addio-lascio-a-fine-stagione-giochero-all-estero-_1212165-201802a.shtml |title=Juve - Lichtsteiner, scudetto e addio: "Lascio a fine stagione, giocherò all'estero" |publisher=www.sportmediaset.mediaset.it |language=Italian |date=6 May 2018 |accessdate=28 September 2018 }} On 19 May, Lichtsteiner made his final appearance for Juventus in the last match of the season in a 2–1 home win over [[Hellas Verona F.C.|Verona]] as the club celebrated winning their seventh consecutive league title; during the same match, he missed a penalty, and was given a send-off later during the game when he came off, despite Juventus having already made all three substitutions.{{cite web|url=http://www.beinsports.com/us/serie-a/video/juventus-bid-farewell-to-buffon-in-win-over-v/878156|title=Juventus Bid Farewell To Buffon In Win Over Verona|publisher=www.beinsports.com|date=19 May 2018|accessdate=19 May 2018}} ===Arsenal=== On 5 June 2018, Lichtsteiner signed for [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] on a free transfer.{{cite web|url=https://www.football-italia.net/122477/official-arsenal-sign-lichtsteiner|title=OFFICIAL: Arsenal sign Lichtsteiner|publisher=Football Italia|date=5 June 2018}} He made his Arsenal debut on 12 August, coming on as a substitute in the 35th minute for the injured [[Ainsley Maitland-Niles]] in an eventual 2–0 home defeat to [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]].{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/live/2018/aug/12/arsenal-v-manchester-city-premier-league-live |title=Arsenal 0-2 Man City |publisher=The Guardian |author1=Nick Ames |date=12 August 2018 |accessdate=26 August 2018 }} On 31 October 2018, Lichtsteiner scored his first goal for Arsenal in the first half of a 2–1 home win over [[Blackpool F.C.|Blackpool]] in the [[2018–19 EFL Cup|2018–19]] [[EFL Cup]].{{Cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2018/10/31/arsenal-vs-blackpool-chelsea-vs-derby-carabao-cup-fourth-round/|title=Arsenal hold off Blackpool's late surge after Matteo Guendouzi rashly sees red|work=The Telegraph|last=Dean|first=Sam|last2=Bagchi|first2=Rob|language=en-GB|date=31 October 2018|access-date=1 November 2018|issn=0307-1235}} ==International career== [[File:Sergio Agüero (L), Stephan Lichtsteiner (R) - Switzerland vs. Argentina, 29th February 2012.jpg|thumb|Lichtsteiner defending against [[Sergio Agüero]] of Argentina in a 2012 friendly match]] A former youth international, Lichtsteiner played in the [[1999 UEFA European Under-16 Football Championship|1999 U16]] and the [[2004 UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship|2004 U21 European Championships]]. He was first called up to the [[Switzerland national football team|senior squad]] on two occasions in 2005 but was an unused substitute both times. On 11 November 2006, he made his senior debut in a friendly against [[Brazil national football team|Brazil]] which ended in a 2–1 loss. Although he missed out on the [[2006 FIFA World Cup|2006 World Cup]], Lichtsteiner was given a chance to prove himself as first choice right back [[Philipp Degen]] was out with long-term injury.{{cite news|title=Liege-Einheit für Stephan Lichtsteiner|url=http://www.nzz.ch/nachrichten/sport/aktuell/lichtsteiner_unterzieht_sich_einer_therapie_1.569792.html|publisher=[[Neue Zürcher Zeitung]]|date=15 October 2007|language=German}} In May, [[Köbi Kuhn]] named him in the squad for the [[Euro 2008]]. He played every match at the tournament and eventually replaced Degen as first choice right back. Switzerland ended the tournament with two losses and a win. He retained his starting place under new manager [[Ottmar Hitzfeld]] and played every minute in 8 of the 10 [[2010 FIFA World Cup qualification (UEFA)|2010 World Cup qualifiers]]. Lichtsteiner played seven games in [[UEFA Euro 2012 qualifying]], with the Swiss failing to reach the finals in Poland and Ukraine. He scored his first international goal on 11 October 2010 in the final game, a 2–0 win over [[Montenegro national football team|Montenegro]] in [[Basel]].{{cite news |last1=James |first1=Andy |title=Switzerland end on a high against Montenegro |url=https://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/season=2012/matches/round=15171/match=2002284/postmatch/report/index.html#switzerland+finish+high |accessdate=14 September 2018 |publisher=UEFA |date=11 October 2011}} In [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualification (UEFA)|2014 FIFA World Cup qualification]], he played eight full matches in a successful campaign, scoring two first-half goals on 6 September 2013 in a 4–4 draw with [[Iceland national football team|Iceland]] at the [[Stade de Suisse]].{{cite news |title=Eight-goal thriller in Bern |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/switzerland-vs-iceland/report/253629 |accessdate=14 September 2018 |publisher=Sky Sports |date=6 September 2013}} Manager [[Vladimir Petković]] named him in the 23-man squad for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup|finals in Brazil]],{{cite news |title=Switzerland squad for 2014 World Cup: the 23 chosen by Ottmar Hitzfeld |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/jun/06/switzerland-world-cup-squad-brazil-2014 |accessdate=14 September 2018 |work=The Guardian |date=6 June 2014}} where he played every minute in a run to the last 16. Due to injury to regular captain [[Gökhan Inler]], Lichtsteiner wore the Swiss armband for the first time on 14 October 2014 in his 70th match, a 4–0 away win over [[San Marino national football team|San Marino]] in [[UEFA Euro 2016 qualifying]].{{cite news |title=Lichtsteiner: "Von alleine fällt der Ball nicht rein" |url=https://www.srf.ch/sport/fussball/nationalmannschaft/lichtsteiner-von-alleine-faellt-der-ball-nicht-rein |accessdate=14 September 2018 |publisher=SRF |date=14 October 2014 |language=German}} Prior to the [[UEFA Euro 2016|finals in France]] Lichtsteiner was made permanent captain as Inler was dropped due to lack of playing time at club level.{{cite news|title=Interview with Switzerland captain Stephan Lichtsteiner|url=http://www.worldsoccer.com/euro-2016/interview-with-switzerland-captain-stephan-lichtsteiner-375261|work=[[World Soccer (magazine)|World Soccer]]|date=31 May 2016}} The Swiss made it out of the group stage and faced [[Poland national football team|Poland]] in the Round of 16. With the score at 1–1, the match was decided by [[Penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalties]], and Lichtsteiner took first and scored but the Swiss lost as [[Granit Xhaka]] missed.{{cite news |last1=Johnston |first1=Neil |title=Switzerland 1–1 Poland |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36566078 |accessdate=14 September 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=25 June 2016}} In [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification (UEFA)|2018 FIFA World Cup qualification]], Lichtsteiner scored in home wins over the [[Faroe Islands national football team|Faroe Islands]], [[Andorra national football team|Andorra]] and [[Hungary national football team|Hungary]], as the Swiss qualified through the play-offs.{{cite news |title=Switzerland down Faroe Islands to stay perfect |url=https://theworldgame.sbs.com.au/switzerland-down-faroe-islands-to-stay-perfect |accessdate=14 September 2018 |publisher=SBS |date=14 November 2016}}{{cite news |title=Switzerland down Andorra to maintain perfect record |url=https://theworldgame.sbs.com.au/switzerland-down-andorra-to-maintain-perfect-record |accessdate=14 September 2018 |publisher=SBS |date=1 September 2017}}{{cite news |last1=Chessex |first1=Robin |title=La Nati a cru une heure à la qualification |url=https://www.20min.ch/ro/sports/football/story/La-Nati-a-cru-une-heure-a-la-qualification-25735498?httpredirect |accessdate=14 September 2018 |work=20 minutes |date=8 October 2017 |language=French}} He was named in Petković's 23-man squad for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup|finals]] in Russia.{{cite news |title=2018 World Cup: Switzerland name Granit Xhaka and Xherdan Shaqiri in squad |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44360966 |accessdate=22 June 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=4 June 2018}} On 8 June, in the final warm-up game against [[Japan national football team|Japan]], he became the fourth Swiss to earn [[List of footballers with 100 or more caps|100 international caps]] in the 2–0 victory.{{cite news |last1=Orimolade |first1=Akindélé |title=Lichtsteiner est centenaire |url=https://fr.besoccer.com/info/lichtsteiner-puissance-100-443237 |accessdate=22 June 2018 |publisher=BeSoccer |date=8 June 2018 |language=French}} He was fined 5,000 [[Swiss franc]]s after the 2–1 group win over [[Serbia national football team|Serbia]] for his part in the controversial goal celebrations of [[Xherdan Shaqiri]] and [[Granit Xhaka]].{{cite news |title=World Cup 2018: Switzerland trio avoid bans for 'eagle gesture' goal celebrations |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44606965 |accessdate=25 June 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=25 June 2018}} ==Style of play== A dynamic, hard-working, consistent, and versatile defender, Lichtsteiner is capable of playing anywhere along the right flank, and has been deployed as an attacking [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|full-back]] or [[Defender (association football)#Wing-back|wing-back]] in a four-man back-line, or also as [[Midfielder#Winger|winger]] in a 3–5–2 formation. Although he predominantly plays on the right, he has also been used on the left flank on occasion, or even as a makeshift [[Defender (association football)#Centre-back|centre-back]]. A quick, physically strong, tenacious, and tactically intelligent player, he is known for his energetic runs up and down the wing, which enable him to exploit spaces and get on the end of long balls, thus enabling him to help out at both ends of the pitch and cover the right flank effectively. His stamina, dedication and athleticism have earned him the nicknames "[[Forrest Gump]]" and "The Swiss [[Express train|Express]]".{{cite web |url=http://www.espn.com/soccer/club/arsenal/359/blog/post/3594617/arsenals-uncomfortable-petr-cech-earns-5-10-as-gunners-struggle-vs-man-city |title=Arsenal's uncomfortable Petr Cech earns 5/10 as Gunners struggle vs. Man City |publisher=ESPN FC |author1=James McNicholas |date=12 August 2018 |accessdate=26 August 2018 }}{{cite web |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/news/11670/11583684/rob-holdings-knee-surgery-went-well-says-arsenal-defender |title=Rob Holding's knee surgery 'went well' says Arsenal defender |publisher=Sky Sports |author1=Lyall Thomas |date=16 December 2018 |accessdate=12 January 2019 }} Although not particularly skilful from a technical standpoint, he is capable of linking up with teammates and making attacking runs to get on the end of passes, which enable him to get into positions from which he can create chances for strikers with crosses from the touchline, or even score goals himself; while he is mainly regarded for his offensive contribution, he is also known for being reliable defensively. However, at times Lichsteiner has also drawn criticism in the media for lacking composure under pressure, being too rash and aggressive in his challenges, and prone to defensive errors, as well as for being inconsistent in his crossing and distribution from the right wing.{{cite web|url=http://www.gazzetta.it/Calcio/Squadre/Juventus/09-11-2012/isla-scusate-ritardo-juve-turbo-destra--913164517005.shtml|title=Isla, scusate il ritardo Juve, il turbo sulla destra|publisher=La Gazzetta dello Sport|language=Italian|author1=Riccardo Pratesi|date=9 November 2012|accessdate=20 February 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.football-italia.net/27593/full-steam-ahead-lichtsteiner|title=Full steam ahead for Lichtsteiner|publisher=Football Italia|author1=Antonio Labbate|date=22 November 2012|accessdate=20 February 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://www.gazzetta.it/Calcio/Serie-A/Juventus/06-02-2014/juventus-lichtsteiner-universale-terzino-esterno-goleador-8019316751.shtml|title=Juventus, Lichtsteiner l'universale: terzino, esterno e goleador|publisher=La Gazzetta dello Sport|language=Italian|date=6 February 2014|accessdate=20 February 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/it/news/2/serie-a/2014/09/29/5141848/editoriale-difende-come-un-difensore-attacca-come-un|title=Difende come un difensore, attacca come un attaccante: Lichtsteiner, l'arma in più della Juventus|publisher=Goal.com|author=Renato Maisani|language=Italian|date=29 September 2014}}{{cite web|url=http://www.tuttosport.com/calcio/serie_a/juventus/calciomercato/2011/06/27-132271/Juve,+arriva+Lichtsteiner%3A+visite+mediche,+poi+la+firma|title=Juve, arriva Lichtsteiner: visite mediche, poi la firma|publisher=Tutto Sport|author=Marina Salvetti|language=Italian|date=27 June 2011|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304111335/http://www.tuttosport.com/calcio/serie_a/juventus/calciomercato/2011/06/27-132271/Juve,+arriva+Lichtsteiner:+visite+mediche,+poi+la+firma|archivedate=4 March 2016}}{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/world-match-centre/news/newsid/758/086/index.html|title=Lichtsteiner: We can progress|publisher=FIFA.com|date=2 May 2008}} ==Personal life== Lichtsteiner is married to Manuela Markworth, an economist and fitness instructor. They have a daughter{{cite news|title=Stephan Lichtsteiner ist Papa geworden|url=http://www.glanzundgloria.sf.tv/Nachrichten/Archiv/2011/02/06/Schweiz/Stephan-Lichtsteiner-ist-Papa-geworden|publisher=[[Schweizer Fernsehen]]|date=6 February 2011|language=German}}{{cite news|title=Er ist Vater geworden!|url=http://www.schweizer-illustrierte.ch/stars/schweiz/er-ist-vater-geworden-0|publisher=[[Schweizer Illustrierte]]|date=5 February 2011|language=German}} and a son.{{cite news|title=Baby Nummer 2: Nati-Star Stephan Lichtsteiner im Papa-Glück |url=http://www.srf.ch/unterhaltung/people/schweiz/baby-nummer-2-nati-star-stephan-lichtsteiner-im-papa-glueck|publisher=[[Schweizer Radio und Fernsehen|srf.ch]]|date=29 October 2014|language=German}} Lichtsteiner acquired the nickname "[[Forrest Gump]]" from Lazio-supporting Radio Sei commentator Guido de Angelis after making a run down his flank to score in the 4–2 derby victory over crosstown rivals [[A.S. Roma]].{{cite news|title="Forrest Gump" Lichtsteiner trifft – Kommentator dreht durch|url=http://www.blick.ch/sport/fussball/international/serie-a/lichtsteiner-trifft-im-roemer-derby-116668|publisher=[[Blick]]|date=12 April 2009|language=German}} His runs and athleticism has also earned him the nickname "The Swiss Express" since moving to Juventus. ==Career statistics== ===Club=== {{updated|29 January 2019}}{{cite [[Forward (association football)|Forward]] |currentclub = [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] |clubnumber = 17 |youthyears1 = 2004–2015 |youthclubs1 = [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] |years1 = 2015– |clubs1 = [[Arsenal football team|Nigeria]] |nationalcaps4 = 21 |nationalgoals4 = 5 |club-update = 08:52, 3 March 2019 (UTC) |ntupdate = 26 June 2018 }} '''Alexander Chuka Iwobi''' ({{IPAc-en|ɪ|ˈ|w|oʊ|b|i}} {{respell|ih|WOH|bee}};<ref>{{Citation |last=Arsenal |title=Arsenal: Introducing Alex Iwobi |date=22 May 2014 |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G54QflUOpKo&t=22s |accessdate=17 November 2017}}</ref> born 3 May 1996) is a Nigerian professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (association football)|forward]] for {{English football updater|Arsenal}} club [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] and the [[Nigeria national football team|Nigeria national team]].
==Early and personal life== Iwobi was born in [[Lagos]] before moving to England at the age of four, following a brief stay in [[Turkey]].<ref>{{cite news |last1=Taylor |first1=Daniel |title=How Arsenal's Alex Iwobi became England's loss and Nigeria's gain |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2016/mar/26/arsenal-alex-iwobi-england-nigeria |accessdate=10 April 2016 |newspaper=The Guardian |date=26 March 2016}}</ref><ref name = "AFC">{{cite web |url=http://www.arsenal.com/academy/players/alex-iwobi |title=Profile |accessdate=11 October 2015 |publisher=Arsenal F.C.}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last1=Lawrence |first1=Amy |title=Alex Iwobi: ‘I did extra training. My mum made me do kick-ups in the living room’ |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/dec/09/alex-iwobi-arsenal-extra-sessions |accessdate=6 November 2018 |newspaper=The Guardian |date=9 December 2016}}</ref> He is the nephew of former professional footballer [[Jay-Jay Okocha]].<ref name = "AFC"/> He grew up in Newham.<ref name = "indy"/>
He is "best mates" with former Arsenal teammate [[Tyrell Robinson]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/15813458.bradford-city-tyrell-robinson-will-not-ease-off-after-signing-new-contract/ |title=Bradford City: Tyrell Robinson will not ease off after signing new contract |date=9 January 2018 |accessdate=10 January 2018 |author=Simon Parker |newspaper=Telegraph & Argus}}</ref>
==Club career== [[File:Alex Iwobi 20150814.jpg|thumb|upright|Iwobi (right) playing for [[Arsenal F.C. Reserves|Arsenal U21s]] in 2015]]
Iwobi joined [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] while still at primary school,<ref name="Alex Iwobi signs new contract">{{cite news |url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/20151006/alex-iwobi-signs-new-contract |title=Alex Iwobi signs new contract |date=6 October 2015 |accessdate=25 March 2016 |publisher=Arsenal F.C.}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/arsenal/11915430/Who-is-Alex-Iwobi.html |title=Arsenal tie down young Nigerian forward Alex Iwobi to a new long term contract: but who is he? |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph}}</ref> in 2004,<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.90min.com/posts/6247986-alex-iwobi-reveals-how-close-he-was-to-leaving-arsenal-after-talks-with-premier-league-pair|title=Alex Iwobi Reveals How Close He Was to Leaving Arsenal After Talks With Premier League Pair|date=15 December 2018|website=90min.com}}</ref> and was nearly released by the club at the age of 14 and again at the age of 16.<ref name = "indy">{{cite web|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/arsenal-news-alex-iwobi-emirates-gunners-a7362431.html|title=How Alex Iwobi avoided an Emirates exit to become Arsenal's breakout star|date=14 October 2016|website=The Independent}}</ref>
He was first involved in a [[first-team]] match as an unused [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] in a [[Football League Cup|League Cup]] match against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] on 25 September 2013.<ref>{{cite web |title=Results/matches: 2013/14 |url=http://www.soccerbase.com/teams/team.sd?team_id=142&teamTabs=results&season_id=143 |website=Soccerbase |publisher=Centurycomm |accessdate=25 March 2016}}</ref> He signed a long-term contract with Arsenal in October 2015.<ref name="Alex Iwobi signs new contract"/><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.premierleague.com/en-gb/players/profile.overview.html/alex-iwobi-2 |title=Profile |accessdate=13 October 2015 |publisher=Premier League}}</ref>
On 27 October 2015, Iwobi made his first-team debut for the club, starting in a 3–0 defeat to [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]] in the Round of 16 of the League Cup.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34654548 |title=Arsene Wenger 'used too many senior players' in League Cup exit |date=28 October 2015 |accessdate=1 November 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34578025 |title=Sheffield Wednesday 3–0 Arsenal |date=27 October 2015 |accessdate=1 November 2015 |author=Luke Reddy |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> He made his Premier League debut four days later in a 3–0 win against [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]] at the [[Liberty Stadium]], as a stoppage time substitute for [[Mesut Özil]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34623949 |title=Swansea City 0–3 Arsenal |date=31 October 2015 |accessdate=1 November 2015 |author=Dafydd Pritchard |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> Iwobi made his [[UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] debut as an 85th-minute substitute in a 5–1 defeat against Bayern Munich.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/34892626 |title=Bayern Munich 5–1 Arsenal |date=4 November 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> Iwobi started in the first team for the [[2015–16 FA Cup]] 3rd and 4th round home wins against [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] and [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] respectively.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Critchley |first1=Mark |title=Arsenal vs Sunderland team news: Alex Iwobi handed first-team chance, Petr Cech starts in goal |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/fa-league-cups/arsenal-vs-sunderland-team-news-alex-iwobi-handed-first-team-chance-petr-cech-starts-in-goal-a6803886.html |accessdate=1 February 2016 |newspaper=The Independent |date=9 January 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last1=Hytner |first1=David |title=Arsène Wenger makes England quip over Arsenal's in-form Alex Iwobi |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/jan/31/arsene-wenger-england-arsenal-alex-iwobi-roy-hodgson-burnley-fa-cup |accessdate=1 February 2016 |newspaper=The Guardian |date=31 January 2016}}</ref>
After getting a first Champions League start in a 3–1 away defeat to Barcelona,<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/35814925 |title=Champions League: Barcelona 3–1 Arsenal (agg 5–1) |date=16 March 2016 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> Iwobi went on to score two goals in his first two Premier League starts in wins against [[Everton F.C.|Everton]],<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/35792188 |title=Everton 0–2 Arsenal |date=19 March 2016 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> and [[Watford F.C.|Watford]], respectively.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/35902639 |title=Arsenal 4–0 Watford |date=2 April 2016 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref>
In the following season, Iwobi changed his squad number from 45 to 17. This was due to Chilean forward [[Alexis Sánchez]] taking up the newly vacated number 7 from the departing [[Tomáš Rosický]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.espnfc.com/english-premier-league/story/2881382/granit-xhaka-to-wear-arsenal-no-16-shirt-alex-iwobi-to-wear-no-17 |title=Granit Xhaka to wear Arsenal No. 16 shirt, Alex Iwobi takes over No. 17 |date=27 May 2016 |publisher=ESPN FC}}</ref>
Iwobi went on to feature throughout Arsenal's victorious [[2016–17 FA Cup|FA Cup campaign of 2016–17]]. As so he earned a winners medal as being part of the squad that beat Chelsea by 2 goals to 1 in the [[2016-17 FA Cup|final of such]].<ref name=FACup /> He achieved further success with Arsenal in the [[2017 FA Community Shield|2017 Community Shield]], in which Arsenal beat Chelsea on penalties.<ref name=CS>{{cite web |url=https://www.goal.com/en-au/amp/news/lets-keep-it-going-iwobi-lauds-arsenal-after-community/1gyizgop73z4s1v9kp2jfxd23j |title='Let's keep it going' – Iwobi lauds ARSENAL after Community Shield Triumph |website=Goal.com}}</ref>
In May 2018, after Arsenal manager [[Arsène Wenger]] announced he would be leaving the club, Iwobi described him as an "inspiration" and stated it was sad but exciting.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43988015 |title=Nigeria's Alex Iwobi says Wenger exit 'sad' and 'exciting' |date=3 May 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref>
In August 2018 he signed a new long-term contract with the club, reportedly until 2023.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45060242|title=Alex Iwobi: Arsenal midfielder signs new 'long-term' deal|date=3 August 2018|publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref>
==International career== [[File:Alex Iwobi-Nigeria.jpg|thumb|upright|Iwobi with [[Nigeria national football team|Nigeria]] in 2017]]
Iwobi started as a youth international for England, with whom he won the [[Victory Shield]] of 2011.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.thefa.com/england/all-teams/players/i/alex-iwobi |title=Profile |accessdate=11 October 2015 |publisher=The Football Association}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2016/mar/26/arsenal-alex-iwobi-england-nigeria |title=How Arsenal's Alex Iwobi became England's loss and Nigeria's gain |date=26 March 2016 |newspaper=The Guardian}}</ref><ref name=Trophy /> Iwobi went on though to play for [[Nigeria national football team|Nigeria]]. He made his senior debut for the Super Eagles on 8 October 2015, replacing [[Ahmed Musa (footballer)|Ahmed Musa]] in the 57th minute of a 2–0 friendly defeat to [[DR Congo national football team|DR Congo]] in [[Visé]], Belgium.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34497630 |title=Arsenal's Alex Iwobi encouraged by Nigeria opportunity |date=10 October 2015 |accessdate=11 October 2015 |author=Oluwashina Okeleji |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref>
He was selected by Nigeria for their 35-man provisional squad for the [[2016 Summer Olympics]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36623763 |title=Kelechi Iheanacho included in Nigeria's Olympics squad |date=24 June 2016 |accessdate=25 June 2016 |author=Oluwashina Okeleji |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> He was not a part of the 18-man final squad.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.fifa.com/mensolympic/teams/team=1889763/players.html |title=Olympic Football Tournament Rio 2016 - Nigeria |publisher=FIFA}}</ref>
In August 2017 Iwobi pulled out of Nigeria's squad for that month's World Cup qualifiers due to injury.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41068525 |title=Iwobi ruled out of Nigeria's World Cup qualifiers against Cameroon |date=27 August 2017 |accessdate=31 August 2017 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> On 7 October 2017, Iwobi scored for Nigeria in a 1–0 win over Zambia to secure the Super Eagles a spot in the 2018 FIFA World Cup in Russia.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://punchng.com/iwobi-sends-nigeria-to-russia-2018/ |title=Iwobi sends Nigeria to Russia 2018 }}</ref>
He was named in Nigeria's 23-man squad for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] in Russia.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44346451|title=World Cup 2018: Arsenal's Iwobi in Nigeria's 23-man squad|date=3 June 2018|publisher=|via=www.bbc.co.uk}}</ref> He said that the team needed to learn from its performance after going out in the group stages.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44888104|title=Alex Iwobi: Nigeria must learn from 2018 World Cup|date=19 July 2018|publisher=|via=www.bbc.co.uk}}</ref>
==Controversy== In January 2018 a video allegedly showing Iwobi at a late-night party 36 hours before a match was released.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42617708|title=Alex Iwobi: Arsenal forward faces fine over pre-match party claims|date=5 May 2018|accessdate=1 February 2019|publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref>
In January 2019, Iwobi was the subject of alleged racism from Indian actress [[Esha Gupta]], an Arsenal ambassador.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-47042681|title=Esha Gupta: Has Instagram exposed everyday racism in India?|date=1 February 2019|accessdate=1 February 2019|publisher=BBC News}}</ref>

==Honours== '''Arsenal''' *[[FA Cup]]: [[2016–17 FA Cup|2016–17]]<ref name=FACup>{{cite news |last1=Dede |first1=Steve |title=Arsenal star is an FA Cup winner |url=http://pulse.ng/sports/football/alex-iwobi-wins-fa-cup-title-with-arsenal-id6746129.html |accessdate=29 May 2017 |website=pulse.ng |date=28 May 2017}}</ref> *[[FA Community Shield]]: [[2015 FA Community Shield|2015]], [[2017 FA Community Shield|2017]]<ref name=CS />
'''England U16''' *[[Victory Shield]]: 2011<ref name=Trophy>{{cite news |url=http://www.heraldscotland.com/sport/13040755.Victory_Shield__Scotland_U16_2_England_U16_4/ |title=Victory Shield: Scotland U16 2 England U16 4 |newspaper=The Herald |location=Glasgow}}</ref>
'''Individual''' *[[CAF Awards#CAF Youth Player of the Year|CAF Youth Player of the Year]]: 2016<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.africanews.com/2017/01/05/live-african-football-lovers-await-top-continental-honours-hosted-in-nigeria/ |title=[LIVE] Algerian Riyad Mahrez is 2016 African Player of the Year |last=AfricaNews |date=7 January 2017 |website=Africanews |accessdate=7 January 2017}}</ref> *[[CAF Team of the Year]]: 2016 (as a substitute)<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cafonline.com/en-US/NewsCenter/News/NewsDetails?id=JjXA1yebDNx8I52tgKCOlg%3d%3d |title=CAF – CAF Awards – Previous Editions – 2016 |publisher=CAFOnline |accessdate=7 January 2017}}</ref>

{{Use British English|date=February 2013}} {{Spanish name|Monreal|Eraso}} {{Use dmy dates|date=February 2013}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Nacho Monreal | image = 1 nacho monreal 2015.jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = Monreal warming up with [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] in 2015 | fullname = Ignacio Monreal Eraso | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1986|2|26|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Pamplona]], Spain | height = 1.78 m<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.dfb.de/datencenter/personen/nacho-monreal/spieler|title=Player profile: Nacho Monreal}}</ref> | position = [[Defender (association football)|Defender]] | currentclub = [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] | clubnumber = 18 | youthyears1 = | youthclubs1 = [[CD Pamplona|Pamplona]] | years1 = 2005–2006 | clubs1 = [[CA Osasuna B|Osasuna B]] | caps1 = 36 | goals1 = 3 | years2 = 2006–2011 | clubs2 = [[CA Osasuna|Osasuna]] | caps2 = 127 | goals2 = 3 | years3 = 2011–2013 | clubs3 = [[Málaga CF|Málaga]] | caps3 = 45 | goals3 = 1 | years4 = 2013– | clubs4 = [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] | caps4 = 177 | goals4 = 7 | nationalyears1 = 2004–2005 | nationalteam1 = [[Spain national under-19 football team|Spain U19]] | nationalcaps1 = 4 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2007–2009 | nationalteam2 = [[Spain national under-21 football team|Spain U21]] | nationalcaps2 = 9 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2009– | nationalteam3 = [[Spain national football team|Spain]] | nationalcaps3 = 22 | nationalgoals3 = 1 | club-update = 22:42, 2 March 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 3 June 2018 | medaltemplates = {{medalCountry|{{fb|ESP}}}} {{MedalCompetition|[[FIFA Confederations Cup]]}} {{medal|Runner-up|[[2013 FIFA Confederations Cup|2013 Brazil]]|}} }} '''Ignacio 'Nacho' Monreal Eraso''' ({{IPA-es|iɣˈnaθjo ˈnatʃo monreˈal eˈɾaso}}; born 26 February 1986) is a Spanish professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|left back]] or [[Defender (association football)#Centre-back|centre back]] for {{English football updater|Arsenal}} club [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] and the [[Spain national football team|Spain national team]].
He started playing with [[CA Osasuna|Osasuna]] in 2005, going on to appear in 144 official games over the course of five [[La Liga]] seasons. In 2011 he signed with [[Málaga CF|Málaga]] and, two years later, joined [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]], winning three [[FA Cup]] trophies with the latter club.
A full international since 2009, Monreal represented [[Spain national football team|Spain]] at the [[2013 FIFA Confederations Cup|2013 Confederations Cup]] and the [[2018 FIFA World Cup|2018 World Cup]].
==Club career== ===Osasuna=== [[File:Nacho Monreal.jpg|thumb|upright|left|Monreal in action for Osasuna in 2010]] A product of [[CA Osasuna]]'s youth ranks, Monreal was born in [[Pamplona]], and made his official debut for his hometown club in an away game against [[Valencia CF]] on 22 October 2006, in a 0–1 [[La Liga]] loss.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://espnfc.com/uk/en/report/203837/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=5739|title=Valencia 1–0 Osasuna|publisher=[[ESPN FC|ESPN Soccernet]]|date=22 October 2006|accessdate=28 October 2012|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140225195559/http://espnfc.com/uk/en/report/203837/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=5739|archivedate=25 February 2014}}</ref> He finished [[2006–07 La Liga|his first season]] with ten league appearances, adding two in [[2006–07 UEFA Champions League|the campaign]]'s [[UEFA Champions League]]; after the [[Navarre]]se's [[2006–07 UEFA Cup|relegation]] to the [[UEFA Europa League|UEFA Cup]], he appeared in four matches as the team reached the last four, being eliminated by fellow league side [[Sevilla FC]].
Monreal became first-choice in [[2007–08 La Liga|2007–08]], retaining that status in the subsequent seasons, with another youth product, [[César Azpilicueta]], being the undisputed starter in the other defensive wing.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/es/news/4194/editoriales/2013/02/02/3720629/monreal-y-azpilicueta-dos-amigos-que-vuelven-a-reunirse-en|title=Monreal y Azpilicueta, dos amigos que vuelven a reunirse en Londres|trans-title=Monreal and Azpilicueta, two friends that reunite in London|publisher=[[Goal (website)|Goal]]|first=Ben|last=Hayward|language=Spanish|date=2 February 2013|accessdate=24 August 2018}}</ref>
===Málaga=== On 10 June 2011, Monreal signed a five-year contract with [[Málaga CF]] on a [[Euro|€]]6 million transfer fee.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/2011/06/10/futbol/equipos/malaga/1307714444.html|title=Monreal jugará en el Málaga las próximas cinco temporadas|trans-title=Monreal will play with Málaga in next four seasons|newspaper=[[Marca (newspaper)|Marca]]|first=Jesús|last=Ballesteros|language=Spanish|date=10 June 2011|accessdate=28 October 2012}}</ref> In [[2011–12 La Liga|his first season]] he initially battled for first-choice status with [[Eliseu]], but ended up only missing seven games as the club finished fourth and [[2012–13 UEFA Champions League|qualified for the Champions League]] for the first time.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.malagahoy.es/deportes/Eliseu-Monreal-punales_0_674332858.html|title=Eliseu y Monreal, dos puñales menos|trans-title=Eliseu and Monreal, two daggers less|newspaper=Málaga Hoy|language=Spanish|date=26 February 2013|accessdate=20 January 2018}}</ref>
Monreal scored his only goal for the [[Andalusia]]ns on 27 January 2013, in a 3–2 away win against [[RCD Mallorca]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://espnfc.com/uk/en/report/348320/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=5739|title=Mallorca stung by 10-man Malaga|publisher=ESPN FC|date=27 January 2013|accessdate=1 February 2013|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130131051349/http://espnfc.com/uk/en/report/348320/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=5739|archivedate=31 January 2013}}</ref>
===Arsenal=== [[File:Nacho Monreal and Florian Thauvin.jpg|thumb|Monreal marking [[Florian Thauvin]] during a Champions League match against [[Olympique de Marseille|Marseille]] in November 2013]] On 31 January 2013, Monreal joined English side [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] on a long-term contract. He was given the number 17 shirt.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/nacho-monreal-agrees-to-join-arsenal|title=Nacho Monreal agrees to join Arsenal|publisher=Arsenal F.C|date=31 January 2013|accessdate=1 February 2013}}</ref> The fee was undisclosed, but was believed by ''[[Sky Sports]]'' to be around [[Pound sterling|£]]8.5 million.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11670/8459528/Arsenal-sign-Spain-internation-left-back-Nacho-Monreal-from-Malaga|title=Arsenal sign Spain international left-back Nacho Monreal from Malaga|publisher=Sky Sports|date=1 February 2013|accessdate=24 August 2018}}</ref> He made his [[Premier League]] debut against [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]] two days later in a 1–0 home win.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en-ie/news/3941/england/2013/02/02/3721101/team-news-monreal-handed-start-on-arsenal-debut-against|title=Team news: Monreal handed start on Arsenal debut against Stoke City|publisher=Goal|date=2 February 2013|accessdate=2 February 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21209193|title=Arsenal 1–0 Stoke|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|first=Neil|last=Johnston|date=2 February 2013|accessdate=2 February 2013}}</ref>
On 23 February 2013, Monreal provided the [[Assist (football)|assist]] for fellow countryman [[Santi Cazorla]] to score the winner in a 2–1 victory over [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21482693|title=Arsenal 2–1 Aston Villa|publisher=BBC Sport|first=Mandeep|last=Sanghera|date=23 February 2013|accessdate=24 February 2013}}</ref> He scored his first goal for the Gunners on 16 March, opening the scoring in a 2–0 win at [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21724187|title=Swansea 0–2 Arsenal|publisher=BBC Sport|last=Williams|first=Aled|date=16 March 2013|accessdate=23 March 2013}}</ref>
Monreal returned from injury<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/team-news-gibbs-sagna-monreal-the-ox|title=Team news: Gibbs, Sagna, Monreal, the Ox|publisher=Arsenal F.C.|date=20 August 2013|accessdate=23 August 2013}}</ref> on 21 August 2013 to feature in Arsenal's 3–0 win at [[Fenerbahçe S.K. (football)|Fenerbahçe SK]] in the [[2013–14 UEFA Champions League|Champions League group stage play-off]], playing the last three minutes in the place of [[Theo Walcott]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.arsenal.com/match/report/1314/post/first-team/fenerbahce-0-3-arsenal-match-report|title=Fenerbahçe 0–3 Arsenal|publisher=Arsenal F.C.|date=21 August 2013|accessdate=23 August 2013}}</ref> On 26 September, he scored the deciding penalty in a [[Penalty shoot-out (association football)|shootout]] against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] to send his team into [[2013–14 Football League Cup|the fourth round]] of the [[EFL Cup|League Cup]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/301230/report|title=Capital One Cup third round: Arsenal win penalty shootout after 1–1 draw with WBA|publisher=[[Sky Sports]]|date=25 September 2013|accessdate=29 May 2014}}</ref>
Upon the arrival of [[Alexis Sánchez]] in the 2014 off-season, Monreal took the vacant number 18 previously worn by [[Sébastien Squillaci]]. On 23 August, he assisted [[Olivier Giroud]]'s late equalizer in a 2–2 draw against [[Everton F.C.|Everton]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/aug/23/everton-arsenal-premier-league-match-report|title=Olivier Giroud rescues a point after Arsenal show backbone at Everton|newspaper=[[The Observer]]|first=Paul|last=Wilson|date=23 August 2014|accessdate=24 August 2018}}</ref> Additionally, an injury crisis in the squad saw him being deployed in an unfamiliar [[Defender (association football)#Centre-back|central defender]] role in a string of games, after [[Laurent Koscielny]] was put out of action due to an [[Achilles tendon]] injury.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/541323/Arsenal-Arsene-Wenger-Nacho-Monreal-centre-back-football-news|title=Arsene Wenger rules out move for centre-back... says he's happy with Nacho Monreal|newspaper=[[Daily Express]]|first=Simon|last=Yeend|date=29 November 2013|accessdate=14 January 2015}}</ref>
On 9 March 2015, Monreal scored the opening goal in a 2–1 win over [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] at [[Old Trafford]] that [[2014–15 FA Cup#Sixth Round Proper|put Arsenal through]] to the semi-finals of the [[FA Cup]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/31689011|title=Manchester United 1–2 Arsenal|publisher=BBC Sport|last1=McNulty|first1=Phil|date=9 March 2015|accessdate=10 March 2015}}</ref> He played the full 90 minutes in [[2015 FA Cup Final|the final]], a 4–0 defeat of Aston Villa at [[Wembley Stadium]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/32856754|title=Arsenal 4–0 Aston Villa|publisher=BBC Sport|last1=McNulty|first1=Phil|date=30 May 2015|accessdate=30 May 2015}}</ref>
On 19 January 2016, Monreal signed a new long-term contract with Arsenal.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/20160118/monreal-signs-new-long-term-contract|title=Monreal signs new long-term contract|publisher=Arsenal F.C.|first=Max|last=Jones|date=19 January 2016|accessdate=24 August 2018}}</ref> On 23 April 2017, he scored the vital equalizer as his team came from behind to defeat [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] in the [[2016–17 FA Cup|FA Cup semi-final]] at Wembley.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/live/2017/apr/23/arsenal-v-manchester-city-fa-cup-semi-final-live|title=Arsenal 2–1 Manchester City: FA Cup semi-final – as it happened|newspaper=[[The Guardian]]|first=Jacob|last=Steinberg|date=23 April 2017|accessdate=1 May 2017}}</ref>
On 6 November 2017, after good performances on the left side of a three-man defence,<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fourfourtwo.com/features/premier-league-5-big-talking-points-arsenal-4-3-leicester|title=Premier League: 5 big talking points from Arsenal 4–3 Leicester|publisher=[[FourFourTwo]]|first=Joe|last=Brewin|date=11 August 2017|accessdate=22 November 2017}}</ref> Monreal won the [[Professional Footballers' Association]] Player of the Month award for October of that year.<ref name="PFA">{{cite web|url=https://www.thepfa.com/news/2017/11/6/pfa-premier-league-fans-player-of-the-month-nacho-monreal|title=Nacho Monreal wins October's PFA Bristol Street Motors Fans' Player of the Month|publisher=[[Professional Footballers' Association]]|date=6 November 2017|accessdate=22 November 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171201044001/https://www.thepfa.com/news/2017/11/6/pfa-premier-league-fans-player-of-the-month-nacho-monreal|archivedate=1 December 2017}}</ref> The following 20 January, he netted once and made two assists before retiring injured 30 minutes into an eventual 4–1 home win against [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/club/arsenal/359/blog/post/3354818/nacho-monreal-creative-cameo-sets-up-emphatic-arsenal-win-vs-crystal-palace|title=Monreal's creative cameo sets up emphatic Arsenal win vs. Palace|publisher=ESPN FC|first=Andrew|last=Mangan|date=20 January 2018|accessdate=20 January 2018}}</ref>
==International career== [[File:Spain - Chile - 10-09-2013 - Geneva - Eduardo Vargas, Ignacio Monreal and Andres Iniesta.jpg|thumb|left|Monreal taking on [[Chile national football team|Chile]]'s [[Eduardo Vargas]] in a 2013 friendly]] In 2007, Monreal earned his first call for the [[Spain national under-21 football team|Spain under-21 team]]. He started all their matches in the [[2009 UEFA European Under-21 Championship|2009 UEFA European Championship]], in an eventual group stage exit.
On 6 August 2009, Monreal was selected to the [[Spain national football team|senior side]] for the first time, for an [[exhibition game]] with [[Macedonia national football team|Macedonia]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.as.com/futbol/articulo/monreal-oportunidad-algo-magico/20090806dasdasftb_30/Tes|title=Monreal: "Esta oportunidad es algo mágico para mí"|trans-title=Monreal: "This is a magical opportunity for me"|newspaper=[[Diario AS]]|language=Spanish|date=6 August 2009|accessdate=28 October 2012}}</ref> He played the last 15 minutes for [[Joan Capdevila]] in a 3–2 away success;<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.europapress.es/deportes/futbol-00162/noticia-futbol-seleccion-cronica-macedonia-espana-20090812233357.html|title=Crónica del Macedonia-España: 2–3.|trans-title=Macedonia-Spain match report: 2–3.|publisher=[[Europa Press (news agency)|Europa Press]]|language=Spanish|date=12 August 2009|accessdate=15 April 2014}}</ref> on 7 September 2010, in the nation's second game after they won the [[2010 FIFA World Cup]] in [[South Africa]], he played the entire 1–4 friendly loss to [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.europapress.es/deportes/futbol-00162/noticia-futbol-seleccion-cronica-argentina-espana-20100908000609.html|title=Crónica del Argentina – España, 4–1|trans-title=Argentina – Spain match report, 4–1|publisher=Europa Press|language=Spanish|date=8 September 2010|accessdate=15 April 2014}}</ref>
Monreal was a member of the Spanish squad which reached the final of the [[2013 FIFA Confederations Cup]] in Brazil, although he was second-choice left back behind [[FC Barcelona]]'s [[Jordi Alba]]. He started in the last two group games, beginning with a 10–0 win over [[Tahiti national football team|Tahiti]] at the [[Maracanã Stadium|Maracanã]] in which he set up a [[David Villa]] goal.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/22896367|title=Spain 10–0 Tahiti|publisher=BBC Sport|last1=Magowan|first1=Alistair|date=20 June 2013|accessdate=19 January 2015}}</ref>
Monreal scored his first goal for Spain on 12 November 2016, contributing to a 4–0 defeat of Macedonia for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification (UEFA)|2018 World Cup qualifiers]] in [[Granada]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/en/football/spanish-football/2016/11/12/58278dc046163f296f8b45b2.html|title=Spain march past Macedonia|newspaper=Marca|first=Arch|last=Bell|location=Madrid|date=12 November 2016|accessdate=24 August 2018}}</ref> He was then selected by manager [[Julen Lopetegui]] for the finals in Russia.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/morata-misses-out-on-spain-world-cup-squad/1ub1qz7jod09i1lfvdcy84ea2l|title=Morata misses out on Spain's 23-man World Cup squad|publisher=Goal|first=Tom|last=Maston|date=21 May 2018|accessdate=21 May 2018}}</ref>
