{{distinguish|text=the Australian rules footballer, [[Callum Chambers]]}} {{EngvarB|date=December 2018}} {{Use dmy dates|date=December 2018}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Calum Chambers | image = Calum Chambers cropped.jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = Chambers after winning the [[2014 FA Community Shield]] with [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] | fullname = Calum Chambers{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=2 February 2018 |accessdate=10 February 2018}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1995|1|20|df=y}}{{Hugman|26074|accessdate=1 April 2016}} | birth_place = [[Petersfield]], England | height = {{convert|1.82|m|order=flip}}{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/players/4620/Calum-Chambers/overview |title=Calum Chambers: Overview |publisher=Premier League |accessdate=18 December 2017}} | position = [[Defender (association football)|Defender]] | currentclub = [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]]
(on loan from [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]]) | clubnumber = 5 | youthyears1 = 2002–2012 | youthclubs1 = [[Southampton F.C. Academy|Southampton]] | years1 = 2012–2014 | clubs1 = [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] | caps1 = 22 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2014– | clubs2 = [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] | caps2 = 48 | goals2 = 2 | years3 = 2016–2017 | clubs3 = → [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] (loan) | caps3 = 24 | goals3 = 1 | years4 = 2018– | clubs4 = → [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] (loan) | caps4 = 19 | goals4 = 1 | nationalyears1 = 2012 | nationalteam1 = [[England national under-17 football team|England U17]] | nationalcaps1 = 6 | nationalgoals1 = 3 | nationalyears2 = 2012–2014 | nationalteam2 = [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]] | nationalcaps2 = 18 | nationalgoals2 = 2 | nationalyears3 = 2015–2017 | nationalteam3 = [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] | nationalcaps3 = 22 | nationalgoals3 = 0 | nationalyears4 = 2014– | nationalteam4 = [[England national football team|England]] | nationalcaps4 = 3 | nationalgoals4 = 0 | club-update = 08:44, 10 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 12:25, 30 January 2019 (UTC) }} '''Calum Chambers''' (born 20 January 1995) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)|defender]] for [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]], on [[Loan (sports)|loan]] from fellow {{English football updater|Arsenal}} club [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]], and the [[England national football team|England national team]]. Originally a member of [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]]'s [[Southampton F.C. Academy|academy system]], Chambers was promoted to the first team at the beginning of the [[2012–13 Southampton F.C. season|2012–13]] campaign. After two seasons with the club, he moved to fellow Premier League club Arsenal. Chambers made his senior international debut for the [[England national football team|English national team]] in 2014. ==Club career== ===Southampton=== Born in [[Petersfield]], Hampshire, Chambers joined [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] at the age of seven.{{cite news |url=http://metro.co.uk/2014/07/14/who-is-arsenal-target-calum-chambers-4798262/ |title=Who is Arsenal target Calum Chambers? |author=James Phillips |newspaper=Metro |location=London |date=14 July 2014 |accessdate=3 August 2014}} He went through the ranks at the club and at the beginning of the [[2012–13 Southampton F.C. season|2012–13 season]], Chambers was revealed as one of four youth players to be promoted to the first-team.{{cite web |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/article/numbers-up-for-saints-318707.aspx |title=Numbers up for Saints |publisher=Southampton F.C. |date=17 August 2012 |accessdate=29 August 2012}} During the pre-season period he made a number of appearances for the team, playing in the Memorial Cup against [[R.S.C. Anderlecht|Anderlecht]],{{cite web |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/article/memorial-cup-report-237234.aspx?pageView=full#anchored |title=Memorial Cup − Report |publisher=Southampton F.C. |date=14 July 2012 |accessdate=29 August 2012}} coming on as a second-half substitute in the matches against [[Thonon Évian Savoie F.C.|Évian Thonon Gaillard]] and [[Étoile Carouge FC|Étoile Carouge]],{{cite web |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/article/evian-tg-0-1-saints-report-291272.aspx?pageView=full#anchored |title=Évian TG 0–1 Saints − Report |publisher=Southampton F.C. |date=21 July 2012 |accessdate=29 August 2012}}{{cite web |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/article/etoile-carouge-1-4-saints-report-291269.aspx?pageView=full#anchored |title=Etoile Carouge 1–4 Saints − Report |publisher=Southampton F.C. |date=18 July 2012 |accessdate=29 August 2012}} and making late appearances against [[AFC Ajax|Ajax]] and [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]].{{cite web |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/article/saints-0-1-ajax-report-275919.aspx?pageView=full#anchored |title=Saints 0–1 Ajax − Report |publisher=Southampton F.C. |date=28 July 2012 |accessdate=29 August 2012}}{{cite web |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/article/saints-2-0-wolves-report-292113.aspx?pageView=full#anchored |title=Saints 2–0 Wolves − Report |publisher=Southampton F.C. |date=4 August 2012 |accessdate=29 August 2012}} Chambers made his full debut for Southampton on 28 August 2012 in a 4–1 win over [[Stevenage F.C.|Stevenage]] in the second round of the [[2012–13 Football League Cup|League Cup]], coming on as an 84th-minute substitute for [[Dean Hammond]] and providing the assist for the final goal of the match by [[Ben Reeves]].{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/19340365 |title=Stevenage 1–4 Southampton |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 August 2012 |accessdate=11 April 2017}} On 31 July 2013, Chambers signed a new four-year contract with Southampton.{{cite web |title=Chambers commits to Saints |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/article/chambers-commits-to-saints-958138.aspx |publisher=Southampton F.C. |accessdate=1 August 2013 |date=31 July 2013}} He made his first-team league debut on 17 August 2013, when he played the full 90 minutes at right-back of the opening match of the [[2013–14 Premier League|2013–14]] season in a 1–0 win against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]].{{cite news |first=Neil |last=Johnston |title=West Brom 0–1 Southampton |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/23644676 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 August 2013 |accessdate=11 April 2017}} He made a total of 25 appearances for Southampton in all competitions, of which 22 were in the league, before leaving in the summer of 2014. ===Arsenal=== [[File:Calum ChambersOct2014.JPG|thumb|upright|Chambers (right) playing for [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] in 2014]] On 28 July 2014, it was announced that he had signed for [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] on a long-term contract for an undisclosed fee, rising to a potential £16 million with performance-related add-ons.{{cite web |title=Calum Chambers signs for Arsenal |url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/20140728/calum-chambers-completes-move-to-arsenal |publisher=Arsenal F.C. |accessdate=28 July 2014 |date=28 July 2014}}{{cite news |title=Arsenal sign Calum Chambers from Southampton in deal rising to £16m |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/jul/28/arsenal-sign-calum-chambers-southampton |accessdate=28 July 2014 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=28 July 2014}} Chambers made his first appearance for Arsenal on 2 August 2014, starting in central defence in a 5–1 win against [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]] in the pre-season [[Emirates Cup]] tournament.{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/aug/02/arsenal-benfica-emirates-cup-match-report |title=Arsenal's Yaya Sanogo hits four in friendly rout of Benfica |date=2 August 2014 |accessdate=3 August 2014 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London}} On 10 August, Chambers made his competitive debut for Arsenal, playing the full 90 minutes of the [[2014 FA Community Shield]] against Premier League champions [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] at [[Wembley Stadium]]. Playing at centre back instead of his usual right back position to cover for [[Per Mertesacker]], the BBC wrote on his performance against the Premier League champions that "his mature performance defied his youthful years".{{cite news |first=Mandeep |last=Sanghera |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/28647186 |title=Arsenal 3–0 Manchester City |publisher=BBC Sport |date=10 August 2014 |accessdate=11 April 2017}} On 16 August, Chambers played his first [[Premier League]] match for Arsenal in a 2–1 win against [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]].{{cite news |first=Saj |last=Chowdhury |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/28718788 |title=Arsenal 2–1 Crystal Palace |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 August 2014 |accessdate=11 April 2017}} He played the first European fixture of his career three days later, a goalless draw in the first leg of Arsenal's Champions League play-off away to [[Beşiktaş J.K.|Beşiktaş]].{{cite news |first=Chris |last=Bevan |title=Besiktas 0–0 Arsenal |url=http://bbc.co.uk/sport/football/28784340 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=19 August 2014 |accessdate=11 April 2017}} Following a strong start to the season, Chambers was nominated for the [[Golden Boy (award)|Golden Boy Award 2014]], alongside international teammates [[Raheem Sterling]], [[Luke Shaw]] and [[John Stones]].{{cite news |last=Richards |first=Alex |title=England pair Raheem Sterling and Calum Chambers join Adnan Januzaj in Golden Boy award nominations |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/england-pair-raheem-sterling-calum-4523237 |accessdate=28 October 2014 |newspaper=Daily Mirror |location=London |date=28 October 2014}} He scored the first senior goal of his career and registered an assist on 1 November as Arsenal beat [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] 3–0 in a Premier League home victory.{{cite news |last=Gheerbrant |first=James |title=Arsenal 3–0 Burnley |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/29768015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=1 November 2014 |accessdate=11 April 2017}} He was sent off for the first time in his career on 6 December, as Arsenal lost 3–2 at [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]].{{cite news |last=Chowdhury |first=Saj |title=Stoke City 3–2 Arsenal |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/30257121 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=6 December 2014 |accessdate=11 April 2017}} Chambers' appearances in the second half of the season were limited by the emergence of [[Héctor Bellerín]] at right-back.{{cite news |last=Fernandez-Abascal |first=Eduardo |title=Héctor Bellerín will 'fight' Mathieu Debuchy for Arsenal right-back slot after breakthrough season |url=http://www.ibtimes.co.uk/hector-bellerin-will-fight-mathieu-debuchy-arsenal-right-back-slot-after-breakthrough-season-1503876 |accessdate=2 June 2015 |work=International Business Times |date=1 June 2015}} He was not in Arsenal's matchday squad when they won the [[2015 FA Cup Final]] 4–0 against [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] at Wembley Stadium on 30 May.{{cite news |last=McNulty |first=Phil |title=Arsenal 4–0 Aston Villa |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/32856754 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=30 May 2015 |accessdate=11 April 2017}} Chambers began the [[2016–17 Premier League]] in the starting line-up for Arsenal and scored in a 3–4 loss against [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] in the first match of the season.{{cite news |last=Chowdhury |first=Saj |title=Arsenal 3–4 Liverpool |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37001073 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=14 August 2016 |accessdate=11 April 2017}} ===Middlesbrough (loan)=== [[File:Calum Chambers*.jpg|thumb|upright|Chambers playing for [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] in 2016]] On 30 August 2016, he joined fellow Premier League team [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] on a season-long [[Loan (sports)|loan]].{{cite news |title=Calum Chambers: Middlesbrough sign Arsenal defender on loan |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37218210 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=30 August 2016 |accessdate=19 July 2017}} ===Return to Arsenal=== Chambers made his first appearance of the [[2017–18 Arsenal F.C. season|2017–18 season]] in the 1–0 win over [[Doncaster Rovers F.C.|Doncaster Rovers]] in the [[EFL Cup]], but was substituted at half time due to injury.{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/arsenal-vs-doncaster/384183 |title=Arsenal 1–0 Doncaster |publisher=Sky Sports |date=21 September 2017 |accessdate=4 October 2017}} On 3 July 2018, Chambers signed a new long-term contract with Arsenal.{{cite web |title=Calum Chambers signs contract extension |url=https://www.arsenal.com/news/calum-chambers-signs-contract-extension |publisher=Arsenal F.C. |accessdate=3 July 2018 |date=3 July 2018}} ===Fulham (loan)=== On 7 August 2018, Chambers signed with fellow Premier League side [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] on a season long loan.{{cite web |title=Calum Chambers joins Fulham on loan |url=https://www.arsenal.com/news/calum-chambers-joins-fulham-loan |accessdate=7 August 2018 |date=7 August 2018}} ==International career== Chambers made his debut for the [[England national under-17 football team|England under-17 team]] on 2 February against [[Portugal national under-17 football team|Portugal]].{{cite web |url=http://www.thefa.com/England/All-Teams/Players/C/calum-chambers |title=Calum Chambers |publisher=The Football Association |accessdate=29 August 2012}} In March, he played in all three of the team's matches in the [[2012 UEFA European Under-17 Championship elite round]], scoring their only goal of the tournament in a 1–0 win over [[Ukraine national under-17 football team|Ukraine]].{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/under17/season=2012/teams/player=250047102/index.html |title=Calum Chambers |publisher=UEFA |accessdate=29 August 2012}} On 26 September 2012, Chambers made the step up to the [[England national under-19 football team|England under-19 team]], playing the full 90 minutes in the team's 3–0 win over the [[Estonia national youth football team#Estonia National Under-19 Squad|Estonia under-19 team]] in the [[2013 UEFA European Under-19 Championship qualification|2013 UEFA European Under-19 Championship qualifying round]].{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/under19/season=2013/matches/round=2000318/match=2009284/index.html |title=England-Estonia |publisher=UEFA |accessdate=27 September 2012}} On 28 September Chambers came on as a second-half substitute in the England under-19 team's match against the [[Faroe Islands national under-19 football team|Faroe Islands]], which England won 6–0, scoring the final goal of the match in the 84th minute.{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/under19/season=2013/matches/round=2000318/match=2009308/index.html |title=Faroe Islands-England |publisher=UEFA |accessdate=28 September 2012}} He scored his second under-19 international goal in a 1–0 victory against [[Turkey national under-19 football team|Turkey]] on 21 March 2013.{{cite web |last=Veevers |first=Nichols |title=Chambers clinches win as England U19s head off to elite round on back of 1–0 win over Turkey |url=http://www.thefa.com/England/mens-u19s/News/2013/turkey-report-210313 |publisher=The Football Association |accessdate=22 March 2013 |date=21 March 2013}} On 28 August 2014, he was named in the senior England squad for the first time, ahead of a friendly against [[Norway national football team|Norway]] and a [[UEFA Euro 2016 qualifying|Euro 2016 qualification match]] against [[Switzerland national football team|Switzerland]] in September.{{cite web |title=Roy calls up four new faces for Norway and Switzerland |url=http://www.thefa.com/news/england/2014/aug/norway-switzerland-squad-announcement-rose-colback-delph-chambers |accessdate=28 August 2014 |publisher=The Football Association |date=28 August 2014}} He made his debut against Norway on 3 September, coming on for the last 9 minutes in place of John Stones as England won 1–0 at Wembley Stadium.{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=England 1–0 Norway |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/28947896 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=3 September 2014 |accessdate=11 April 2017}} Initially chosen for the [[England national under-21 football team|under-21 team]], Chambers moved into the senior squad ahead of European qualifiers against [[San Marino national football team|San Marino]] and [[Estonia national football team|Estonia]] in October 2014 due to an injury to Stones.{{cite news |title=England: John Stones replaced by Calum Chambers in squad |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/29497934 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=5 October 2014 |accessdate=11 April 2017}} He was given his first start on his second cap, against San Marino on 9 October at Wembley Stadium, playing at right back ahead of his former Southampton teammate [[Nathaniel Clyne]].{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=England 5–0 San Marino |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/29454223 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=9 October 2014 |accessdate=11 April 2017}} Chambers then dropped back down to the under-21 team in March 2015, and made his debut in a 1–0 win against [[Czech Republic national under-21 football team|Czech Republic]] in Prague.{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/mar/27/czech-republic-england-under-21s-friendly-match-report |title=Tom Carroll scores winner for England Under-21s against Czech Republic |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=27 March 2015 |accessdate=28 March 2015}} He was part of the team that won the [[2016 Toulon Tournament]], their first such win for 22 years.{{cite news |title=England Under-21s win Toulon Tournament for first time in 22 years |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36410296 |accessdate=29 May 2016 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=29 May 2016}} On 5 June 2017, Chambers was called up to England's squad for the [[2017 UEFA European Under-21 Championship]] to be held in Poland.{{cite web |url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/20170605/england-call-for-chambers-and-holding |title=England call for Chambers and Holding |publisher=Arsenal F.C. |date=5 June 2017 |accessdate=5 June 2017}} Chambers went on to play in the semi-final of the tournament where England went out on penalties to Germany.{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/under21/season=2017/matches/round=2000646/match=2022540/index.html |title=England 2–2 Germany: Germany win 4–3 on penalties |publisher=UEFA}} ==Career statistics== ===Club=== {{Use dmy dates|date=January 2013}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Emiliano Martínez | image = Damian Martinez.jpg | caption = Martínez with Arsenal in 2015 | fullname = Damián Emiliano Martínez{{cite web |title=E. (on loan from [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]]) | clubnumber = 26 | youthyears1 = 2008–2010 | youthclubs1 = [[Club Atlético Independiente|Independiente]] | youthyears2 = 2010–2012 | youthclubs2 = [[Arsenal F.C. Academy|Arsenal]] | years1 = 2012– | clubs1 = [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] | caps1 = 6 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2012 | clubs2 = → [[Oxford United F.C.|Oxford United]] (loan) | caps2 = 1 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2013–2014 | clubs3 = → [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]] (loan) | caps3 = 11 | goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2015 | clubs4 = → [[Rotherham United F.C.|Rotherham United]] (loan) | caps4 = 8 | goals4 = 0 | years5 = 2015–2016 | clubs5 = → [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] (loan) | caps5 = 13 | goals5 = 0 | years6 = 2017–2018 | clubs6 = → [[Getafe CF|Getafe]] (loan) | caps6 = 3 | goals6 = 0 | years7 = 2019 | clubs7 = → [[Reading F.C.|Reading]] (loan) | caps7 = 7 | goals7 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2009 | nationalteam1 = [[Argentina national under-17 football team|Argentina U17]] | nationalcaps1 = 2 |nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2009–2011 | nationalteam2 = [[Argentina national under-20 football team|Argentina U20]] | nationalcaps2 = 5 |nationalgoals2 = 0 | club-update = 00:23, 3 March 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = }} '''Damián Emiliano Martínez''' ({{IPA-es|daˈmjan emiˈljano ˈemi maɾˈtines|am}}, born 2 September 1992 in [[Mar Del Plata]]) is an Argentine professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Goalkeeper (association football)|goalkeeper]] for English club [[Reading F.C.|Reading]], [[loan (sports)|on loan]] from [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]]. ==Club career== [[File:1 Emiliano Martínez 2018.jpg|thumb|left|upright|Martínez in 2018 before an [[International Champions Cup]] game]] He made his début in the [[The Football League|English Football League]] on emergency loan to [[Oxford United F.C.|Oxford United]] in their final game of the season against [[Port Vale F.C.|Port Vale]] in [[Football League Two|League Two]] on 5 May 2012;{{cite web |url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/reserves-news/martinez-joins-oxford-on-emergency-loan |title=Martinez joins Oxford on emergency loan |publisher=Arsenal FC |date=4 May 2012 |accessdate=7 May 2012|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120507040156/http://www.arsenal.com/news/reserves-news/martinez-joins-oxford-on-emergency-loan|archive-date=7 May 2012|dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all}} Port Vale won 3–0.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17878372 |title=Port Vale 3 Oxford Utd 0 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=5 May 2012 |accessdate=7 May 2012}}{{cite web |url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/reserves-news/43298/loan-watch- |title=Loan Watch: Wellington scores for Alcoyano |publisher=Arsenal FC |accessdate=7 May 2012|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120510060549/http://www.arsenal.com/news/reserves-news/43298/loan-watch-|archive-date=10 May 2012|dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all}} Martinez has been named on the Arsenal substitute bench for their fixtures away at [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]] on 26 August 2012 and against [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] on 2 September 2012 as [[Wojciech Szczęsny]] and [[Łukasz Fabiański]] were injured at the time and at Southampton on 1 January 2013. On 26 September 2012, he made his Arsenal début in a 3rd Round [[2012–13 Football League Cup|League Cup]] tie at home to [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]].{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19645217 |title=BBC Sport – Arsenal 6–1 Coventry |publisher=Bbc.co.uk |date=26 September 2012 |accessdate=16 January 2013}} He then made his second Arsenal appearance in the following round in a 7–5 win away at [[Reading F.C.|Reading]] in which Arsenal were 4–0 down.{{Soccerbase season|62458|2012|access-date=16 January 2013}} On 15 October 2013, Martínez transferred to [[Football League Championship|Championship]] side [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]] on an emergency 28-day loan agreement.{{cite web |url=http://www.swfc.co.uk/news/article/arsenal-talent-joins-owls-1114863.aspx? |title=Arsenal talent joins Owls |publisher=Sheffield Wednesday F.C. |date= |accessdate=15 October 2013}} On 14 November 2013 Arsenal announced that the loan agreement had been extended until 1 January 2014.{{cite web |url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/martinez-extends-loan-deal-at-wednesday |title=Martinez extends loan deal with Owls | News Archive | News |publisher=Arsenal.com |date=2013-11-14 |accessdate=2015-03-27}} Martínez made his debut for Wednesday on 23 November 2013 against Yorkshire rivals [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]]. The loan was extended to the end of the season soon after. Martínez was an unused substitute as Arsenal won the [[2014 FA Community Shield|Community Shield]] on 10 August 2014, with a 3–0 win over [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] at [[Wembley Stadium]].{{cite news |last1=Sanghera |first1=Mandeep |title=Arsenal 3–0 Man City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28647186 |accessdate=10 August 2014 |work=[[BBC Sport]] |date=10 August 2014}} He made his Arsenal debut in the [[UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] group stage match against [[R.S.C. Anderlecht]], which ended in a 2–1 win to Arsenal.{{cite web |last=Draper |first=Rob |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2803749/Anderlecht-1-2-Arsenal-PLAYER-RATINGS-Emiliano-Martinez-impresses-European-debut-Gunners-comeback-victory.html |title=Anderlecht 1–2 Arsenal PLAYER RATINGS: Emiliano Martinez impresses on European debut for Gunners in comeback victory | Daily Mail Online |publisher=Dailymail.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2015-03-27}} He then made his Premier League debut as a 2nd half substitute, replacing the injured [[Wojciech Szczęsny]] against [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] at the [[Emirates Stadium]].{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/news/2896/premier-league/2014/11/22/6395391/wilshere-szczesny-forced-out-of-manchester-united-clash-as |title=Wilshere & Szczesny forced out of Manchester United clash as injury strikes Arsenal |publisher=Goal.com |date=2014-11-22 |accessdate=2015-03-27}} Because of the injuries of [[Wojciech Szczęsny]] and [[David Ospina]], Martínez was made starting keeper against [[Borussia Dortmund]] on 26 November at the Emirates, keeping a clean sheet as Arsenal won 2–0.{{cite web |last=Chowdhury |first=Saj |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29363037 |title=BBC Sport – Arsenal 2–0 Borussia Dortmund |publisher=Bbc.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2015-03-27}} His "faultless" performance in the match led to him being named in that week's UEFA team of the week.{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/news/newsid=2188080.html |title=UEFA.com's team of the week – UEFA Champions League – News |publisher=UEFA.com |date=2014-11-27 |accessdate=2015-03-27}} He made his first Premier League start on 29 November against West Brom, which was followed by his second Premier League start against Southampton just four days later. He kept two clean sheets as Arsenal won both matches 1–0.{{cite web |last=Reddy |first=Luke |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30156733 |title=BBC Sport – West Bromwich Albion 0–1 Arsenal |publisher=Bbc.co.uk |date=2014-11-29 |accessdate=2015-03-27}}{{cite web |last=McNulty |first=Phil |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30204434 |title=BBC Sport – Arsenal 1–0 Southampton |publisher=Bbc.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2015-03-27}} On 20 March 2015, Martínez joined [[Football League Championship|Championship]] club [[Rotherham United F.C.|Rotherham United]] on an emergency loan until the end of the season.{{cite news |title=Emiliano Martinez and Lawrie Wilson join Rotherham on loan |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31985338 |accessdate=27 March 2015 |work=BBC Sport |date=20 March 2015}} He made his debut the following day against [[South Yorkshire]] rivals [[Sheffield Wednesday]], conceding two added-time goals in a 3–2 home defeat.{{cite news |title=Rotherham 2–3 Sheff Wed |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31882514 |accessdate=27 March 2015 |work=BBC Sport |date=21 March 2015}} On 2 August 2015, Martínez was an unused substitute as new signing [[Petr Čech]] played for Arsenal in the [[2015 FA Community Shield]], a 1–0 win over [[Arsenal F.C.–Chelsea F.C. rivalry|rivals]] [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]].{{cite news |last1=Cryer |first1=Andy |title=Arsenal 1–0 Chelsea |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33667216 |accessdate=2 August 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=2 August 2015}} On 11 August, he joined [[Football League Championship|Championship]] side [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] on a season-long loan.{{cite news |title=Martinez Deal Completed |url=http://www.wolves.co.uk/news/article/martinez-deal-completed-2610385.aspx |accessdate=11 August 2015 |publisher=Wolverhampton Wanderers |date=11 August 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151001084853/http://www.wolves.co.uk/news/article/martinez-deal-completed-2610385.aspx |archivedate=1 October 2015 |df=dmy-all}} On 5 April 2017, Martinez made his first league start of the 2016/17 season as Arsenal beat West Ham 3-0.{{cite web |url=https://www.thesun.co.uk/uncategorized/3270332/emiliano-martinez-with-3rd-clean-sheet-in-4-games-is-he-a-future-arsenal-no-1/ |title=Emiliano Martinez with 3rd clean sheet in 4 games – is he a future arsenal no 1? |website=The Sun.co.uk}} On 2 August 2017, he was loaned to [[La Liga]] side [[Getafe CF]] on a one-year deal.{{cite web |url=http://www.getafecf.com/Noticia/tabid/137/Article/4597/Emiliano-Martinez-cedido-al-Getafe.aspx |title=Emiliano Martínez cedido al Getafe|trans-title=Emiliano Martínez loaned to Getafe |publisher=Getafe CF |language=es |date=2 August 2017 |accessdate=2 August 2017}} On 23 January 2019, he was loaned to [[EFL Championship|Championship]] side [[Reading F.C.|Reading]] until the end of the season.https://www.arsenal.com/news/emi-martinez-joins-reading-loan He made his debut on 29 January against [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton]]. A few days later he won man of the match against [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]]. ==International career== He was called up to the [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]] senior squad to replace [[Óscar Ustari]] to face [[Nigeria national football team|Nigeria]] in June 2011.{{cite web |url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/reserves-news/martinez-called-up-to-full-argentina-squad |title=Martinez called up to full Argentina squad | News Archive | News |publisher=Arsenal.com |date=2011-06-02 |accessdate=2015-03-27 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150924051846/http://www.arsenal.com/news/reserves-news/martinez-called-up-to-full-argentina-squad |archivedate=24 September 2015 |df=dmy-all}} ==Personal life== Martinez is currently sponsored by [[Puma (brand)|Puma]].{{cite web |url=https://mobile.twitter.com/emimartinezz1/status/983719992616210432 |title=Delighted to have signed a new contract with @pumafootball |website=Twitter.com}} ==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 3 March 2019}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center" |+ Appearances and goals by club, season and League U-22]] (loan) |caps2 = 3 |goals2 = 0 |years3 = 2016– |clubs3 = [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] |caps3 = 0 |goals3 = 0 |years4 = 2016–2018 |clubs4 = → [[VfB Stuttgart]] (loan) |caps4 = 41 |goals4 = 5 |years5 = 2017 |clubs5 = → [[VfB Stuttgart II]] (loan) |caps5 = 2 |goals5 = 1 |years6 = 2018– |clubs6 = → [[Hannover 96]] (loan) |caps6 = 6 |goals6 = 0 | nationalteam1 = [[Japan national under-23 football team|Japan U23]] | nationalyears1 = 2015– | nationalcaps1 = 18 | nationalgoals1 = 6 | nationalteam2 = [[Japan national football team|Japan]] | nationalyears2 = 2015– | nationalcaps2 = 17 | nationalgoals2 = 3 | club-update = 19:43, 9 December 2018 (UTC) | ntupdate = 14 November 2017 }} '''Takuma Asano''' ({{lang-ja|浅野 拓磨}} ''Asano Takuma''; born 10 November 1994) is a Japanese professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays for [[Hannover 96]] of the [[Bundesliga]], on loan from {{English football updater|Arsenal}} club [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]], and for the [[Japan national football team|Japan national team]]. ==Club career== === Sanfrecce Hiroshima === Asano joined [[Sanfrecce Hiroshima]] at the age of 18 in January 2013, and went on to win the [[J1 League]] in his inaugural season while making just one league appearance. The forward concluded his first year at the club by also lifting the [[Japanese Super Cup]] for the first time. He went on to win the cup once again in 2014 and 2015, while starting to break into the squad for the [[J1 League]]. He helped his side lift the J1 League for a second time in 2015, this time adding nine goals in 34 appearances. He was also named as the J-League's '[[J.League Rookie of the Year|Rookie of the Year]]'.{{Cite web|url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/20160702/arsenal-agree-deal-for-japan-forward|title=Arsenal agree deal for Japan forward|last=Group|first=Arsenal Media|website=www.arsenal.com|access-date=3 July 2016}} === Arsenal === {{wikinews|Arsenal signs Japanese Takuma; Chelsea signs Batshuayi}} On 3 July 2016, Asano was announced as [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]]'s second signing of the season, subject to a medical and international clearance.{{Cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11670/10332294/arsenal-to-sign-takuma-asano-from-japans-sanfrecce-hiroshima|title=Arsenal to sign Takuma Asano from Japan's Sanfrecce Hiroshima|last=Charles|first=Andy|date=3 July 2016|website=|publisher=Sky Sports|access-date=}} Manager [[Arsène Wenger|Arsene Wenger]] described him as "a talented young striker and very much one for the future".{{Cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/jul/03/arsenal-sign-takuma-asano-j-league-football-transfer-window|title=Arsenal sign Japanese striker Takuma Asano from Sanfrecce Hiroshima|date=3 July 2016|newspaper=The Guardian|access-date=3 July 2016}} However, Asano was refused a work permit to play in the [[Premier League]].{{cite web|url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/20160826/asano-loaned-to-stuttgart-|title=Asano loaned to Stuttgart|publisher=Arsenal FC|date=26 August 2016|access-date=26 August 2016}} ==== Loan to VfB Stuttgart ==== On 26 August 2016, Asano was loaned out to [[VfB Stuttgart]] until the end of the season with an option for a further year.{{cite web|url=http://www.vfb.de/en/vfb/latest/newsarchive/2016/329855-takuma-asano-signs-from-arsenal/|title=Takuma Asano kommt von Arsenal|publisher=[[VfB Stuttgart]]|date=26 August 2016|access-date=26 August 2016}} On 9 April 2017, Asano scored a brace in VfB Stuttgart's 2-0 derby win over Karlsruher SC to take his team to the top of the 2. Bundesliga table.{{cite web|url=https://www.vavel.com/en/international-football/germany-bundesliga/776040-vfb-stuttgart-2-0-karlsruher-sc-asano-brace-sends-swabians-top.html|title=VfB Stuttgart 2-0 Karlsruher SC|publisher=[[Vavel]]|date=9 April 2017|access-date=9 April 2017}} On 22 June 2017, the loan deal with Stuttgart was extended for another season.{{cite web|url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/20170622/asano-s-loan-at-stuttgart-is-extended|title=Asano's loan at Stuttgart is extended|website=www.arsenal.com}} ==== Loan to Hannover 96 ==== On 23 May 2018, Asano was loaned out again to another [[Bundesliga]] team for the season, [[Hannover 96]].{{Cite news |title=Asano to join Hannover 96 on loan|url=https://www.arsenal.com/news/asano-join-hannover-96-loan|publisher=Arsenal F.C.|date=23 May 2018|accessdate=23 May 2018}} == International career == On 7 May 2015, [[Japan national football team|Japan]]'s coach [[Vahid Halilhodžić]] called him for a two-days training camp.[http://www.nikkansports.com/soccer/japan/news/1473077.html 大久保嘉人ら28人日本代表候補合宿メンバー／一覧]. Nikkansports.com (7 May 2015). Retrieved on 2016-07-03. On 23 July 2015, he was called again for the upcoming [[2015 EAFF East Asian Cup]].[http://www.jfa.jp/national_team/news/00006836/ EAFF東アジアカップ2015（8/2～9＠中国／武漢） SAMURAI BLUE（日本代表）メンバー・スケジュール]. Japan Football Association (23 July 2015) Asano scored his first goal on 3 June 2016 in the [[Kirin Cup#Kirin Cup Soccer 2016|2016 Kirin Cup]] in a 7–2 win against [[Bulgaria national football team|Bulgaria]].{{cite news|url=http://www.sportal.co.nz/football/news/japan-7-bulgaria-2-kagawa-at-the-double-in-dominant-win-kirin-cup/q3w5c00habi19c97609wx163|title=Japan 7 Bulgaria 2: Kagawa at the double in dominant win|date=3 June 2016|website=Sportal|accessdate=3 June 2016}} Asano represented the [[Japan national under-23 football team|under-23 side]] at the [[2016 Summer Olympics]], where Japan was eliminated in the group stage. On 15 March 2018, [[Vahid Halilhodzic]] surprisingly left out Asano and [[Yosuke Ideguchi]] for the [[Japan national football team|Japan]] squad for friendly matches with [[Mali national football team|Mali]] and [[Ukraine national football team|Ukraine]] in preparation for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]], with Halilhodzic describing Asano & Ideguchi's lack of regular game time, he proclaimed ''It makes me sad that Asano and Ideguchi are not playing, They were the heroes of our qualifying game against [[Australia national football team|Australia]]. They haven’t been chosen this time, and if things continue the way they are, there is a chance that they won’t be chosen for the World Cup.”''{{cite news |title=Halilhodzic reveals roster for upcoming friendlies|url=https://www.japantimes.co.jp/sports/2018/03/15/soccer/halilhodzic-reveals-roster-upcoming-friendlies/#.WqqLBOjFLIU |newspaper=Japan TImes|date=15 March 2018|accessdate=15 March 2018}} In May 2018 he was named in Japan’s preliminary [[Japan national football team|squad]] for the [[2018 World Cup]] in [[Russia]].{{cite web|title= World Cup 2018: All the confirmed squads for this summer's finals in Russia|url= https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/440833652018}} However, he did not make the final 23.https://www.goal.com/en/amp/news/kento-misao-yosuke-ideguchi-takuma-asano-cut-japan-world-cup/1vx0o2pxmil9h1s2hb9k4emkec ==Club statistics== {{updated|match played 16 December 2017}} {{soccerway|takuma-asano/286104|accessdate=9 October 2017}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |+ Appearances and goals by club, season and competition |- !rowspan="2"|Club !rowspan="2"|Season !colspan="3"|League !colspan="2"|Cup !colspan="2"|League Cup !colspan="2"|Continental !colspan="2"|Other !colspan="2"|Total |- !Division!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals |- |rowspan="5"|[[Sanfrecce Hiroshima]] |[[2013 J.
